loans.name: Azamjon

texts.en: B. Azamjon has been a client of MicroInvest since 2008. He is applying for a loan with the intention of improving his livestock business. Mr. B. Azamjon raises his livestock himself and sells livestock for profit. With the money he earns, he has purchased more livestock in the neighboring Kyrgyzstan. He dreams of having a larger flock so he wants to build a big cowshed. Mr. B. Azamjon thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: to build a cowshed to house livestock

loans.name: Rithy Moeung's Group

texts.en:
This group which consists of four people is located in Sontouch village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Rithy M. is the group leader. She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and then re-sell later at a better price. This business is going well, so she wants to expand it and has asked for a loan to buy 1,000 kilograms of rice to keep in stock. Her husband, Mr. Chhoem Sarun, is a policeman who makes a small salary to support the family. Mrs. Rithy M. is 41 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are working as constructors while the others are attending the local school.

Mrs. Rithy M. will share this loan with the members of her group.

loans.use: To buy 1,000 kilograms of rice to keep in stock.

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Maimouna D. a 22 ans, est fiancée, et vit chez ses parents  dans le quartier Darsalam I de la préfecture de koutiala(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
Très tôt elle abandonna les études pour se consacrer aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat –vente des produits de beauté et diverses autres marchandises. Elle a appris le commerce auprès de sa  maman dépuis son jeune âge. Actuellement elle évolue à son propre compte y’a de cela 2 ans.  Elle est trés bien connue dans le secteur de la cosmétique.  Pour augmenter la taille de son activité et diversifier ses activités, elle décida d’intégrer l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il ya deux mois. Elle est à son 1er prêt en individuel.
Maimouna compte acheter, un important  stock des produits de beauté avec ce prêt.. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des commerçants grossistes de Koutiala et souvent à Bamako(capitale du Mali). Elle vend sur son étale sis au centre du marché de Koko dans la ville de koutiala à une clientèle  constituée essentiellement de femmes , au comptant et à crédit.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et préparer son mariage.
Dans ses perspectives, elle envisage d’agrandir son activité jusqu’à  ouvrir une boutique au marché de koko.
texts.en:
Maimouna D. is 22 years old, engaged to be married, and lives in the home of her parents in the Darsalam I district of Koutiala prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Very early on, she abandoned school to devote herself to income-generating work, notably buying and selling beauty products and various other goods. She learned commerce from her mom when she was young. And now, making it on her own for two years, she is very well known in the cosmetics sector. To expand her work and diversify her business, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso two months ago. She is on her first individual loan and plans to buy a sizable stock of beauty products with it. She gets her supplies from wholesale merchants of Koutiala and often in Bamako (capital of Mali). From her display at the Koko marketplace in the city of Koutiala, she makes her sales to customers composed essentially of women, cash or credit accepted. Maimouna intends to realize a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that she envisions using to repay the loan interest and to prepare for her marriage. With these prospects, she envisions expanding enough to open a shop at the Koko marketplace.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products for resale

loans.name: Choun

texts.en: Choun S., 36, lives with her husband and daughter in the Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, earning around $7 per day, while her husband has a business selling rubber and earns approximately $5 a day. Mrs. Choun would like to use this loan to purchase more grocery items to meet her clients’ demands.

loans.use: groceries to stock store

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La Sra. María Teresa, vive en la zona de Villa Victoria, conjuntamente a su hermana la Sra. María Isabel, quien tambien es cliente de Kiva y de Emprender, aunque ambas se dedican a diferentes actividades viven en el mismo domicilio junto a su señora madre ya que su padre falleció hace algunos años.
La Sra. Maria Teresa, se dedica a la mecánica dental, trabajo que realiza arduamente en un pequeño taller ubicado en su mismo domicilio, ha demostrado ser una cliente muy responsable en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa lives in Villa Victoria with her sister Maria Isabel who is also a client of Emprender and Kiva. Although they dedicate themselves to different careers, they live in the same house with their mother (their father passed away a few years ago). Maria Teresa dedicates herself to providing dental care, a service that she runs out of a small shop within her house. She has demonstrated herself to be a very responsible worker.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.en:
G. Iskandar has worked for many years in the difficult business of raising cattle. He is an exemplary husband in that he always tries his hardest to provide food for his wife and the three children in their home. After purchasing his cattle, Iskandar provides them with all the right conditions for their growth: taking care of their food and protection and making sure they don’t get lost. Once they’re fully mature, Iskandar sells them in his area and also provides their milk for sale. Currently he needs to purchase cattle to raise and for this reason is turning to IMON International to obtain a loan of $600. Iskandar thanks Kiva for the support that Kiva provides to small entrepreneurs.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle

loans.name: Asunción Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Asunción del Pilar A. D. A. tiene 48 años, vive en el distrito D. Salaverry, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 2do D. secundaria, abandono los estudios debido a que sus padres no tenían los medios económicos para seguir apoyándola. Tiene 03 hijos D. los cuales  01 aun depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Asunción se dedica a la costura y tiene una pequeña bodega, iniciò su negocio  con la venta D. kerosene (combustible)y verduras que abandonò para dedicarse al cuidado D. su pequeña hija, luego se dedicò a la costura. Con el tiempo a iniciado la venta D. abarrotes y D. productos D. belleza. También se dedico a la venta D. calzado y queso por temporadas, su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su banco comunal “Jerid Camino al Éxito II”, lo invirtió en la compra D. calzado   
Con el crédito D. 1200 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra D. insumos para la elaboración D. alimentos para aumentar el capital D. trabajo.
Asunción sueña con tener una bodega granD. y comprarse un carro
Ella pertenece al club D. madres D. su sector
texts.en:
Mrs. Asunción del Pilar A. D. A. is 48 years old, lives in the district of Salaverry, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú. She completed her second year of high school, but had to leave school because her parents did not have the economic means to continue supporting her. She has three children, one of whom is still financially dependent on her.

Asunción is a seamstress and has a small store. She began her business with the sale of kerosene (combustible) and vegetables, which she left to care for her small daughter; later she began her work as a seamstress. With time she has begun to sell groceries and beauty products. She also sells footwear and seasonal cheeses. She conducts her business from her home.

With the loan of 1200 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy consumable products for food production in order to increase her working capital. Asunción dreams of having a big store and of buying herself a car. She belongs to the club of mothers in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of consumable products for the preparation of foods

loans.name: Fazala Group

texts.en:
Fazala is the group leader of Fazala group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for her business.

Fazala wants to take a loan for her embroidery business. Leeda wants to take a loan for her quilt making business. Lateafa wants to take a loan for her husband, who is a taxi driver. Nulofer wants to take a loan for her fruit and vegetable shop. They are all very thankful to Kiva lenders, who can support all worlds.

loans.use: for purchasing necessary things for their businesses

loans.name: Lorivic

texts.en:
Lorivic A. is from the village of Taboc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is 24 years old and married. To make a living, Lorivic owns and operates a retail business called a "sari-sari," or general store. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Lorivic has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately $150 USD a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lorivic joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorivic is requesting a new loan of $100 USD which will be used to purchase additional products to sell in her "sari-sari." This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lorivic from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business and to support her family's financial needs.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Chon

texts.en:
Chon C. is 25 years old, single and a resident of Siem Reap Province, where he earns a living raising ducks in a cage behind his house. He raises ducks to produce eggs and sells the eggs to people who come to buy in bulk at his house.
On the other hand, he has also cultivated a rice crop on his plot of land in the village. He currently lives with his older mother and his three siblings. Chon C. requested a loan to use in both goals, to grow a rice crop during this rainy season and to buy additional small ducks to breed.

loans.use: To buy additional small ducks to breed and to grow rice

loans.name: Fahriniso

texts.ru: Фахринисо - 47 года. Замужем и мать 4-х детей. Занимается продажей женской одежды на рынке "Фаровон" города Гафурова. Она привозит товар из города Алма-аты Республики Казахстан. Иногда ездит в город Бишкек. И два раза в месяц ездит в город Истаравшан. Фахринисо уже один год кредитуется в нашей организации. За этот период она показала себя как опытный бизнесмен и своевременно погашает свой займ. Фахринисо просит займ для закупки летней партии женской одежды.
texts.en:
Fahriniso is 47 years old, married and has 4 children. She sells women’s clothing at the Farovon market in the city of Gafurov. She brings her merchandise from the city of Alma-Ata in the Kazakhstan Republic. Sometimes, she travels to the city of Bishkek. And twice per month, she travels to the city of Istaravshan. Fahriniso has been our client for one year. During this time, she has shown to be an experienced entrepreneur, who timely repaid her loans. Fahriniso is requesting this loan to buy a stock of women’s summer clothing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's summer clothing

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
 Кадырова более 6 лет получает кредиты в нашей организации. Ее магазин автомобильных запасных частей находится рядом с домом. В бизнесе ей помогает сын, поскольку Рано работает бухгалтером дома быта «Навбахор». Клиентов ее магазина привлекает широкий выбор товаров и доступные цены. Получив следующий займ, Рано хочет расширить ассортимент колесных дисков для автомобилей.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Rano K. has been taking out loans at our organization for more than six years. Her spare auto parts store is located near her house. Her son helps her with the business because Rano works as an accountant at a home depot Navbahor. A wide variety is what attracts her customers to the store and also affordable prices. After receiving her next loan Rano wants to expand the assortment of wheel rims for cars.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheel rims for cars

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Señora Mary is seen here with two clients who are enjoying her delicious regional dishes. Mary runs a business where she sells cooked foods in front of her home in the evenings. She lives in an area called "Luz y Paz" (Light and Peace) in the city of Pucallpa.  

Mary is 36 years old and married with three children. Her children inspire her to keep working hard at her business.  Her husband works as a laborer at Pucallpa's port. (Pucallpa is located on the Ucayali, a wide brown river that flows past the city and eventually joins the Amazon to the north).  

Mary has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for more than a year and belongs to a communal bank known as Las Romanticas. She used her very first loan of about $100 to invest in her business selling foods typical of the region. She plans to invest this new loan in the same manner. Mary is very pleased to be working with Manuela Ramos, as the organization not only provides loans, but also teaches borrowers strategies to grow and improve their businesses.  

Mary's goal is to improve the interior of her home so that she can make part of it into a restaurant. In this way, she will be able to serve her customers in a cleaner and more pleasant environment.

loans.use: To buy food and supplies for a catering/restaurant business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a member of the Itiji West borrower group in Itiji,Mbeya,she is 36 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 15 and 18 years.

Joyce started her own cafe  business selling  food 1 year ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 10,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Joyce first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 100,000 In order to buy more commodities like sugar,salts for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from  the use of this loan Itiji hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice,sugar,cooking oil,salts

loans.name: Djikiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djikiya est constitué de 6 femmes mariées (trois sont polygames deux monogames et une célibataire)   ayant en moyenne  32 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Médine un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dont le but  est de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de  pagnes wax, de céréales  et de boissons.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter,  25 pièces de pagnes wax, 15 sacs de 100 kg de céréales et  30 casiers de boissons. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages environnants. 
Les marchandises sont vendues aux marchés, de façon ambulante dans les quartiers, dans la famille ou sur commande, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 19.000 FCFA dont une partie sera investie dans les activités et l’autre partie en épargne.
Certaines femmes du groupe Djikiya ambitionnent agrandir et diversifier leurs activités et participer à l’épanouissement de leur famille.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Jenielyn

texts.en: Jenielyn N. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Jenielyn owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling used clothing known as ukay-ukay in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Jenielyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira B., 37 years old, started her general store six year ago. She lives with her three children and her husband, Armando, in a populous village in Tala, Caloocan City.

Elvira saves her profits to build up funds for the renovation of their house. Part of her earnings also goes to her children’s education. She is now making P 6,500 in net income per month.

She considers being a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative a blessing for her business and her family. Elvira is now in need of a new loan in the amount of P10,000 as additional capital for her general store. She will purchase grocery items and soft drinks.

Elvira wishes to help her children continue their education until college.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and soft drinks for her store

loans.name: Omolara

texts.en: Omolara is 40 years old. She is married with a child. She sells drinks and stationery at various retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because it is highly competitive; she hopes to meet the requirement of her customers. She hopes for a loan of N 100,000, with which she will purchase more drinks and stationary. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing more drinks and stationary

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas N., 62 years old, is a snack food seller. She operates her business in front of her home. Besides selling food, she and her husband always cultivate a rice crop when the farming season approaches. Meas N. is a good mother blessed with eight kids. Six of the children are married and the other two are still young. Meas N. is applying for a loan to buy more essential ingredients to continue cooking food for sale.

loans.use: To buy more essential ingredients to continue cooking food for sale

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura G. was born in 1959 in Koti village, Ijevan area. She is a widow and has four daughters. Two of them are married and live separately from Laura. Laura was a cigarette maker in the state farm for about 18 years. Since 1990, she is engaged in cattle breeding and land cultivation. Thanks to her income Laura provides for her family needs, organized her two daughters’ weddings and paid for their educations.

Laura needs a loan of 500,000 AMD to buy pigs and fodder for her farm animals. She plans to spend her increased income on her younger daughters’ educations and to provide a dowry for them.

loans.use: To buy pigs and fodder.

loans.name: Thelesphore

texts.en:
Thelesphore is a 25-year-old single businessman. He lives in Musanze, a region of Ruhengeri, in the Northern Province of Rwanda, which is approximately two hours from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Thelesphore has been successful in his business of selling dishes and kitchenware for the past seven years. He began his career as an entrepreneur early in life. He employs three people from his community and together they work from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every weekday. 

Thelesphore is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. He plans to use these funds to purchase more dishes and kitchenware in order to meet the growing demand from his customers. With this expansion, he will satisfy the prevailing market and in the process, increase his sales and attract more customers.

If his plans work out, Thelesphore hopes to increase his revenue and reinvest any profits in his business in order to create a strong financial base for his growing enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase more dishes and kitchenware

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Maria tiene 60 años, es viuda pues su esposo falleció hace 8 años y tiene 8 hijos que ya no dependen D. ella pero vive con sus dos hijos Rosmar y Nataniel.           

La socia alquila habitaciones D. su domicilio que dan hacia la calle y ahora desea alquilar las habitaciones internas D. la casa. Ya son dos años que alquila habitaciones D. su domicilio y le ha ido muy bien, gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una mujer emprendedora que requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimientos D. cuatro a cinco habitaciones D. su domicilio que están en mal estado, la socia va contratar un albañil para hacer mejorar las paredes y los pisos D. los cuartos por lo cual se necesitara material D. construcción como yeso y cemento.    

La socia es natural D. la ciudad D. Urcos D. la provincia D. Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” D. la Asociación Arariwa.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria is 60 years old. She has been a widow for eight years, and has eight children. Her children are no longer dependent on her, but she lives with two of them, Rosmar and Nataniel.

Maria rents out rooms in her house that face the street, and now she wants to also rent the insiD. rooms. She has been renting rooms for two years and it is going well, thanks to the determination she puts into her work. She is an enterprising woman and needs this loan to do maintenance on four or five rooms that are in bad condition. She will contract a mason to improve the walls and floors and will need construction materials like plaster and cement.

Maria is a native of the city of Urcos in the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco. She belongs to the “Qori Orcco” communal bank of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity and promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire a mason to improve the walls and floors

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
El señor Raúl H. es padre de familia y tiene tres hijos adolescentes que actual mente están estudiando.
Con unos ahorros que tenía empezó la construcción de un cuarto mas para la vivienda, pero le esta haciendo falta colocar el techo. Tiene el proyecto de construir una losa de concreto para que la casa sea más segura y duradera. 
El está solicitando el préstamo para esa construcción y planea pagarlo con sus ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo en una fábrica en  el departamento de producción. 
Su deseo es que sus hijos tengan su propio cuarto y vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Raúl H. is the head of a household and he has 3 adolescent children who are currently in school. With some savings he began building an additional room onto his home, but he still needs to add the roof. He wants to build the roof from a concrete slab, so that it will be more secure and durable. He is requesting a loan for this construction, and he plans to pay if off with the income that he earns working in the production department of a factory. He wants his children to have their own room so that they can live better.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction of a concrete roof

loans.name: Vreneli

texts.en:
Vreneli S. is from the village of Anakan, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Vreneli is married and has 4 school-aged children. Vreneli owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Vreneli has been involved in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Vreneli joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vreneli has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Vreneli is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Vreneli from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Zoila Estela

texts.es: Zoila estela A. D. M. D. 60 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipio D. Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive únicamente junto a su esposo quien trabaja como peluquero. Zoila posee una venta D. sopa muy típica D. este país llamada “sopa D. pata”, la cual esta hecha a base D. piernas D. res y verduras, esta sopa es muy popular, y solicitada por las personas. Zoila elabora y comercializa esta sopa, en el mercado central D. San Salvador, uno D. los mercados más grandes D. la capital, en donD. exixte una gran competencia entre las diferentes ventas D. comida. DesD. hace 16 años que Zoila se dedica a este tipo D. trabajo, logrando obtener gran fama por darle un toque muy especial a su producto, en su lugar D. trabajo es muy conocida y respetada por ser una señora muy trabajadora y amable, tanto con sus clientes como con las personas que le ayudan en el negocio. Zoila solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima para la elaboración D. esta exquisita sopa, ya que es gracias a este negocio como ella ha logrado seguir adelante junto a su esposo, trabajando mucho por poder tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
Zoila Estela A. D. M., 60, lives in Ilopango, San Salvador department. She lives with her husband, who is a barber. She sells a kind of soup that is very typical of this country, called "Sopa D. Pata," which is maD. based on beef leg and vegetables. This is a very popular, sought-after dish. Zoila makes and sells this soup in San Salvador's central market, one of the capital's largest and a site where there is much competition in food sales. Zoila has been in this type of work for 16 years and has acquired a bit of fame due to the special touch she adds to her product; she is very respected and known for being hard-working and kind both to her customers and to the persons who help her in her business. Zoila is asking for funding to buy the raw materials needed to make this delicious soup because, thanks to this business, she and her husband have managed to get ahead working hard to have a dignified life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beef and vegetables.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina has managed a small store since 1987. She sells coconut wine for PHP 200 per container. Then the income was used to buy the daily needs of her family. She continues to sells coconut wine because it is a very good business. She would like to increase her business through the help of a loan.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional coconut wine for her store.

loans.use: To buy additional coconut wine to resell

loans.name: Mame Yacine

texts.fr: Madame Mame Yacine D. sollicite un prêt de 150 000 FCFA pour acheter des tissus du genre indigo (thioupe)  qu’elle place à ses clients qui lui règlent par fin de mois. En fait cette dame, célibataire âgée de 44 ans, est dans le secteur du commerce depuis  5 ans pour dit-elle régler ses propres besoins. Elle pratique le commerce ambulant de tissus, d’habits, arachide …etc.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mame Yacine D. is requesting a 150,000 FCFA credit loan to buy indigo-style fabrics (thioupe) she offers to her clients, who then pay her end of month. This 44-year-old lady has in fact been active in retail commerce for the past five years, to meet her personal needs. She is an itinerant vendor of fabrics, clothes, peanuts, etc.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabrics for her business

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren is 44 years old and lives with her husband and six children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Byambasuren operates a soldering and manufacturing iron products business with her husband in her town. She has been operating her business since 1999, and has steadily expanded her business and over the years she has gained much experience. Byambasuren and her husband have a loyal customer base, and they manufactured the iron fence along the driveway of the Arvaiheer soum.

Currently, they have been busy with many orders from customers, and they are planning to expand their business and workplace in the future. Byambasuren is a very hardworking person and she is very enthusiastic about the future. She says, “Education is the most important thing for everyone, and I would like to be financially available for my children's studying in the future. In addition, I would like to have my own plot of land with a yard in the future.” She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug to purchase more iron while the wholesale prices remain low.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua E. operates a fufu joint at Akotokyire where she pounds fufu with a variety of soups, depending on the day of the week. On this day, Monday, she was going to serve the fufu with palm nut soup. Fufu is one the most popular food in the country. It is made out of cassava and plantain, cassava and cocoyam or yam mixed together in a form of pounding. Ekua has received a senior high education.  She is married to a driver and has two children. Ekua helps her husband in the upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs such as yam to cook to bring variety into her sales. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to put up a shop where people can comfortably sit to eat.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as yam

loans.name: Alaba

texts.en: Alaba E. is 27 years old, married with 3 children. Her eldest child is 6 years old. Her children attend school and this gives her joy as a mother. Alaba sells clothes by hawking them on a cart within her community in Ibadan, Oyo state. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She is requesting a loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. Alaba says thank-you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: María

texts.es: María S. O. de 60 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora, la cual día con día se esfuerza por salir adelante y mejorar en todo lo que sea posible. Vive junto a su esposo, su hija y dos nietos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. María posee una tienda en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad como: agua embotellada, gas propano, pan, leche y otros más, la tienda se encuentra ubicada en su casa de habitación la cual se encuentra en Santa María, en el departamento de Usulután. Desde hace 5 años que María cuenta con este negocio, el cual poco a poco ha ido sacando adelante surtiéndolo con lo que ha sido posible para ella, ya que esto es bastante difícil, ya que la mayoría de las ganancias son destinadas a los gastos familiares. Es por esta razón que María solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos comestibles, así mismo productos los cuales sean de primera necesidad para el hogar. María es alguien quien sueña con mejorar su condición económica, es por esto que espera mejorar mucho su negocio.
texts.en:
María S. O. is 60 years old. She is a hardworking woman who works day to day to get ahead and improve in every way possible. She lives with her husband, her daughter and her two minor grandchildren, who are in school. María has a store where she sells basic products such as: bottled water, propane gas, bread, milk, and more. The store is located in her house, which is in Santa María, in the department of Usulután. Maria has had this business for five years. She has gotten it ahead little by little, diversifying it as much as she has been able, since it is very difficult. Most of the profits are used for family expenses. This is the reason that María is asking for a loan from Integral through which she can buy a greater quantity of edible products, and items that are basic necessities for the home. María is someone who dreams of improving her economic condition, and that is why she is hoping to much improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perishable items.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 64 años, vive sola en su casa propia, pues sus hijos ya son independientes. Ella se dedica en la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que ha venido desarrollando a lo largo de todos estos años, pues al ser sus hijos ya independientes y no teniendo responsabilidades económicas con ellos, puede realizar su trabajo más cómodamente. Martha es la líder de la zona en la que vive, esto significa que debe organizar a un grupo de compañeras, para que realicen bien la venta y proveerles la cantidad de productos que han logrado vender. Ella se siente muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza, pues ha pensado en seguir mejorando su negocio adquiriendo mayor cantidad de productos y de paso ganar los premios que le ofrece la compañía de cosméticos para la que trabaja. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de las cuotas. Martha quiere comprar mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para tenerlos en stock.
texts.en:
Martha, age 64, lives in alone in her own house. Her children are now independent. She sells beauty products, an activity which she has developed over many years. Now that her children are independent and she is not economically responsible for them, she can work more comfortably. Martha is the leader in the area where she lives. That means that she needs to organize a group of colleagues in order to make good sales and to provide them with the products they have sold. She is very happy with the work she does. She has thought about continuing to improve her business by getting more products. Then she would win the prizes offered by the cosmetic company she works for. This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to be very punctual with all of her payments. Martha wants to buy more beauty products to have them in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of beauty products

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: The photo shows Prak P. with his wife at their home.  Prak is 32 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province.  To pursue a daily income, he owns a motorbike and operates a taxi service.  Beside his taxi business, Prak and his wife grow a few crops on their land next to their house for extra income.  They have one child who attends school.  The coming rainfall is good for growing, however, Prak needs a loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for planting.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es: Marcelo, de 65 años, lleva 21 años separado de su pareja, pues no tiene hijos, por lo que vive sólo en su casa propia, en compañía de sus inquilinos.En su juventud  era operador de locomotoras y trailers, en un asentamiento minero del cual se jubiló y de inmediato se fue a vivir a su ciudad natal. Tenia temor de  regresar a trabajar en  la agricultura, pero luego de un tiempo se decidió, y aplico las técnicas agrícolas que le enseñó su padre y ahora es uno de los mejores productores, pues desde hace 8 años cultiva  diferentes tipos de tubérculos, además de avena (pastizal), en sus terrenos propios. Lo que más le gusta es trabajar sus tierras y mantenerlas siempre limpias y verdes, porque así auguran una cosecha exitosa, sin embargo, le disgusta no contar con la ayuda de nadie, por eso piensa arrendar todos sus terrenos a su hermano, además quiere comprar cantidad de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y conejos pues quiere  instalar su granja.Es la décima vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y como es parte de la junta directiva, se siente contento de seguir trabajando con los integrantes de su banco comunal, porque son personas responsables en el pago de sus cuotas.Marcelo tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  varios sacos de abono para esparcirlos en sus cultivos, pues desea mejorar la calidad, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Marcelo, 65, has been separated from his partner for 21 years, but he doesn't have children so he lives alone in his own house in the company of his tenants. In his youth he was a train and truck operator in a mine site, from which he retired and immediately when to live in the city of his birth. Marcelo was afraid of going back to work in agriculture, but arrived at a point when he decided to do so and applied the agricultural techniques that his father taught him. Now he is one of the best producers in the region. For 8 years Marcelo has cultivated different types of tubers, as well as wheat (grass) on his own plots of land. What he enjoys most about his work is working on the land and keeping his crops clean and green, as this assures him of an excellent harvest. Nevertheless, he doesn't like not having anyone to help him and so he is thinking about renting his land out to his brother. Marcelo also wants to purchase a quantity of small animals, such as guinea pigs, chickens and rabbits, and to install a barn. This is the tenth time he has had a loan from MFP, and as he is part of the board of directors he feels happy to continue working with the members of his communal bank as they are very responsible people. Marcelo plans to invest this loan in the purchase of sacks of fertiliser to scatter on his crops as he wants them to be of a better quality, and in this way continue with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser to improve crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics, creams, and tools to use in her beauty salon

loans.name: Tirso

texts.en:
Tirso R. is from the village of Cabisera 5, Baribad. He is 37 years-old and married with three young children. To make a living, Tirso owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Tirso has been engaged in his business for over 16 years and earns approximately 50,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Tirso joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tirso is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Tirso from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra S. is from the town of Banga. She is 48 years old. Sandra is married and has 4 children. Her eldest is aged 28 and the youngest is 20. To make a living, Sandra owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Sandra wishes for her children to become professionals some day.

Sandra joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sandra has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Sandra is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Decsi Asunción

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora Decsi mantiene una relación de unión libre hace ya 25 años, tiene 6 hijos los cuales todos estudian y aun viven en su casa, el esposo se dedica a la venta de legumbres en un triciclo el cual recorre la ciudad para hacer sus ventas.

En los actuales momentos ella trabaja en la venta de legumbres en su casa dice que el negocio es pequeño pero esto le permite ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, trabaja desde 4am hora que junto a su esposo se va al mercado a comprar las frutas y legumbres que estén bien frescas para venderlas en el transcurso del día. Labora hasta las 3pm.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a emplear en comprar frutas y verduras. Además de sillas, mesas ollas, y otros artículos para poner una picantería (restaurant). Está en el banco desde hace 10 ciclos y le gusta el banco por que presta el dinero sin muchos tramites.
 
Sus metas son que su negocio sea productivo y comprar un piano para su hijo que quiere ser músico.
texts.en:
The community bank named "May 3" meets every two weeks in the district of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. The location is known for its commerce, for its traditional feast days of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the generally happy population. Decsi has been with her boyfriend for 25 years. They have 6 children together and they all go to school and still live at home. Her husband sells vegetables from a tricycle that he drives throughout town to make his sales. She also sells vegetables but from her house and she says that the business is small but it helps her contribute towards the family's expenses. She works from 4am, the same time when her husband goes to the markets to purchase their fruits and vegetables, to have the freshest product possible to sell during the day. She works until 3pm. This new loan will be used to purchase fruits and vegetables, as well as chairs, tables, and other items to set up a small restaurant. She has been a member in the community bank for the past 10 loan cycles and she enjoys this community bank because there isn't a lot of red tape. Her goal is to have her business be more productive and purchase a piano for her son. He wants to be a musician.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables and furniture to set up a restaurant.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 40 years old and married with four children who are between 4 and 19 years old.  Vestine owns a shop where she sells a variety of goods which include rice, sugar, salt, etc. She also sells drinks and some other goods (as shown in the picture).  She has been in this business for about three years. The business hours are from 6 am to 9 pm every day.

Vestine needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Vestine will purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs.  She hopes to earn more profits which, in turn, will allow her to keep reinvesting in her business for better financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet N. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 4 children, three of whom are in school.   Annet has a business of selling chickens. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 7 days out of every week. Annet sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Annet has requested for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more chickens. The main business challenge(s) for Annet include seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start rearing chickens herself.  Annet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for resale.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño, tiene 39 años, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos (21,17,15,13 años.
Gabriela se dedica  a la preparación y venta de alimentos (restaurante) tiene una concesión en el paradero de la Ruta No 6, su esposo se dedica a la elaboración de telares, carteras, tapices, cojines, etc.
Gabriela con el préstamo que solicita comprará, arroz, azúcar, aceite , fideos, papas verduras y todo lo necesario para la preparación de alimentos y una parte para la compra de lana para que trabaje su esposo e hijo.
Le gusta las reuniones de su bancomunal porque puede ahorrar, hay mucha solidaridad entre las socias, se ayudan cuando algunas de ellas tienen dificultades o problemas.
Le gusta las capacitaciones porque le hablan de negocios, salud, de como invertir su dinero, a no sobreendeudarse ya sabe como debe trabajar las juntas directivas.
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y que tengan su propio negocio para que no sufran, le gustaría también tener un local donde pueda vender los trabajos que elabora su esposo pues ahora los intermediaros lo visitan y compran.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a member of the 'Retoño' community bank.  She is 39 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 4 children aged 21, 17, 15 and 13.

Gabriela makes and sells food (restaurant).  She has a concession at the bus stop of route number 6.  Her husband works with a loom making wallets, carpets, cushions etc.

Gabriela will use the loan which she is requesting to buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles, potatoes, vegetables and everything else she needs to prepare food.  The rest she will use to buy wool for her husband and son to work with.

She likes the meetings of her community bank because she can save and there is a lot of solidarity between the members.  They help each other when anyone has difficulties or problems.

She likes the training sessions because they talk about business, health, how to invest money and how not to get themselves too far into debt.  She now knows how boards of directors should work.

Her dream is for her children to be professionals and for them to have their own businesses so that they don't suffer.  She would also like to have premises where she can sell her husband's handicrafts as right now intermediaries visit them and buy from them.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles, potatoes and vegetables

loans.name: Tamasha

texts.ru:
Tamasha H. 42 qoda. Ona zamujem i jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Tamasha imeyet 2 detey doch kotoroy 19 let ona uchitsya v universitete i sin kotoromu 16 let uchitsya v shkole.

Tamasha uje 4 qoda zanimayetsya prodajey tovarov domashneqo upotrebleniya. V svoyom maqazine ona prodayot kastruli, skavorodki, tarelki  a tak je spalneye bilyo, skaterti i t.d Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey mami. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit pomesheniye.
texts.en: Tamasha H. is 42 years old. She is married and lives in the Absheron Region together with her family. Tamasha has two children: a 19-year old daughter who is a university student and a 16-year old son who goes to school. For four years, Tamasha has been selling household goods. In her store she sells pots, pans, dishes, as well as bed linen, tablecloths, and so on. She learned this business from her mother. At present she needs 2000 AZN in order to expand her facility.

loans.use: Expanding her store facility

loans.name: Muratbek

texts.en:
Muratbek S. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His three oldest children attend a local school, and his youngest son is in kindergarten. His wife works as a librarian, and Muratbek operates a coal-delivery business using his own truck. 

Muratbek began his transportation business in 2000 and has gained much experience as a driver. After many years of owing his business, he has established a wide customer base. Muratbek is a hardworking and decent man and says, " All I want is to improve my truck, which is very outdated and requires a lot of repairs." He is requesting a loan of 1,100,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to increase his working capital for his coal-delivery business.

loans.use: To repair his truck

loans.name: Marleni

texts.en:
Marleni is twenty-eight years old. She shares her home with her four children. The family lives in the district of Tambogrande in northern Peru.  Tambogrande is a semi-tropical zone just a few hours away from the coastal desert in the province of Piura. It is primarily populated by small farmers and ranchers. Many residents own small fruit plantations or raise animals. 

Marleni sells beauty products. She works primarily with the product line UNIQUE, a well-known company in the area, which provides women with access to business opportunities. Marleni has a good number of consistent clients. She visits her clients regularly and makes bulk orders twice per month. She sells products from inventory, on request and on credit. Her clients appreciate the good treatment she provides and the flexibility.

Marleni has worked with Edpyme Alternativa in the past. She has a good repayment record and has used the loans responsibly. She plans to use the funds to expand her inventory and to meet the last minute needs of her clients as the holiday season approaches. She hopes the investment will improve her market share and to improve her income ongoing.

loans.use: To expand her inventory and to meet last minute needs of her clients as the holiday season approaches.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío es socia del Banco Comunal Belén, tiene 24 años de edad, trabaja en un taller de confecciones, los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para comprar hilo, agujas, tijeras y tela. En esta época el negocio es bajo debido a que el año escolar terminó recientemente y gran parte de su negocio proviene de confección de uniformes escolares. Rocío es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace mas de un año y ha sido presidenta de su Banco Comunal Belén. Lo que más le gusta de trabajar con FINCA Perú son las capacitaciones que recibe sobre cómo mejorar su negocio. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, comprar más máquinas de coser, actualmente sólo tiene uno.
texts.en:
Rocío is a member of the Belén (Bethlehem) community bank.  She is 24 years old and works in a dressmaking workshop.  She has used previous loans to buy thread, needles, scissors and fabric.  During this season her business is slow as the school year recently ended and a large part of her business comes from making school uniforms.

Rocío has been a member of FINCA Perú for more than a year and she has been president of her community bank.  What she most likes about working with FINCA Perú are the training sessions that she attends on how to improve her business.  Her dream is to expand her business and buy more sewing machines.  She currently only has one.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es:
Eliberto de Jesus A. es un comerciante 27 a;os de edad, casado, con tres hijos, y reside en el barrio Guanacaste en el municipio de La union, Olancho. Eliberto es integrante del grupo solidario Las Estrellas y funge como coordinador del mismo. Desde hace un a;o Eliberto inicio con el negocio de venta de abarroteria en un peque;o espacio de su domicilio. Su esposa le de terminar con los quehaceres del hogar lo ayuda a atender a los clientes. Su horario de trabajo es de lunes a domingo desde las 6:00 am hasta las 7:00 pm. Una de sus ventajas es que en el barrio donde vive no hay otro negocio parecio al de El, es por eso que cuenta con la clientela total. 

Eliberto solicita el prestamo para surtir su pulperia de mas productos para asi poder ofrecer a sus clientes una gama de opciones. Con el apoyo del prestamo podra seguir teniendo una entrada de dinero para sostener a su familia, ya que su negocio estara bien surtido. 

Su sue;o es tener un mini super y contar con los ingresos suficientes para educar a sus hijos y darles una mejor condicion de vida. Es su segundo ciclo en FAMA y ha demostrado responsabilidad en el pago de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Eliberto de Jesus A. is 27 years old and is a merchant. He is married, has three children and lives in the Guanacaste neighborhood in the municipality of La Union, Olancho. Eliberto is a member of the communal bank Las Estrellas and also serves as the bank's coordinator. A year ago Eliberto started his business selling groceries in a small space in his home. After she finishes her housework, his wife helps him serve the customers. His work schedule is Monday through Sunday, from 6:00 am until 7:00 pm. One of his advantages is that the neighborhood where he lives does not have a similar business which is why he counts with all the customers. 

Eliberto is requesting a loan to stock his grocery store with more products to be able to offer his customers a range of options. With the support from this loan he will be able to continue to have an income stream to support his family since his business will be well stocked. 

His dream is to have a small supermarket and have enough income to educate his children and to give them a better quality of life. This is his second loan cycle with field partner FAMA and he has shown that he is responsible in making his payments.

loans.use: Purchase groceries to stock his grocery store.

loans.name: Rosalia Josefina

texts.es: Rosalía es una señora muy responsable con los pagos de sus cuotas. Ella trabaja arduamente en sus chacras, se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de tunas y cochinilla desde hace más de diez años. Con el producto de su trabajo logró comprar terrenos para chacras pero como son pequeños y ella desea sembrar mayor cantidad de semilla decidió alquilar más terreno. Rosalía está feliz con el ingreso de su actividad porque con la ayuda de estos ingresos y el apoyo moral, económico de su esposo cubre los  estudios de su hija quien se está preparando para ingresar a la universidad y también cubre los gastos de sus pequeños hijos. Ella solicitó el préstamo para comprar más abono para seguir cultivando sus chacras. A Rosalía le encantaría que su hijo mayor quien está estudiando mecánica  tenga su propio taller o factoría. En la fotografía podemos apreciar a Rosalía con el último de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosalía is a woman who is very responsible with her repayments.  She works hard in her fields growing prickly pears and cochineal; she’s been thus occupied for over 10 years.  Her work made it possible for her to buy land for farming but, because the plots are small and she wants to plant larger amounts of seed, she decided to buy more land.

Rosalía is happy with the income from her activity because with the income and moral and economic support from her husband she covers her daughter’s educational expenses who is preparing to enroll in the university as well as the expenses of her little children.

She asked for the loan to buy more manure to continue farming her fields.  Rosalía would be ecstatic if her oldest son, who is studying mechanics, could have his own workshop or factory.

In the photo we can see Rosalía with her youngest son.

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina has been living in the area of Daata Nagar, Lahore, for the past 16 years with her family in a 2-room brick house. Lahore is Pakistan’s 2nd largest city and also known for its history and culture.  
Samina is 38 years old, married to M. A., and has 2 children. Both are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 
Her husband has been involved in the furniture-making business for the last 10 years. His showroom is located in the market and he makes good quality furniture. 
Samina herself is a housewife.  She prefers to stay at home and take care of her household responsibilities. She is an active and supportive lady and takes care of her family very well.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy wood, nails, and furniture polish to make larger quantities of furniture. This should help him to fulfill larger orders on time.  Samina is very confident that her husband will make good use of the loan and will successfully be able to expand his business.
This is Samina's 2nd loan application with Asasah.   In the previous loan year, she has proved herself a responsible client by paying her installments on time and attending every meeting.

loans.use: To buy wood, nails and furniture polisher for furniture making business

loans.name: Filomina

texts.en:
Filomina T. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old, married, and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a manufacturing business, making and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-six years and earns approximately $47 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Filomina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. 

Filomina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be her 5th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia S. is from the city of Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is 55 years old. Cecilia is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Cecilia makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2011, Cecilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Cecilia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Irailakan's Group

texts.en:
Irailakan T., age 55, is the leader of this group. She has earned a living by offering convenience goods for sale for the past 34 years. Her monthly profit is 3,000 soms. She hopes to obtain this loan in order to purchase more goods so that she can increase the turnover of her business. With part of the loan, she will purchase fertilizers and seeds for farming. In the future, she wants to improve the family’s living conditions. 

Irailakan lives with her husband and family in Uzgen, a beautiful and ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Her husband is retired and receives a monthly pension in amount of 2,500 soms. Together they have raised seven children: the youngest son is 15.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line:
- People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), 
- Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and 
- Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 
MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team, Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance, at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase convenience goods to offer for sale

loans.name: Pyramide Plus Group

texts.en:
Clément is the leader of a community bank named “Pyramide Plus”.  This group which is composed of 15 microentrepreneurs, united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.
 
Clément sells second-hand clothing. He started his business in 2005 with the beginning capital of US$60. With hard work and determination, he has succeeded in making it thrive thanks to good management and accumulated profits.  Currently, he earns a profit of $120 every week. 

Clément is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC and has received three previous loans which he has successfully repaid.  He intends to use this next loan to increase the inventory for his business by purchasing a second-hand clothing bundle in order to increase his profit. 

Clément is married and is the father of three children aged between 10 months and 6 years old -- one of them is currently going to school. His dream is to open a general boutique and a drugstore in his community.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to resell

loans.name: Pasha

texts.ru: Pasha A. rodilsya v 1969 qodu. Pasha uje 12 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye uchatsya v shkole. Seychas Pasha nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya uvelicheniya molochnoqo produkta dlya prodaji v magazini.
texts.en: Pasha A. was born in 1969. Pasha has been a herdsman for twelve years, raising cows.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives with his close-knit family in the Fuzuli region.  He is married and has two children who go to school.  Now, Pasha needs 2300 AZN to buy cows to increase production of the milk he sells in stores.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Charen

texts.en:
Charen is 29 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Charen has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for two years and also earns an income from ready-to-wear clothing.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a hardworking entrepreneur living in the Philippines. He is 48 years old and married. Roberto has five children. His wife works as a domestic helper.

Roberto has been in the business of furniture making for four years. Each month, he earns 15,000 Philippines pesos. He plans to use this loan to purchase wood to be used in furniture making.

In the future, Roberto would like to diversify his business to make frequent sales and to make his family more economically stable.

loans.use: to purchase wood to be used in furniture making

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a resident and a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. He has been active in mixed farming for over ten years, producing and selling coffee, milk and bananas to the local market. He is married and has one child, aged nine years. He gets additional income from his masonry work.

Kenneth has made a loan request amounting to 50,000 KES to start construction of a modern dairy unit. He hopes the better shelter will secure his cows, limit the common animal diseases and improve his income, which will enable him to educate his child.

He notes that animal diseases and the high cost of dairy feeds are still the greatest challenges for his farming business.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: 10 Hải Sơn - Hoằng Trường - Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Ms. Thuỷ is applying for a loan to improve her business. She operates a food stall selling fish.

Thuỷ is 21 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 10 Hải Sơn - Hoằng Trường - Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with her three dependents.

In 2010, Thuỷ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thuỷ has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thuỷ has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Thuỷ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Thuỷ hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for fish selling

loans.name: Sope Baye Niass Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité sope baye niass a été créé le 29/06/2009.Il est composé de 11 membres issus de la même localité.Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Tabara en position assise , à l'extrême droite est la responsable du groupement elle est mariée, âgée de 45 ans et mère de 02 enfants .

Sa principale activité est le commerce de chaussures,d'écharpes,de mil et des arachides.

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin  de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle qui est essentiellement féminine.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires,construire sa maison.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sope Baye Niass was created on June 29, 2009. It is composed of eleven members from the same town. Their main work involves commerce. 

Ms. Tabara (seated at the far right in the photo) is the group's official. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  Her main business involves commerce in footwear, scarves, millet, and peanuts. 

Her loan will enable her to stock up on a sufficient quantity of merchandise in order to respond to the demands of her customer base, which is essentially made up of women. Her goal is to increase her turnover and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (footwear and scarves)

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 32 years old and lives in Paynesville. She’s married and her husband collects and sells used bottles.  They have two children aged 8 and 3 years.  Both of them live at home and attend school in the morning.  In the afternoon, the elder looks after the younger child and minds the stall when Mamie has to go to the market.  

Mamie sells dried goods (Soap,Tissue, Toothpaste, etc) from a table; sometimes she uses a wheelbarrow to make deliveries.  Her principal concern is fluctuations in the level of business which is sometimes very slow.  She learned this business from her auntie.  She is proud to run her own business and of the independence it gives her.

She’s requesting a loan to purchase stock for her business.  In the future, she hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase stock (Soap,Tissue, Toothpaste, etc) for her business.

loans.name: Bandina

texts.en: Bandina is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Bandina has a pigpen and sells matured & grown pigs. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs. Bandina has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Bandina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Béatrice Ama

texts.fr:
Béatrice Ama est une femme  âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 03enfants.
Béatrice Ama travaille comme revendeuse de bananes, de farine, de charbon, de tapioca  depuis 1989. Elle livre ses marchandises à la maison après achat à Danyi(KPALIME).
Béatrice Ama a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbon, des bananes, de la farine.
WAMPA
texts.en:
Béatrice Ama is 47 years old. She is married to a driver and the mother of three children. She has been selling bananas, flour, coal and tapioca since 1989. She sells her goods out of her home after having bought them in Danyi (Kpalimé).

Béatrice Ama came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her first loan to buy coal, bananas and flour.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coal.

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en:
Jenilyn is 33 years old and married. She has 2 children ages 7 and 6. Jenilyn's husband is a farmer.

Jenilyn has had a sari-sari (convenience) store business for 3 years. She sells canned goods, sugar, coffee and other various products. Jenilyn also helps her husband grow rice on their farm. She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, coffee, sugar and other items.

In the future, Jenilyn hopes to have a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, coffee, sugar and other items

loans.name: Marie Providence

texts.en:
Marie Providence, who is single, is a rice farmer. She has been doing rice farming for the past four years. She was taught rice farming by her parents.

She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and, lastly, in harvesting activities.

With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Manohari

texts.en:
A four-storied wooden framed building in the heart of Tangal, a busy district near Kathmandu, is home to this family-run business, ‘Nepalese Wood Craft Child Craft.’ The family has been in the wood craft business for three generations. Over the years, the business has expanded to employ twenty people from the community who have become like a family, according to the business proprietor. She is applying for a Kiva loan to purchase more raw materials to make wooden toys and learning tools for children.

Once a year during the sale season, she sells her products to a number of buyers, including non-profit organizations such as “Save the Children” and “Room to Read.” Many of these products help children learn to read and count, while some products, such as the rocking horse, are meant for entertainment. For rest of the year, Manohari is busy overseeing the preparation of stock for the next season.

The factory works at every stage of the production line - from cutting through the first grain of wood for making a rocking horse or a jigsaw puzzle to varnishing a toy with final paint. The Kiva loan will help Manohari to purchase materials for these processes so that the business can produce more stock in time for the big sale season.

loans.use: to buy wood to craft children's toys and learning tools.

loans.name: Wanjohi

texts.en:
