Wanjohi is a resident and a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya. He is 38 years old and married with four children between one and ten years-old. His farm produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables for the local market. He fully relies on farming for his family upkeep.

Wanjohi has made a loan request amounting to 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He will use the additional income to repay the loan and school fees for his children. He hopes to upgrade his cattle in future and operate under economies of scale.

He mentions high costs of raising animals as the main problem in farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.es:
Nuevo Renacer se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, gracias a que la actual presidenta, la Sra. Norma contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 14 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en el 1° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Una de las miembros es la señora Ramona, quien se dedica a la venta de lencería, dice que tiene ya muy buena clientela, ya que siempre trae productos de buena calidad y eso agrada a sus clientes. Comenta que por medio de este trabajo ella logra mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de todo tipo de lencería, lo cual le ayudará a cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
An excellent group of women is called Nuevo Renacer. It based is the city of Villa Elisa, thanks to the present president, Norma, who contacted the consultant in a weekly meeting that she had in the area to find out about the type of work the Enterprising Women's Committee does. Once she had consulted about the program, she was able to get 14 women together who are working very well together and are in their 1rst cycle. They are united and supportive in the program.    

One of the members is Ramona. She sells undergarments. She says she has a very good customer base since she always brings good quality products and this pleases her customers. She remarks that with this work she is able to support her self and her family.  

She is asking for the loan to buy all types of undergarments, which will help her to satisfy her customers demand.

loans.use: to buy undergarments to sell.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: Claudia Maria está estudiando administración de empresas, está cursando el quinto año, y el crédito solicitado será para pagar el curso de titulación para obtener el título de su carrera. Sueña con tener su propia empresa y apoyar a los jóvenes que desea superarse y que por falta de empleo no han podido. Le inspira el poder lograr sus metas para superar las necesidades de su familia. Siempre ha sido responsable con sus compromisos, y espera mantener el mismo comportamiento con este crédito
texts.en: Claudia María is studying Business Administration; she’s in the fifth year.  The loan will be to pay for her final course in order to graduate and receive her professional title.  She dreams with having her own firm and to help young adults who want to get ahead but who have been unable to do so because of lack of employment.  She’s inspired to reach her goals to overcome her family’s needs.  She’s always been responsible with her commitments and expects to behave the same way with this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her university courses.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar owns and manages his corn farming business. He is proud that he is a farmer. Edgar has managed his corn fields for almost 20 years and he is able to earn an income of P45,000 per crop season but he uses this amount for school fees, household expenses and allowances for his children. He devotes full-time in improving his corn fields because he would like to earn a greater amount to provide for his family's needs. He is 40 years of age and married with two children. He is glad because he has a supportive wife.

Edgar aims to increase his yields this coming crop season because his crops were destroyed by the typhoons "Pedring and Quiel". With this circumstance, his profit is no longer sufficient and that's the reason why he is asking for additional capital amounting to P50,000 which will be used in buying fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides to improve the growth of his crops. He is hoping that he can obtain his goal in life and most of all he will be able to send his children into higher education.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides for agricultural business.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 82-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.
 
Vicenta has a shop that sells bananas and coconuts for copra. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy coconuts and bananas for selling.

Vicenta has been a member of HSPFI since 1996. In the future, Vicenta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas for selling.

loans.name: Rosa Carlota

texts.es:
Rosa Carlota tiene 45 años de edad es soltera tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos de 19, 17 y 12 años de edad en el Cantón ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz hace 12 años. Las compras y las ventas los realiza en ventanas. Solicita el crédito para seguir trabajando, comprar abonos agrícolas.

 Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá pagar a los trabajadores. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problemas. 
En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar.
texts.en:
Rosa Carlota, 45, is a single mother.  She lives with her three children--19-, 17-, and 12-years old, respectively--in Ventana, a canton of the Ecuadorean province of Los Rios.  

Rosa Carlota is a member of the Las Palmas community bank in the rural town of Campo Alegre.

Rosa Carlota has been a farmer for 12 years.  She grows maize and rice.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy manure to fertilize her land.

Your loan will help Rosa Carlota to pay her workers.  She's never had problems of this kind before.  She likes to work, even in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is married and has two children. Rosemarie is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Rosemarie is a farmer. She plants and harvests rice crops to sell to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years and every month she earns 18,893 PHP from this work. 

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

Rosemarie has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to enable her children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

location.town: Campo 4, Ramon MAgsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Sambath, 57, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She sells cake at the market. Her husband is a construction worker. All of her children are garment workers. Sambath is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work and to run as motor taxi when he is free. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home to generate extra income to support her family. In addition, she plans to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is 30 years old and married with two children aged two and 11. For the past six years, she has sold used clothes to earn a living, and now employs one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to expand her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy trousers, dresses and jackets to resell.

loans.use: To buy trousers, dresses and jackets.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 38 years old.  She is married and has three children aged 15, 14 and 10.  In 1998, she established  her poultry farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy chickens for her business.  

In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 0In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business.  Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy.  Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chickens for her business.

loans.name: Dúo Neftalí Group

texts.es: Dúo Neftalí La líder de este dúo es la señora Guadalupe, ella se dedica a la crianza de gallinas ponedoras y a la venta de huevos.  Este es el tercer crédito que ella solicita a FAPE y KIVA  al principio de su negocio  ella se dedicaba a criar pollos, luego los vendía por libra.  Ella cuenta que  invertía más tiempo y recursos en los pollos,  por lo que decidió mejor comprar gallinas ponedoras a la cuales cuida y aprovecha la producción de huevos. Ya cuenta con dos años de experiencia en su negocio  y ya tiene buen número de  clientes a los que les entrega los huevos por cartón.  Ella solicita el crédito para comprar otras gallinas ponedoras ya que la producción de huevos ha bajado y ella no le quiere quedar mal a sus clientes a quienes surte los huevos.  La señora Guadalupe es una mujer trabajadora y cuenta que su meta es que su negocio crezca, ella tiene dos hijos uno de 21 y 23 años que aun que ellos ya son independientes ella trabaja para poder tener su casa propia, ya que actualmente alquila.

loans.use: Compra de gallinas ponedoras.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: A 32-year-old woman, married with four children, Dorcas I. lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks to the community. She promises to increase her business with the above amount.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale.

loans.name: Nafesa

texts.en: Nafesa D/O G. A. was born in 1962 and lives in District 7 of Kabul City. She is married and helps her husband financially with her Bead Working business. When she first started her business she lacked the money to buy all the material she needed, but she worked hard and made good quality clothes and sold them in the market. Her first loan was used to buy beads and fabric to produce more clothes to sell. She is ready to take another loan in order to purchase more beads and fabrics which will enable her to produce more clothes and do more business in the market.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and beads

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuy O., 47 years old mother of 5 children, lives with her husband in a part of Preyveng province, Cambodia. To service in her family's expenses, Tuy O. operates a business in the suburb of the city selling a variety of fruits, and typically makes about $16/day in revenue. Her husband, meanwhile, works on a farm growing crops and breeding animals, while 2 of her children work at a local hotel and the rest are students.

Tuy O. is requesting a loan amount of $1000 to purchase more fruits in order to keep investing in her sustainable business as well as to meet her clients' demand. For the coming year, she hopes to have enough money to keep expanding her business and offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Mery Angelica

texts.es:
Mery works selling ceviche and other foods made with fish and seafood. She began her business to meet her family’s needs and also to let her excellent abilities in the kitchen shine. She is located in San José de Sisa, in the department of San Martín, Perú. The ceviche and other foods are prepared according to the requests of the customers, who are from the community and also visitors that come from other cities.

The loan that she that she will receive is from the Moviemento Manuela Ramos, through its Doradinas en Acción Communal Bank. She will invest it in fixing up her own restaurant with adequate furniture to provide better service to her customers and will also buy ingredients for making ceviche and a diversity of other foods so that she can fulfill the daily orders. The loans she has received have grown from S/300 ($94) to S/700 ($219).

She is 38 years old and has two daughters. In addition to tending to her business and taking care of her family, she is also studying at a technological institute in order to better prepare herself because her goal is to buy land and produce and sell agricultural products.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Mery, se dedica a la venta de cebiche y otros paltos a base de pescados y mariscos, decidió iniciar su negocio para solucionar las necesidades familiares, y además para sacar a relucir las habilidades que posee en la cocina. Ella esta ubicada en San José de Sisa, en el departamento de San Martín – Perú. El cebiche y otros platos son preparados según los pedidos de los clientes que son propios de la comunidad y los visitantes que llegan de otras ciudades El préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos, a través de su Banco Comunal Doradinas en Acción, será invertido en el arreglo de su propio local, implementación con mobiliario adecuado para una mejor atención a los clientes, compra de insumos para la producción del cebiche y platos diversos y así cumplir con los pedidos diarios. Los prestamos que ha recibido han ido creciendo desde S/300 ($94) llegando a S/700 ($219) Ella tiene 38 años y 2 hijas, paralelo a la atención de su negocio y con el apoyo de su familia, estudia actualmente en un instituto tecnológico para superarse cada día más, porque su meta es comprar tierras y dedicarse a la producción y venta de productos agrícolas.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her restaurant and to buy food ingredients

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana is 40 years old and has three children. She and her husband are merchants; they sell fruits and vegetables to other communities far from their hometown. They have a van that lets them travel and transport their merchandise from one place to another. Sebastiana is part of the solidarity group called Crisantema 1. With your loan she will increase the investement in fruits and vegetables which will allow them to visit more communities and increase their income, thus improving the financial situation of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

SEBASTIANA tiene 40 años y tiene tres hijos. Ella junto con su esposo son comerciantes, se dedican a vender frutas y verduras a otras comunidades lejanas a su lugar de origen, tienen una camioneta que les permite viajar y transportar la mercancía de un lugar a otro. Forma parte del grupo solidario llamado Crisantema 1. Con su préstamo aumentara la inversión de frutas y verduras lo cual permitirá que visiten más comunidades y así obtendrán mas ganancias que les permitirá mejorar su condición económica familiar.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (fruits and vegetables)

loans.name: Mork

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Mok and her husband Mr. Mut Moen got married in 1979. They have five children: two daughters and three sons. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor in2000 and started her silk production business in the same year. She has never attended primary school, while her husband, who began, did not graduate from primary school. Her husband grows rice and raises cattle.

This is Mrs K. Mok's first loan from MAXIMA. She is requesting $500 to purchase silk materials and sewing thread and to pay for fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es:
Mrs. T. has been making and selling tortillas for 10 years. Through her efforts, she has demonstrated that she can improve her financial situation. She started out with a small tortilla stand, and then, with her profits, she was able to set up a tortilla shop that she runs from home. Her hardwork has permitted her to raise her two children and proviD. for their schooling. With this loan, she will buy corn so that she can sell some while reserving the other portion for the fast-approaching winter. She also wants to take advantage the current market value of corn.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra T. tiene 10 años D. dedicarse a la venta D. las tortillas considera que con los esfuerzos se pueD. salir adelante y a si lo ha demostrado, ya que inicio con la venta D. tortillas y actualmente a puesto una tienda en su misma casa D. la ganancia que le a ido quedando D. ella. Su esfuerzo a contribuido para poder sacar adelante a dos D. sus hijos y seguir dándole el estudio a los demás con el financiamiento ella comprara Maíz para poder vender y tener D. reserva para el invierno que pronto se acerca, y aprovechar los precio actuales en el mercado.

loans.use: Purchase of corn for distribution and production of tortillas

location.town: Final Colonia Jerusalen Contiguo a Ferrocaril  cal

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria Isabel M. is a woman with many strengths who has managed to expande her clothes-selling business in the town of León in Nicaragua.

She is very proud of being a grandmother: she already has a grandson who is her responsibility and to whom she is dedicated to caring for at all times. It is for this reason that she tries to work everyday in order to give support to her young daughter in the maintenance of her small son

Through 35 long years, Maria Isabel has undertaken this activity. She used to acquire clothes sporadically but at very high prices. For this reason she came to Ceprodel in order to receive help with loans and thus acquire the merchandise to then market and sell it.

It is necessary to stress that currently she has a record of 7 credits, all repaid on time and in the correct manner. These have been used to buy stock and to improve the quality of life for her, her daughter and her grandson.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Isabel M. es una dama que con muchos esfuerzos ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio de venta de ropa en la ciudad de León en Nicaragua.

Se siente muy orgullosa por ser abuela, ya que tiene un nieto a su responsabilidad que se dedica a cuidarlo en todo momento. Es por esta razón que busca la manera de trabajar todos los días por darle el apoyo a su joven hija para mantener a su pequeño hijo.

Desde hace 35 largos años se dedica a esta actividad. La ropa la adquiere esporádicamente pero a precios muy altos. Por tal razón es que acude a CEPRODEL para recibir apoyo crediticio y así adquirir la mercadería y luego comercializarla.

Es necesario destacar que actualmente tiene un total de 7 créditos pagados en tiempo y forma. Estos han sido destinados para la compra de los productos y mejora de la calidad de vida de ella, su hija y su nieto.

loans.use: Purchase clothes

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru:
Gulandom M. lives in the Yavan region. She is 28 years old, single and does not have children. She has a High School education. She is in the business of selling clothing. She has her own sales location on the market. She brings clothing for sale from the the city of Dushanbe and sells it in Yavan. Because she does not yet have her own family, she helps her parents. She has 12 years experience working in this business. She plans to use the obtained loan to purchase spring clothing for sale. Her business makes it possible for the locals to purchase the necessary articles of clothing locally and at an affordable price without having to spend a lot of money on the road. She plans to repay the loan in a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazu, Kiva volunteer

Музафарова Гуландом жительница Яванского района. Возраст 28 лет , не замужем, детей не имеет.Образование среднее. Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли одеждой. Имеет торговую точку на рынке в районе. Привозит товар из города Душанбе и реализует в Яване.Т.к своей семьи не имеет помогает родителям. Опыт в этом бизнесе 12 лет.Кредит планирует использовать для ввоза весеннего товара.Так же ее бизнес дает возможность населению покупать необходимые вещи у себя в районе по доступным ценам не затрачивая деньги на дорогу. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase spring clothing

loans.name: Gwali Mutala Women's Group

texts.en: Macrene, age 54, is the chairperson of Gwali Mutala Women’s Group in Kasanje. She is a farmer growing sweet potatoes and cassava on her family land; and at the same time she buys produce from other farmers, including bananas, Irish potatoes, tomatoes, and green pepper, which she takes to Kibuye farmers’ market every Wednesday for sale. She has been doing this with the help of her husband, who is also a farmer, for the past 20 years; and so far she is not regretting the path she took, especially with the loans she has been getting together with her members for 8 years now. Her dream is to buy a motorcycle to help her with the transportation of her produce from the villages, where she buys most of the produce. She is married with 8 children, the eldest being 35 years old and the youngest being 19. She also helps to look after 4 grandchildren who are still in school.

loans.use: Macrene intends to use the loan to buy more green bananas, Irish potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and green pepper so as to expand her business.

loans.name: Anna's Food Vending Group

texts.en:
Anna is 25 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 8 years old. She and her husband also take care of 3 other people, ages 49, 21and 8 years old. Anna owns a small food vending store and she is a clothes seller, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items and more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Edithar, who has business dealing in clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items and more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena has three children, two daughters ages 19 and 23, and one son age 28. Eight years ago she realized she needed to find work when she separated from her husband. The money he gave to the children didn't cover the family's expenses, and after a lot of time looking for work, Elena decided to start her own business selling used clothing. Little by little she has grown her business.

She is requesting a loan, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase more clothing to offer her customers and increase her income. Your contribution will help make this possible.

Elena, es madre de 3 hijos: 2 mujeres de 19, 23 y un varón de 28 años; desde hace 8 años se vio en la necesidad de buscar un trabajo debido a que se separo de su esposo, y con el dinero que le daban sus hijos, no le alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos familiares, después de mucho buscar decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de ropa usada, y fue así como poco a poco fueron incrementando sus ventas.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses, para surtir con ropa nueva para así tener más opciones para sus clientes, y tener un mayor ingreso. Con tu contribución Elena saldrá adelante.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE USED CLOTHING TO OFFER HER CUSTOMERS.

loans.name: Jorge Roman

texts.es:
Jorge is married and he has two grown up children who are also married.

He began his business seven years ago when he was made redundant from his job in a gas company following its restructuring and reorganisation. Needing to earn an income, he decided to use the knowledge and experience he had gained on security products to market and sell these products.

Jorge needs a loan for $975, repayable over six months, to remodel and redecorate his office premises to be able to convey a better and more professional image to his clients. With your support, he will be able to increase his revenue and grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Jorge es casado y tiene dos hijos, ya casados. El inicio su negocio hace 7 años al quedarse desempleado debido a un reajustado de la compañía de gas donde trabajaba, por lo que requeria de algun ingreso seguro, fue asi que decidio emprender su propio negocio, y al tenr conocimiento sobre los productos de seguridad decidio empezar con la comercializacion de dichos productos.

El necesita un prestamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar el local donde trabaja y tener una mejor imagen para sus clientes. Con tu apoyo Jorge hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Remodelling and Redecoration of business premises

loans.name: Fanta's Group

texts.fr:
The members of the Tiessiri 2 group are married women with an average of 28 years of age and 5 children. They live in polygamous families in the village of Sikouna 2 in the Fana area (Koulikoro region in Mali). The main activity of this group of women is the sale of wood for heating, charcoal (which they sell to peasants in Sikouna 2 and in surrounding villages) and various other items (gathering products, etc). They have a stock room for the charcoal or keep the wood in front of their joint sales stands. They generally sell the charcoal for cash or credit in the village or wholesale to buyers from big cities like Ségou and Bamako, who also come to the village to buy cargoes of heating wood. Linked by professional and friendship ties, and very experienced in the business, the members of the group decided to request their first group loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. They intend to buy 50 charcoal bags and 3 loads of heating wood and plan to attain an average monthly income of 12500FCFA, which will be used for paying the interest on the loan, providing for the needs of their families and especially for building their business activities.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Les membres du groupe Tiessiri 2 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’age de 28 ans et 5 enfants Elles vivent dans des familles polygames dans le village de Sikouna 2 sous préfecture de Fana( Région de Koulikoro République du Mali) L’activité principale de ce groupe de femmes Tiessiri 2 est la vente du bois de chauffe, du charbon de bois (qu’elles achètent avec les paysans sur place à Sikouna 2 et dans les villages environnants) et d’articles divers (produits de cueillettes etc.). Elles disposent d’un lieu de stockage dans pour le charbon de bois) ou devant (pour le bois de chauffe) les concessions conjugales pour le stockage de leurs marchandises. Elles vendent généralement le charbon de bois à détail au comptant et à crédit à domicile (au village) et en gros aux forains venant des grandes villes comme Ségou et Bamako, qui viennent également jusqu’au village pour faire leurs cargaisons en bois de chauffe au comptant. Unies par des liens professionnels, de voisinage et très expérimentés dans les activités économiques, les membres du groupe ont décidé ensemble de solliciter la collaboration de l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Elles comptent acheter 50 sacs de charbon de bois 3 chargements de bois de chauffe et envisagent réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12500FCFA. qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille et surtout renforcer les activités.

loans.use: Purchase of coal and heating wood

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is married with 5 children ages 19, 15, 5, 3, and 1. She has been a vegetable seller since 1998. Every day, she works from 8am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Rebeca now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Aramatoulaye Khassim

texts.fr: Aramatoulaye Khassim D., 48 ans, mariée, 8 enfants à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Néma Sobeya depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente d’huile de palme, de miel, de citron, de balais, de poisson et d’huître. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et d’aider ses proches.<b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Aramatoulaye Khassim D., 48, is married and has 8 children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank Néma Sobeya for 6 and a half years. She would like to bolster her business selling palm oil, honey, lemons, brooms, fish and oysters. Her income allows her to improve living conditions for her family and help those near and dear to her. She is asking for a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and resale of foodstuffs and brooms

loans.name: Mrs. Hou Channa's Village Bank Group

texts.en: The Village Bank loan, which is located in Au Da Village in Kampong Cham Province, consists of eight members and they plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Hou C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is 31 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local schoO.. She owns a small lake where she raises fish. Since she now has a lot of fish, she does not have enough money to buy enough food to feed them so she decided to ask for a loan to deal with this purpose. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Nak Pheak, is a construction worker who can earn less than $2 a day. Aside from this business, he is a breeder who raises four pigs.

loans.use: Hou would like to buy more food to feed her fish to sell and the rest of the group would like to improve their small businesses.

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đào Thị Vệ tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Hiện tại chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con đã trưởng thành tại huyện Ninh Giang tỉnh Hải Dương. Hàng ngày ngoài chăn nuôi và trồng trọt  chị Vệ đi  buôn bán hoa quả tại chợ, chồng chị ở nhà đan cót bán cho người dân địa phương. Do chăm chỉ và biết cách làm ăn nên sau 5 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương hiện tại kinh tế gia đình chị Vệ đã có sự phát triển rõ rệt. Với mức thu nhập khá ổn định từ buôn bán, chăn nuôi  ngoài việc hoàn trả và chi tiêu trong gia đình chị Vệ còn đầu tư sửa sang  được nhà cửa, mua được xe máy phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh buôn bán của gia đình.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000, một phần chị đầu tư mua 30 bó tre nứa phục vụ cho công việc đan cót của chồng, số còng lại chị sẽ sử dụng để đầu tư thêm vốn vào kinh doanh hoa quả phát triển kinh tế gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Dao Thi V. joined TYM Fund in 2003. She is living with her husband and her two grown-up children in Ninh Giang town, Hai Duong province. Mrs. V. breeds poultries and plants fruits at home, and then sells them in the market. Her husband makes baskets at home and sells them for people in the town. After fiV. years of membership, her family’s income has become much more stable. She has been able to renovate her house and buy motorbike to facilitate the family’s business. In the next round of loan, Mrs. V. would like to borrow 6.000.000 VND ($375), part of which will be used to buy bamboo for her husband to make baskets; the rest will be invested in flowers to sell in the market.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort D. is married and has 2 children. She completed senior high school. Comfort sells pharmaceuticals at Abandze near Abura, which she has done since 1997. Her husband is a pharmacist. Comfort uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Comfort will use the loan to buy more, better-quality products to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to invest in their children's education.

loans.use: To buy more, better-quality products to sell.

loans.name: Thul's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thul P. is a group leader of four members who all live in Khnong village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Thul P. and her husband, Mr. Chhai Chhon, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn their living. In this plantation, they can gather only a little rice revenue which cannot support the family well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Thul P. decided to ask for a loan to buy piece of land to cultivate to expand her rice revenue. Mrs. Thul P. is 37 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child four years old.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy piece of land to cultivate to expand her rice revenue.

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en:
Choeurn R. is 52 years old and is a rice farmer. Her husband is a village chief who earns a salary of $40 per month. Choeurn R. and her husband have eight children; four are married and no longer live at home, while two are employed as garment factory workers and two others are students.

Choeurn R. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike for her family’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma has been a firewood seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for the past 2 years. She belongs to the Hatuyumbishwi loan group (Group code 2025). She currently makes an average monthly profit of $40. Every day she works for 14 hours.  She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and to save money for future use.

Fatma is 45 years old, divorced, and has six children: ages between 26 and 17.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for her business.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Albertina L. se dedica a su negocio de venta de mecates y por no tener un establecimiento propio, vende en las afueras expuesta en ocasiones al sol y al trabajo duro.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los mecates ya que requiere adquirirlos lo más pronto posible para su venta. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente y sale adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, Albertina L. has a business selling rope. Because she does not have her own shop, she sells in exposed places outdoors, at times in the sun and working very hard.

Now she has turned to Ceprodel with the aim of receiving a loan for the purchase of rope, as she needs to obtain it as quickly as possible for its sale. She will benefit tremendously with this loan, and make progress in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of rope

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane M. is currently in the business of selling rice,dale and beans at the hotel and is requesting a loan to buy fans and a generator for the provision of fresh air in the hotel .  Jane is twenty-five years old. Her husband is employed as a nurse. She has two children and both of them go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, Jane hopes to be able to open up a supermarket.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy fans and a generator to provide fresh air in the hotel

loans.name: Yusufjon

texts.ru: Юсуфчону 35 лет.Он женат и уже имеет 5-ро детей. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, нянчит детей и по мере возможности кормит скот. Юсуфчон занимается откормом и продажей скота. Начало весны для Юсуфчона – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что скот сейчас стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. Скот ест горную траву, и Юсуфчон не покупает для скота сено. Через 4 месяца наступает священный месяц Рамазан, и городские люди начинают покупать скот. Вот тогда, Юсуфчон продаст свой скот.
texts.en:
Yusufjon is 35 years old. He is married and already has 5 children. His wife does not have a job. She stays at home and takes care of the house, raises the children and feeds the livestock when she is able. Yusufjon fattens and sells livestock. The start of spring is the season for purchasing livestock for Yusufjon, because it is currently cheap. He also does not need to spend a lot to fatten the livestock. The livestock eats mountain grass and Yusufjon does not purchase hay for it. In 4 months starts the holy month of Ramadan and city residents start to purchase livestock. Then Yusufjon will sell his livestock.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Buvoisho

texts.en:
Buvoisho O., a married mother of four children, has for many years been involved in the cattle-raising business. This noble work that she inherited from her parents fills her with happiness and satisfaction, and thanks to the care and dedication she offers each one of her animals, they reproduce quickly. With the sale of the animals, she can better the economic situation of her family, and most importantly, offer the possibility of completing higher education to her children. Buvoisho and her husband, who also works in this business, wish to keep increasing their quantity and variety of animals to better their quality of life and secure their plans. Both are requesting a loan that will allow them to fulfill their objectives in a short time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle in order to expand the business.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha C. sells beans, green vegetables, and flour and is requesting a loan to stock more beans and flour to sell. She is 39 years old and married to a driver. Tabitha has three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for the family to live in. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more beans and flour to sell

loans.name: Maria Naid

texts.es: Maria Naid C. D. B. resiD. en La Herradura ubicado en departamento D. La Paz. Maria tiene 64 años D. edad, vive con su familia compuesta por su esposo, su nuera y una nieta. El esposo D. Maria trabaja D. pescador, obtiene ingresos mensuales D. 100$, es por ello que Maria busco otra manera para generar dinero ya que no eran suficientes lo ingresos D. su esposo y fue así como puso su negocio que es una tienda con productos D. primera necesidad. Maria solicita este crédito para surtir su tienda y así lograr mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria Naid C. D. B. lives in the department of La Paz. She is 64 years old and lives with her family—her husband, daughter-in-law, and a granddaughter. Maria’s husband is a fisherman whose monthly income is $100.00. For this reason, Maria sought another way to make money because her husband’s salary was insufficient, so that is why she set up her general store in which she sells basic need items. Maria is requesting this loan to increase inventory, thus boosting sales.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock general store

loans.name: Anna Ruby

texts.en: Anna Ruby R. is from the village of Labuyo, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Anna Ruby owns and operates a business providing dress-making services to local community members. Anna Ruby has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Anna Ruby joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Math A. is a widowed mother of fifty-two years who is blessed with four children: two are single and two are married and live separately.

Math A. is currently buying and selling used-goods to earn a living. One of her single children is assisting her in the business operation. At the moment, Math A. uses her wheelbarrow to serve as her business transportation. She proposes to use her loan money to buy a motorbike to connect to her existing cart. This new system will allow her to transport more used-goods more quickly. She and her daughter are pictured.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to connect to her existing cart

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Anthonia is 41 years old, married and has four children. She makes a living selling hair extensions and cream, and is also a hair stylist. She has been in this business since 1993 in Lagos, where she lives. She is very happy and grateful to Kiva for its financial help in these hard times. Anthonia has applied for a loan to buy more hair extensions and cream to sell, and thanks Kiva participants for their support.

loans.use: To buy more hair extension and cream to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sonia Caridad

texts.es: Sonia Caridad P. D. F. resiD. en la capital del país en unos D. los municipios más poblados Soyapango. Sonia tiene 46 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos uno D. ellos es empleado y el otro se encuentra estudiando en la universidad. Sonia se dedica a la venta D. productos D. perfumería, cremas corporales, zapatos entre otros; Sonia posee una clientela ya establecida y obtiene un buen margen D. ganancia. El crédito que solicita para invertirlo en productos nuevos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia Caridad P. D. F. lives in Soyapango, one of the most populated municipalities in the capital of the country. Sonia is 46. She lives with her husband and their two children. One of the children is employed, and the other is attending the university. Sonia sells perfume products, body creams, shoes, and other things. Sonia has an established customer base, and she has a good margin of earnings. The loan she is asking for is to buy new products for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her inventory

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the KDC borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is 39 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are aged 13,11,7, and 4 years old. She also cares for other 2 dependents.

Elizabeth has owned a tailoring business for 3 years. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Elizabeth`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more materials for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Elizabeth hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more materilas

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick W. is 40 years old and married with three children. He has a poultry farm where he incubates chicks then sells to customers from the outskirts of Kinoo center, which is highly populated. He has never borrowed from another MFI and was introduced to KADET by a friend. He has applied for a loan which he wants to use to acquire incubators that will hold up to 1000 chicks at a time. He hopes to be a major supplier of chicks in the area and also to other big poultry firms.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To buy more chick incubators

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy timber in bulk

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel C. is from the village of Zone 1, Camarahan, Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 33 years old. Ariel is single. To make a living, Ariel makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling grilled meat such as chicken legs, chicken feet, chicken intestines, pork, chicken liver, etc. in the local community. Ariel has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ariel joined HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Ariel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Ariel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan S., 28, is married. She resides in Kandal Province, Cambodia with her husband. To make a living, she and her husband grow specific types of vegetables such as beans and salads to serve the market’s demand, earning collectively an income of US $10 per day. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. This primary source of income helps cover the household expenses. Mrs. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase construction materials to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to repair the house

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 49 years old. She has four kids who are currently in school. She trades in maize in the local market in her community. She requests a loan to enable her to buy more maize to grow her business and scale up sales. She says her major challenge is getting herself a container shop where she can sell her stock.  She hopes to increase her savings to acquire a shop.

loans.use: To purchase maize in bulk.

loans.name: Rosenne

texts.en: Rosenne has been doing tailoring for the last nine years. She makes dresses, tablecloths and also sells material. She is married and has two children. Her husband is also a businessman. Her customers are mostly ladies. Her major challenge is the seasonality in demand for clothes. She is borrowing KES 70,000 to restock her business with clothing and to buy a new sewing machine in preparation for the festive season. She is visionary and hardworking and wants to have a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials and a sewing machine

loans.name: Claudia Luz

texts.es:
La señora  Claudia Luz C. se dedica a la venta de verduras y carnes, esta actividad la realiza en un carrito estirado por un caballo, sale todas las mañanas bien temprano a repartir los productos, ya tiene su clientela  formada, con este trabajo mantiene  a sus 4 hijos, ella realiza este trabajo con su marido , Con este trabajo  dignifica a su familia, pues a todos sus hijos les ofrece estudio y un hogar donde vivir.
La misma se dedica a esta actividad hace bastante tiempo y para mejorar las condiciones de su trabajo recurrió a la Fundación ya que ella no cuenta con  garantías reales para poder acceder  un crédito y por eso agradece a la Fundación por la ayuda  que la misma le ha brindada.
texts.en:
Claudia Luz C. sells vegetables and meats from a horse-drawn cart. She goes out very early every morning to deliver her products to her regular customers. She does this work together with her husband. With their income, they maintain four children, and are able to offer them schooling and a place to live.

Claudia has been running this business for a good while and to improve her work conditions she turns to Fundación Paraguaya because she has no collateral for getting a loan. She is grateful for the help.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, peppers, lettuce, tomatoes, carrots, eggs, garlic, meat, apples, oranges, pineapples, grapes, mangos, etc.

loans.name: Vaivao

texts.en:
Vaivao T. is 30 and married with 3 children (ages 5 - 13years).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  Vaivao has 4 years of experience in this business.  Vaivao needs a loan of WST $750 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 110 tala or US $46 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Vaivao joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Vaivao's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Vaivao T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.5 out of 3

You can view pictures of a typical vegetable garden in Samoa, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at:   http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/VegetableGarden#

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Chan Thoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Chan Thoeun L. is 27 years old and she lives in Chong Angkar village, Takeo province. She lives with her spouse and they have two children, one of whom is a student in the local school; the younger child is 2 years old. Mrs. Chan Thoeun L. and her husband, Mr. Saem Soeun, are farmers who own 4-hectare field to cultivate rice on. In this farming, Mrs. Chan Thoeun L. needs 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to buy supplies for a pump, gasoline, fertilizer, and pesticide. She plans to use the rest of the loan to pay for laborers to dig a well to support the field. Aside from being a farmer, she is a scarf weaver who can earn a small income to support the family. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a pump, gasoline, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Annick

texts.fr: Annick D. est âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Depuis 4 ans elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Mboro et y a bénéficié de 8 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Elle fait un petit commerce tissus et d'effets de toilettes. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale et la scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en:
Annick D. is 39 years old, she is married and the mother of 5 children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Mboro for the past 4 years and has received 8 loans from the organization, all of which were fully repaid on time. She has a small business selling cloth and toiletries. Her goal is to help her husband pay for the needs of their family and their children's tuition.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow her business.

loans.name: Kalyskan Tagaeva`s Group

texts.en:
Kalyskan is 39 years old. She is divorced and has one son. He is a college student. She has been involved in a sewing business for more than 10 years. At present time, this is her main income of source. At the first stage, she rented a sewing machine. Later she had some savings and bought a sewing and overstitching machine. She mainly sews curtains and women's garments. She is asking for her first loan to buy sewing materials. 

Monuskan and Kalyskan are sisters. Monuskan, 37, is married with three children. Her husband is a foremaster. She is involved in animal breeding. She has cows, horses and sheep. This loan will be used to buy additional cattle. 

Kubatbek, 36, is married. His wife is a housewife and mainly looks after the animals. They have cows, horses and eight sheep. He wants a loan to buy five sheep. The increase in cattle will let her increase her overall family income. 

Zulayka is a widow. She has three sons. They always help their mother with the housework. She breeds animals. She started her business just two years ago with two sheep. Now she has three cows, two calves and two sheep. This is because of her hard work and enterprenurial skills. She hopes to increase the number of sheep, using this loan.
 
This is the first loan for all members of this group. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials

loans.name: Borhanudin Group

texts.en:
Husina is the group leader of the Borhanudin group. She is single and lives in district 11 in Kabul, Afghanistan. 
She lives in a household of five members and she is responsible for paying for the house rent and school fees of her sisters. 
She has a small tailoring business in her house and all her family members benefit through the income she generates.
She needs the loan to purchase a new machine, fabric and different kinds of needles and threads.
She hopes to expand her business and to open a shop instead of working in the house.

loans.use: To purchase a new machine for her tailoring business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina C. is a young and hardworking mother of three children whose ages range from 6 to 9 years old. She has been a productive partner to her husband, who is a driver, by having her own businesses. She fattens hogs/pigs and has a “sari-sari” (variety) store. 

These businesses were put up and maintained through the loans she has accessed through ASHI, a Kiva partner. The proceeds of these businesses are a great source for providing her family, including her 68-year-old father and 25-year-old brother, with their basic needs. Though it is small, it is helping her and her family a lot. 

Despite poverty, Gina became hopeful that one day, she will be reaching her dreams by growing her business and having stable profits. With that, she is requesting another loan from ASHI to start another business, which is cattle fattening. Together with the hogs, the cattle will be sold either alive or slaughtered at the public market or to the people in their village.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for fattening

loans.name: Kabidolda

texts.en: Kabidolda is 62 years old and lives with his wife and son in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife, Sameriy, is 58 years old and retired. His 27-year-old son, Asilbek, is an accountant in a local library. Currently, Kabidolda operates a transportation business with a microbus that he owns. He transports his customers to and from many different areas. Kabidolda has been operating his business since 2008 and operated a variety of businesses between 2000 and 2008. He received three loans so far from Xacbank. In his first loan, he did not pay his loan on time because his two children were students at that time and he had  to pay his two children's university fees. But he is a very open and enthusiastic person. Kabidolda says, “It would be great if I could sell my current car and purchase new car for my business.” He is requesting a 1,100,000 tugrug (~  785 USD) loan to purchase a new engine to change his broken down engine for his car.

loans.use: To purchase an engine

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkola, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Tiontala, sous préfecture de Massigui, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté et font le commerce de céréales et d’habits.
Ces femmes du groupe Benkola sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des céréales auprès des producteurs du  village  et environnants.  
Mariam Sidibé qui connaît le secteur du commerce de céréales dans lequel elle évolue depuis plusieurs années, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  trois sacs de 100kg des céréales. 
Elle s’approvisionne en céréales le plus généralement à Massigui et à Dioïla et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Massigui et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
All the women of the group Benkola are married and average 40 years of age and three children each. They live in traditional extended families in Tiontala, sub-prefecture of Massigui, Region of Koulikoro, in the 2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.  They know one another though ties of community and kinship, and they work in the commerce of grains and clothing.  The women in the group are on their third solidarity loan, which will be used for buying grains from producers in and around the village.  Mariam Sidibé, who is familiar with the business of grains in which she has been working for several years, intends to use her loan for buying three 100-kg sacks of grain.  She stocks up for the most part in Massigui and in Dioïla, and she sells retail, locally at the market. And she accepts cash and credit from a customer base composed of women and men. She plans on making an average monthly profit of 300,000 francs CFA that will be used for covering day-to-day family expenses, and the rest will be reinvested in business. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying grains

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr: Née en 1956 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, K. Joséphine vit depuis vingt six ans environs à Agbalilamè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Joséphine est mariée à WATCHINOU Antoine et est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Joséphine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Joséphine n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Joséphine vend des condiments de sauce (oignons, piments, gingembre, légumes, etc.) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Joséphine vend du maïs. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi au marché de Abattoir à Cotonou, que Joséphine achète ses produits. Joséphine a déjà quinze ans d'expérience dans l'exercice de son activité, et a déjà obtenu quatre prêts de ALIDé.Joséphine a bien effectué le remboursement de ces crédits. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Joséphine souhaite rehausser le niveau de son activité et mieux faire face à la demande des clients ; raison pour laquelle Joséphine sollicite un cinquième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1956 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Josephine K. has been living in Agabalilamè, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, for 26 years. She is married to Antoine Watchinou and is the mother of three children, all of whom go to school. Josephine lives together with her husband and children. The couple takes care of the family budget jointly. Josephine never attended school. In order to support herself, she sells condiments for sauces (onions, chili peppers, ginger, vegetables etc) out of her home. In addition, she also sells corn. She purchases her stock in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin as well at the Butcher’s Market in Cotonou. She has 15 years of experience in this business, and had obtained four ALIDé loans in the past. Josephine has always repaid her loans properly. Facing the growing customer numbers, she would like to expand her business and better meet the demand, which is why she is seeking her fifth loan.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing condiments [for resale]

loans.name: Rosa Avelina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa D. es socia del banco comunal Corazón de Jesús, vive en la parroquia el Valle comunidad el Despacho, en su mayor parte su población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería pero los jóvenes han migrado a la ciudad en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo.

Nuestra socia tiene 44 años de vida, es una mujer viuda,  su esposo murió dominado por el alcohol, hace dos año, en su unión conyugal ha procreado 5 hijos los cuales tienen 22, 20, 18, 16, 15, años de edad, su hijo de 22 años trabaja como ayudante de albañil el cual le ayuda a su mamá económicamente, la hija de 20 años trabaja en un restaurante y  realiza sus estudios a distancia los días domingos; su hijo de 18 años luego de mucho luchar finalmente se ha graduado en el SECAP; el otro hijo de 16años por el momento está estudiando en el colegio; y finalmente su hija de 15 años trabaja como niñera y estudia los días sábados, toda esta familia vive en unos pequeños cuartos que han construido en los terrenos de su padre.

La señora Rosa trabaja en su casa realizando los quehaceres domésticos, también se dedica ala cría de cerdos y de aves domesticas. Es socia de nuestra institución por un periodo de 7 ciclos, y así ha podido  incrementar la cantidad de animales, para luego venderlos y así satisfacer sus necesidades diarias. Con el nuevo crédito que recibe por parte de la fundación ESPOIR lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos y pollos. El sueño más deseado por nuestra socia es de tener una casita propia donde poder vivir con toda su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa D. is a member of the communal bank "Corazón de Jesús." She lives in the El Valle parish of the community of Despacho. There the majority of the population works in agriculture and livestock, but the younger ones have migrated to the city to look for better work opportunities. Rosa is 44 years old and is a widow. Her husband died 2 years ago of alcoholism. Their marriage produced 5 children, who are now 22, 20, 18, 16,and 15 years old. Her oldest son works as an mason's assistant, and helps his mother economically. Her 20 year old daughter works in a restaurant, and also is completing distance studies during each Sunday. Her 18 year-old son, after a long struggle, finally graduated from SECAP. The other son, who is 16, is currently studying in secondary school. Finally, her 15 year-old daughter works in child care and studies on Saturdays. The whole family lives in small rooms that were built on their father's lands. Rosa works in the home carrying out household chores, and she also raises pigs and poultry. She has been a member of our institution for 7 loan cycles, and in this way she has been able to increase the number of animals that she has, so that she can later sell them and support herself. With the new loan that she is receiving from the fundación ESPOIR, she will invest in the purchase of pigs and chicken. Her biggest dream is to have her own little house where she could live with her whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria P., 55, is widow from the village of Antipolo, Dapitan City. She is 55 years old. Apolinaria has 11 adult-aged children.  To make a living, Apolinaria raises crops, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  Apolinaria has been in business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,900 PHP a month.

In 2008, Apolinaria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Apolinaria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,500 PHP from PMPC.  Apolinaria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her living conditions. 

-------------------------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Hugo Orlando

texts.es:
Hugo de 36 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil(zona urbana, su originalidad fue que habían muchas flores Orquídeas), el tiene una tienda de vivirse, vende todo tipos de alimentos como arroz, cereales, bebidas etc. 

Antes de tener su tienda el tuvo un puesto de comida de “fritadas” (comida típica del Ecuador, con chancho, mote y cebollas). Con unos ahorros que el tenia decidio comprar unos víveres y venderlos para pasar mas tiempo con sus dos hijos, por esa buena decisión ahora tiene una tienda de víveres, trabaja desde las 05h30ma hasta las 22h00pm todos los días.     

Para poder tener mas ingresos en su casa el quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, bebidas, enlatados para su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener un local de comidas rápidas.
texts.en:
Hugo is 36 years old and lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil, an urban area where many orchids once grew. He has a general store where he sells all types of food such as rice, cereals, beverages, and other items.

Prior to having his store, Hugo operated a food stand where he sold “fritadas” (a traditional Ecuadorian dish made of pork, corn, and onions). Using his savings, he decided to buy a few provisions to sell so that he could spend more time with his two children. This turned out to be a good decision because he now has his own store where he works every day from 5:30am to 10pm.

In order to generate more household income he wants to use this loan to buy rice, beverages, and canned goods for his store. In the future he wants to open a fast food shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, beverages, and canned goods

loans.name: Havila Group

texts.es:
El grupo Havilas lo conforman Yahoska M., Olga R. y Ana María C. tres féminas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora es M. comerciante de ropa usada y nueva negocio que inicio hace dos años.
Las otras integrantes Olga R. comercializa cosméticos de distintas marcas y Ana María C. tiene una pequeña fritanga restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita y vende ropa.
texts.en:
The "Havilas" group is formed by Yahoska M., Olga R. and Ana María C., three dedicated, hardworking and enterprising women. The coordinator is M., who sells new and used clothing, a business that she started 2 years ago. The other members are Olga R., who sells a variety of brands of cosmetics, and Ana Maria C., who has a small restaurant where she sells fried food and also sells clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina A. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 54 years-old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Edwina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Edwina has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Edwina joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edwina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Edwina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mr. Moeun Kruoch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Moeun K., 53, is married with four children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory while the others are laborers. His wife, Mrs. Saroum Hun, is employed by a private company. Moeun is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land upon which he cultivates rice to sell. He also raises pigs. The family lives in Prey Chheu Teal village in Takeo province.

Moeun was selected as the village’s bank president by its other twenty-four members who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes. Moeun’s problem is that his field is not fertile. To improve his production, he is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire both a plowing machine and farm laborers. With the rest of the loan he will buy more piglets.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire a plowing machine and laborers

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeurn S. is 30 years old, married, and has two children who attend the local public school. She owns a small shop in her village where she sells food and fruits to her nearby neighbors. She typically makes around $4 profit each day to meet her family's needs. Her husband works as a porter in the busy market.
Oeurn S. normally hires a motor taxi to travel to and from the market where she buys items for her business. She hopes to have a vehicle, which will allow her to travel without hiring taxis. To achieve her goal, Oeurn S. is requesting a loan to purchase a used motorbike. Any remaining cash from the loan will be used to increase her capital.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buying inventory for food market sales

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida.  Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Carmen es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de cumplir y los intereses son muy bajos. Ella tiene 62 años de edad, esta separada hace varios años y de esta relación tuvo 6 hijos ya todos mayores de edad y solo uno de ellos vive con ella.

Tiene un comedor en el centro, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 5am hasta las 14h00 y los sábados y domingos desde las 4am hasta las 20h00, trabaja con la ayuda de su hijo, dice que la gente la prefiere ya que cocina delicioso y por eso tiene muchos clientes, su especialidad es el pescado hornado.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar materiales para la preparación de sus deliciosos platos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local mas amplio y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The community bank Health and Life meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This town is known for its traditional culture and also for being a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province such as San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Ms. Carmen is a founding member of the community bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make and the interest rates are very low. She is 62 years old and has been separated for several years.  From this relationship she had 6 children.  All are adults now and only one of them lives with her.

She has a restaurant downtown and works Monday through Friday from 5:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. and on Saturdays and Sundays from 4:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.  She works with the help of her son. She says that people prefer her because of her delicious cooking and that is why she has many clients. Her specialty is baked fish. 

She will use this loan to purchase materials to prepare her delicious dishes. 
 
Her dream is to have a larger location and to continue working.

loans.use: Purchase fish, rice, potatoes, yucca, etc.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 48 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 23 años posee una tienda de abarrotes, hace mucho años empezó en el negocio vendiendo de manera ambulante, pero hoy tiene un puesto de ventas dentro de un mercado cerca de su casa. Es así que atiende todas las mañanas a sus clientes y algunas horas después del almuerzo. Ella siempre esta pendiente de su negocio, por tanto procura mantenerla surtida de productos, eso hace que su negocio tenga estabilidad, permitiéndole a la vez sostener a su familia y no descuidar a sus hijos. Por el momento desea seguir trabajando en su negocio adquiriendo más mercadería. Es su crédito número 14 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita, puesto que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería ya que se acercan  fechas importantes donde sus ventas aumentarán.
texts.en: Antonia is 48 years old and lives with her three children in their own home. For the last 23 years she has had a grocery store.
