Many years ago she started the business with travelling sales, but today she has a store in a market near her house.  This is how she tends to her customers every morning and for a few hours after lunch.  She is devoted to her business, so she manages to keep it stocked with products, which makes her business stable, allowing her to both support her family and not neglect her children. For the moment, she wants to keep working in her business acquiring more merchandise. This is her 14th loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has a financial support. In addition, she is grateful to be part of her communal bank, because all its members are responsible people and very supportive. She is also grateful to all the people that will fund the loan she is seeking, since it will be very useful in the further development of her business. She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of more merchandise, since important dates are coming up during which her sales will increase.

loans.use: To stock up on basic products

loans.name: Edidt

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Edidt; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de muebles, ella hace diferentes tipos de muebles como mesas, sillas, camas y después lo vende en la feria de muebles que se llama mercamueble, ella atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar madera al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Edidt is a member of the Communal Bank “Mercamueble”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 33 years old, in a common law marriage, and has four children. Edidt divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling furniture. She makes different types of furniture such as tables, chairs, and beds and then sells them at the furniture fair called “Mercamueble”. Yolanda works from 8am to 6pm. She wants to improve her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy wood in bulk.

Edidt is grateful to those who have helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase wood in bulk

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru: Баротов Курбонали проживает в районе Восе. Возраст, 40 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Более 8 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: B. Kurbonali lives in the Vose region. He's forty years old, married and has four children. He has a high school level of education and has bred cattle for over eight years. Generally, he fattens the cattle and then sells it for profit. He's asking for a loan to acquire some more cattle.

loans.use: To buy some cattle

loans.name: John Nganga

texts.en:
John Nganga M. is a 42-year-old businessman. He is married to Elizabeth, and they are blessed with two children. He is in the transport business and has owned a retail shop for the last six years. This will be his fifth loan from KADET.  

With his loan, he plans to purchase beans, rice, maize, and sugar. He will direct the anticipated profits into the expansion of his business.  John’s dream is to expand his transport business through the addition of more motorbikes.

loans.use: To purchase beans, rice, maize, and sugar

loans.name: Miriam Margot

texts.es:
Miriam es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, un distrito caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de sus clientes concentrados en zonas rurales que distan mucho entre sí, sus principales actividades económicas son la agricultura y el comercio, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de tres años a la venta de prendas de vestir. Ella vende uniformes, buzos, zapatos y ropa en general a sus clientes, Miriam ofrece sus productos de acuerdo a la temporada del año y adquiere su mercadería en las tiendas confeccionadoras de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Gracias al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad, Miriam ha llegado a tener clientes fieles que a su vez han promocionado su negocio, lo que ha generado que cuente con una clientela estable. Actualmente desea adquirir capital para empezar a solicitar sus pedidos en las tiendas de Chiclayo y surtir su negocio con más mercadería, por ello ha creído conveniente  solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Miriam ya ha tenido un préstamo financiado por el fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla, en aquella oportunidad ella pudo ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mercadería para la temporada escolar, lo cual le generó bastantes ingresos con los cuales su familia pudo salir adelante, ella se encuentra contenta y  agradece a todas las personas que le ayudaron a sacar adelante a su negocio.
texts.en:
Miriam is a mother, she is 44 years old and she lives together with her family in the district of Olmos. The region is known for its population that mostly resides in rural areas with great distances between them. The main businesses are agriculture and commerce and the region belongs to the province of Lambayeque. It is one hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

For the past three years she has been selling clothing. She sells uniforms, sweaters, shoes, and general clothing items to her clients. Miriam sells clothing that is appropriate for the season. She acquires her merchandise from stores in the city of Chiclayo. 

Miriam has had a Kiva loan in the past through Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) and its allied company Capital Semilla.  With the help of the first loan she was able to expand her business with the acquisition of merchandise in time for the new school year. This generated substantial earnings and it was of great benefit to her family. She is very happy and she is grateful to all those individuals that have helped her turn her business into a success.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE ETERNO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maria D. Carmen; La socia tiene 53 años de edad, es casada; la socia tiene 3 hijos, las socia trabaja en su librería cristiana, ella elabora también manualmente todo tipo de arte con motivo de la religión cristiana y empastan libros y canticos, la socia apertura hace muy poco su librería y está muy eiz de haberlo logrado a su edad, según ella manifiesta, la socia ahora solicita el préstamo para poder implementar su librería con los últimos acabados que siempre se requiere y la adquisición de libros que le están enviando de la capital. La socia solicita el préstamo para la adquisición de libros cristianos para implementar su librería.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
María D. Carmen, 53, is a member of the “PADRE ETERNO" (Eternal Father) communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco department.

She is married and has three children.  She works in her Christian bookstore and also does Christian-themed religious crafts and binds books and hymnals.  She opened her bookstore a short while ago and is very happy to have done so at her age, as she states.

She now needs a loan to do the final finishing touches to the bookstore and to stock her store with books that are being sent to her from the capital. She is requesting a loan to acquire Christian books to stock her bookstore.

She is happy with the granted loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy Christian books to stock her bookstore.

loans.name: Tahmina's Group

texts.en:
Tahmina D. is the leader of this group. She is 28 and married. Her husband works as an electrician. Together they bring up two sons and  both sons are preschool age (under seven). Tahmina works as a chief specialist in the Regional Department. Two years ago with the initial investment of 20000 soms the family started to breed livestock.  By reselling livestock after fattening they earn additional 2000 soms per month. Tahmina applied for the loan because she needs additional money to purchase furniture in order to improve the family’s living conditions.

 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Reyna Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Reyna Cecilia tiene 46 años, tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad. Ella brinda negocio de transporte, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, sin embargo fue con el tiempo que logro obtener su taxi propio, con los ahorros que obtuvo, lo cual le ha brindado una mayor estabilidad económica ya que ahora las ganancias son para pagos y gastos de su familia. el crédito que está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de realizar unas compras de artículos para el vehículo, ya que necesita algunas reparaciones. Actualmente, al igual que todo el sector transporte está enfrentando el desafío de mantener los precios y las ganancias, pese a la alta inestabilidad del combustible, lo cual hace que cada día sea más cara la canasta básica y todos los artículos.
texts.en: Señora Reyna Cecilia is 46 years old and she has two adult children. Reyna has a transportation business and she has ten years of experience. Without a doubt, it took time to save enough so that she could own her own taxi, now her savings have helped her to establish greater economic stability and now she has the ability to cover payments and family expenses. The loan that Reyna is seeking is to buy a part for her taxi as the car already needs repair. In reality, the entire transportation sector is facing the challanges of maintaining profits with the instability of fuel prices, which are more expensive every for even the lowest grade.

loans.use: Working capital: auto parts

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a 51-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  a sari-sari (general) store and copra. She lives in the municipality of Brooke's Point, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari (general) store and copra businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 12,500. Elvira is now borrowing PHP 13,000 so that she could purchase more stock. This will be her 23rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Elvira aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business and buy more seeds for his land

loans.name: Estrellieta

texts.en:
Estrellieta C. is from the village of Sta.Cruz, Jimenz, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old. Estrellieta is widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Estrellieta owns & operates a general store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Estrellieta has been engaged in her business for over 43 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Estrellieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrellieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Estrellieta is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase rice and corn grits to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Estrellieta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits to sell

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a Transportation (Tricycle) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy tricycle spare parts for her transportation (Tricycle) business.

Janeth has been in this business for five years. Janeth earns more income buying and selling mahogany seeds.

Janeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy tricycle spare parts

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a young man from Deir Al Balah in the Gaza Strip. Saleh is a barber who works in his father's shop as his father is old and can't work anymore. Saleh's income must also cover the parents' household expenses.

Saleh took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a new shaving kit, creams, towels and hygienic items that are necessary and will help him offer better service to customers.

Saleh appears in his shop with one of the customers.

loans.use: to purchase shaving kit, towels and other needed items.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 6 años de edad, él trabaja desde hace 10 años en las actividades agrícolas, todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo el cual invertirá en abono y fertilizantes, el préstamo le ayudara a asegurarse con todos los insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz y frijol.
Él tiene como objetivo cada años mejorar sus cultivos, trabajar por recibir buenas cosechas y de esta manera sacar adelante a su hijo en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Concepción lives in San Rafael Oriente, San Miguel Department.  He’s a farmer living with his wife and 6-year-old son.  He’s worked in farming for the last ten years every day from 6am until 3pm.

He needs a loan to buy manure and fertilizer.  With the loan he will be sure to have all the necessary supplies for his corn and bean crops.

His ultimate goal yearly is to improve his crops, to work towards attaining good harvests in order to support the family and help his son with his schooling.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Elsa works hard to support her family. 

She has a shell crafting business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling tropical fish. Elsa is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy materials for her shell crafting business. 

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shell crafting business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 25 years old. 

Josephine is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del sur. She has been growing rice for 10 years. She also owns and manages a sari-sari store. She sells various items like soap and shampoo. Josephine earns 15,000 PHP per month from her businesses.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes to lift her family from the difficulties of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two school-age children. He has been working in the jewelry industry for more than 10 years. He works from his house. His work is specialized in producing jewelry, polishing them, and fixing the wrecked ones. He is well known for his high quality, handmade jewelry. His wife also works to support the family. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1300 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase additional jewelry products. He is sure that the loan will help him increase his profits by a significant percentage.

loans.use: to purchase additional jewelry products.

loans.name: Jorge Raul

texts.es: Jorge nació en la ciudad de Arequipa (Perú) y tiene 38 años de edad. Actualmente, Jorge vive en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Jorge tiene su taller donde confecciona de chompas de lana de alpaca. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Jorge  requiere el préstamo para comprar fibra de alpaca.  El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Chaska Ñawi” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Jorge was born in the city of Arequipa (Peru) and is 38 years old.  He now lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Jorge has a workshop where he makes sweaters from alpaca wool.  He has had this business for 3 years and it is going very well, thanks to the effort that he puts into his work.  At this time, Jorge needs a loan to buy alpaca fiber.  Jorge is a responsible and hardworking person; because of these qualities, his friends invited him to participate in the communal bank "Chaska Ñawi” in the Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy alpaca fiber

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is 41 years old, married and has six children. Her eldest son left his education after 10th and started working in a factory. Her second son also works in a factory. Her third and youngest sons are able to continue their education. 

Her husband operates a plant-selling business. He is very fair in his prices and deals with his clients in a professional manner. He has good number of business contacts and meets their requirements. 

Razia is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities very well. Part time, she also sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very good at her work and receives a good number of orders every month.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s plant selling business. With the loan, he will buy plants of different kinds that will allow him to make more sales and earn better profits. 

He has been doing this business for the past 10 years and Razia hopes that an investment will bring very good changes to his business and improve the life style of her family.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy plants to sell

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is 47 years old and lives in Paynesville. She attended school, attaining 11th grade. She is married and her husband is a teacher. They have four children two of whom live at home and attend school. Musu sells dried goods, mainly foodstuffs and charcoal, from a table in the market. Her main difficulty is keeping the business going when school fees and other expenses use up all her cash. She learnt this business from her mother and is proud to run her own business. She’s requesting a loan to ensure that she always has stock for her business. In the future, she wants to complete the children’s education and buy them a house.

loans.use: to ensure that she always has stock for her business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina, a 59-year-old resident of the Philippines, is married and has four children.  For the past five years, Catalina has had a food shop that sells banana cakes, and she is now requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. A new member of HSPFI, she  hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 37 years old, married and blessed with three children fourteen, seven and five years old. She buys and sells secondhand clothes, earning a monthly income of 8,000 KES. She has been in business over the past five years.

Lucy is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES, her third, to boost her business. She will use this loan to purchase two bales of secondhand clothes to sell. With the anticipated profits, she will increase the level of inventory in her business.

Lucy hopes to educate her children to a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana María, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes pues tiene una tienda. El crédito lo requiere para aumento de capital y comprar  arroz, fideo y conservas para surtir la tienda y ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a su clientela. Esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir sus gastos. Vive en  casa propia la misma queda  ubicada en la zona de  Alto Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz, es casada y tiene un hijo. Ana Maria ya accedió a un crédito el año 2010 y ahora será la primera vez que requiere que Kiva ayude para conseguir el fondeo necesario.
texts.en: Ana María sells groceries because she has a store.  She needs the loan to increase capital and buy rice, noodles and canned goods to stock the store and have a wider variety available for her customers.  This activity is the source of income she has to cover her expenses.  She lives in her own house located in the city of La Paz’s Alto Irpavi zone.  She’s married and has a son.  Ana María already had a loan in 2010 and now this will be the first time she needs Kiva’s help to get the necessary funding.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Roxana Marínela

texts.es: Roxana Marínela D. cuarenta y tres años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos en su humilD. casa que con mucho esfuerzo es propia en zona urbana y cercana a la capital del país. Ella se dedica a la venta D. platos plásticos, frutas y verduras frescas en su misma casa, es muy  conocida en el lugar donD. resiD. y se ha hecho D. mucha clientela pues siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan con producto D. muy buena calidad y a precios increiblemente accesibles; Roxana es una mujer decidida que le gusta el trabajo y mira la vida como la oportunidad D. invertir cada día,  es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar platos plásticos, tomates, ajos, cebollas, chiles, guineos y fruta D. temporada a fin D. incrementar su inventario o suplir productos que sus clientes últimamente demandan y por falta D. recurso propio no ha podido comprar. Roxana Marínela tiene la esperanza que así tendrá la oportunidad D. llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y forjar un mejor futuro para su querida familia.
texts.en:
43-year old Roxana Marínela lives with her husband and children in a simple house they worked hard to buy. It is located in a suburb near the capital city. Roxana earns her living selling plastic items as well as fresh fruit and vegetables from her home. She is well known in the area and has many customers because she always has what they want. The products are of good quality and a fair price. 

Roxana is a determined woman who enjoys work. She sees life as a daily opportunity to be seized, and for this reason she is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL to buy plastic dishes, tomatoes, garlic, onions, chiles, guineos (green bananas), and whatever fruit is in season. These purchases will allow her to increase her stock and proviD. what her customers have recently been asking for. She hasn't been able to afford to buy them herself.

Roxana hopes that the loan will give her the opportunity to proviD. a steady income and a better future for her beloved family.

loans.use: to buy plastic dishes, tomatoes, garlic, onions, chiles, mangos etc.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking mother who owns and manages a variety store to supplement her husband's income. She is now 50 years old and has two school-age children. Due to high cost of school fees and transportation, they need to earn more income to satisfy their needs and finance the education of their children. She aims to improve her variety store to increase her product offerings and satisfy her customers' needs.

Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, noodles, beverages, snackk foods, eggs, soaps and seasonings to sell in her variety store. She mentioned that this will be a great help for her to improve the business. She hopes that through her patience and sacrifices, she will make the business a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, beverages, snack foods, eggs, soaps and seasonings to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Luis Alfonso de 30 años, el posee una panadería el era estudiante pero no pudo t conseguir un empleo entonces opto por establecer este negocio se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues el pan que comercia es de muy buena calidad, muy rico y con precio realmente accesible además el servicio es excelente, Luis es un hombre muy entusiasta con ganas de salir adelante siempre está con la mejor disposición de trabajar. El crédito es para la compra de harina, huevos, mantequilla, queso, entre otros.
texts.en: Luis Alfonso, 30, has a bakery.  He was a student but was unable to find work so he opted to open this business.  He’s acquired quite a few customers because the bread he sells is very good quality, very delicious and priced quite affordably; besides service is excellent.  Luis is a very enthusiastic man with a strong drive to get ahead.  He’s always well-disposed to work.  The loan is to buy flour, eggs, butter and cheese, among others.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, butter and cheese, among others.

loans.name: Fredick

texts.en: Fredick is a Kenyan man married with two children who are 2 and 10 years old. His wife is a housewife. He runs a business making and selling pans, metal boxes and charcoal banners. His business is located downtown of the city. His customers come from within and outside of Nairobi. He says the business is good and the major challenge he has is insufficient funds. He is using his loan of KES 40,000 to add stock of scrap metal to grow his business. His future desire is to own several business. He is determined and hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap metal

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, a jolly 38-year-old married mother of two school-age children, has been patiently selling fruits and vegetables in her neighborhood, offering squash, eggplant and tomatoes on a house-to-house basis for a year now. Though the work is tiresome, she is very determined to acquire profits.

Now requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy more eggplant, cabbages, tomatoes and onions to sell, Vilma wants to improve her sales and earn more profits for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, cabbages, tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Roselinda

texts.en:
Roselinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines.

Roselinda requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more recycled materials to sell.

She has been in this business for 3 years.

Roselinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Siempre Viva Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Siempre Viva” esta conformado por 10 integrantes de los cuales dos son hambre y las restantes son 8 mujeres todos los integrantes del grupo son responsables y muy trabajadores, El nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque se consideran personas muy trabajadoras en sus respectivas actividades que realizan cada uno de ellos, “Somos personas que nos sentimos vivas, muy agiles y con muchas de salir de adelante.
Doña Angelina que es la representante del grupo tiene 27 años de edad esta casada con el señor José desde hace 10 años juntos han procreado tres hijos José Manuel de 10 años quien cursa el quinto año de primaria, Ángel Eduardo, de 9años de primaria esta en cuarto grado y Gabriel de 3 años quien aun no estudia. 
La señora Angelina tiene una tienda de abarrotes quien el cual tiene por nombre “miscelánea Dieguito” en ella ha trabajado desde hace 9 años solo que en negocio lo inicio en la ciudad ahora lleva tres años con ella en la comunidad, esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para invertir en su tienda compra lo que mas le hace falta como productos enlatados, azúcar, leche, huevo, pan, lo que mas le hace falta son alimentos, lo que mas consume la gente.
Cometa que su único problema es que tienen demasiada competencia por todos lados y por lo mismo sus ventas no pueden aumentar, sin embargo esta segura que con el crédito le ayudara a tener un mejor precio para ofrecérselos a sus clientes ya que las personas buscan el mejor precio con la mejor calidad, así si ella da los precios mas bajos su clientela aumentara.
Una de sus metas es que su tienda de abarrotes este bien surtida y por su puesto beneficiar a toda la comunidad con los precios bajos.
Así como doña Angelina invertirá en la tienda de abarrotes los integrantes invertirán en otras actividades, Carlos en un ciber café, Guadalupe en Herbalife (tés), María, Estephani, Edith y Horalia invertirán en animales como borregos, pollos, cerdos  y guajolotes, Rosa María en una tienda chica, Rubén en cocina, Catalina en ropa. “Todos estamos muy contentos y agradecidos por el préstamo que nos han otorgado ya que nos ayudara a mejorar nuestra calidad de vida y también para nuestras familias”
texts.en:
Thte “Siempre Viva” [Always Live] group is made up of 10 members, two of whom are men and 8 of whom are women. All the group members are responsible and very hardworking. They chose the name of the group because they consider themselves to be very hardworking in their different activities. "We are people who feel alive, very agile, and who really want to get ahead."  

Angelina, who is the group representative, is 27 years old and has been married to Jose for 10 years. They have three children, José Manuel, 10, who is in fifth grade, Ángel Eduardo, 9, who is in fourth grade, and Gabriel, 3, who isn't in school yet. 

Angelina ha a grocery store named “Miscelánea Dieguito”. She has worked there for 9 years. She started it in the city and and has had it in the community now for three years. She is asking for the loan this time to invest in her store and buy what she needs the most, such as canned goods, sugar, milk, eggs, bread. What she needs the most is food, what people consume the most.   

She remarks that her only problem is that she has too much competition everywhere and because of this her sales can't go up. Nonetheless, she is sure that the loan will help her to have better prices to offer her customers since people always look for the best price with the best quality. So if she gives her customers lower prices her clientele will grow. 

One of her goals is to have her grocery store well stocked and off course benefit the whole community with the low prices. 
Angelina will invest in the grocery store and the other members will invest in other activities. Carlos in an internet cafe, Guadalupe in Herbalife (teas), María, Estephani, Edith and Horalia will invest in animals such as sheep, chickens, pigs and turkeys. Rosa Maria will invest in in a small store, Rubin in a stove, Catalina in clothes. “We are all very happy and grateful for the loan they have given us, since it will help us to improve our quality of life and also that of our families."

loans.use: to buy bread, milk, sugar, eggs and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and fuel wood for resale.

loans.name: Nimol

texts.en:
Nimol, 40, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running a business of carrying clothes to sell around the village for over two years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a wood trader. One of her children is a construction worker.

In order to improve her business, Nimol is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a new motorbike for carrying her clothes to sell. In the future, she would like to expand her business and support her children's studies until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for carrying her clothes to sell

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad works hard to support four children. She is married and has a buy-and-sell livestock business in the Philippines.

Trinidad requested a PHP 1,800 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light, in case of emergency.

Trinidad is aware that, by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Ella es Fabiola tiene 24 años de edad, está estudiando Enfermería en la Institución Campo Alto, ella vive con la hermana, el cuñado y el sobrino en una situación un poco difícil, la hermana trabaja por días en casas de familia, el cuñado trabaja en celaduría y Fabiola trabaja como aseadora cuyo contrato es por servicios y el sueldo depende de lo que ella haga. 
En la casa colabora mensualmente para los gastos de la hermana, para el pago del arriendo y aparte compra la comida, paga loss servicios y los transportes. Debido a esta cantidad de gastos muchas veces solo le queda para pagar la mensualidad del estudio e incluso no logra pagarla completamente. 
Por otra parte como la hermana y el cuñado no tiene trabajos que les generen grandes ingresos  es difícil hacerle prestamos, por estos motivos ella necesita la ayuda que ofrece KIVA, porque muchas veces lo que gana no le alcanza para cancelar la cuota mensual que paga en Campo Alto y por eso debe hacer trabajo extra o prestamos independientes para conseguir completar la cuota, incluso ya hace un año debió aplazar el estudio, pero sigue buscando la manera de continuarlo, ya que el siguiente semestre, si continua estudiando, podrá empezar las prácticas.
texts.en:
This is Fabiola, age 24. She is studying Nursing at CampoAlto. Fabiola lives with her sister, brother-in-law, and a nephew in a bit of a difficult situation. Her sister works during the day at the houses of other families, her brother-in-law works at a security guard station, and Fabiola works as a housekeeper who contracts out her services. Her salary is dependent on each job.

At home Fabiola contributes each month toward her sister’s expenses, the rent payment, buying food, utility services, and transportation. Due to these numerous expenses, there have been several months in which the only thing left she can pay is her monthly tuition. Sometimes she hasn’t been able to pay anything at all.

Since her sister and brother-in-law do not have jobs that earn a lot of money, it has been difficult for her to obtain loans. For this reason, she needs the help that Kiva offers. Many times she has not been able to cover her monthly tuition payment to CampoAlto, so she has had to find extra work or seek private loans on her own in order to pay the bill. A year ago Fabiola had to postpone her studies, but she continues to look for ways to continue her education. She hopes to resume her studies the following semester so that she can begin her practicums.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Guadalupe Esperanza

texts.es:
Guadalupe es una mujer de 19 años, su estado civil es soltera, tiene un hijo y ella se dedica a la crianza de chanchos lo cual ese trabajo le ayudado a salir adelante junto a su hijo.
Esta actividad lo heredo de su madre quien le enseño y le motivo a trabajar desde muy temprana edad.
 El cliente solicito el crédito para incrementar chancheras.
El cliente tiene un alma de emprendedora ya que a su corta edad ella ya tiene algunos animales y en este mercado ya le conocen que vende y tiene sus propios clientes sin necesidad de salir a ofrecer a las ferias.
El propósito de la cliente es llegar a tener chanchos finos ya que obtendría mayores ingresos, en el sector donde reside la cliente tiene un clima templado y las costumbres de las personas es el comercio de animales y la agricultura.
Guadalupe está muy agradecida con KIVA quien le abrió las puertas para obtener su crédito.

loans.use: Para incrementar las chacheras e incrementar su negocio que es el sustento para ella y su hijo.

loans.name: Nasima

texts.en:
Nasima is 35 years old and a mother of 6 children, living in District 2, Kabul, Afghanistan.

It is almost 3 years that she has been working in her shop baking bread and selling to the bazaar 

She hopes to receive a loan through AFSG so she can buy wood and flour and find good income through this business.

loans.use: To buy wood and flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase building materials and hire laborers for his rental houses business

loans.name: Zainura

texts.en: H.  Zainura owns and works in her shop, which located in the center of the Avganbasaar market.  She is married and has 4 children.  In 1992, she supplied shops with her goods from Uzbekistan, Iran.  Her husband is a doctor, and he helped to organize a place for trade so that she could start her own business in 2002.  She started her business with a loan provided by Micro Invest.  She is an active client of this organization.  Today she is an independent and experienced businesswoman.  Her little shop became one of the best known shops in the area, and is very deserving of her clients' trust.  The diversity of her goods attracts new clients who leave satisfied with the goods they have purchased from her.  She is planning to use the next loan for the purchase of goods from Tashkent, Usbekistan to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: Purchase goods from Tashkent, Usbekistan

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en: Rasim K. is a taxi driver in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Rasim has been driving a taxi for a few years now and is married, with one child. This will be Rasim’s first loan with Normicro. He has been approved for a loan of $575.00 with which he plans to purchase new tires for this taxi as well as some minor repairs for his vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase tires and to make other minor repairs to his taxi.

loans.name: Etevise

texts.en: Etevise is 32-years-old, married, and has six children. Her parents have had a vegetable garden for ages, and now Etevise has taken over. Her husband is a very hard-working man, and he has been working on the garden for a long time. Through years of hard work, they have managed to improve their family life. Etevise is thankful for the financial support from SPBD, especially since her husband is unemployed and their six children need looking after. She sells enough every week to make a profit, and she is planning to buy a car to use in delivering her vegetables, not only to the market but to the village as well.

loans.use: To buy a back sprayer, fertilizers, gromoxone chemical (weed killer), knives, and a spade for her garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more khat stock.

loans.name: Muava

texts.en: Muava is a mother of 3 from the big island of Savaii and is married to a business man from Matautu Falealili. She joined the program in 2005 when she needed help for her business. She is now applying for another loan to help buying more inventory for her shop and to pay her children school fees.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Kuña Kyre´ÿ Group

texts.en:
In the city of Yaguarón, a little more than nine miles from the main city Paraguarí, there is a group of 18 women who have come together to ask for a loan. They have lucrative businesses selling everyday goods like food and house supplies.

Together they have formed a support group and depend on one another to help repay the loans that are given to them. The group has taken on the name Kuña Kyre´ÿ; the name is in the second official language of Paraguay – Guaraní. It means “Active Woman”. All of these women have excellent qualifications and have formed an even greater system where each woman relies on the others to be accountable to repaying her loan. Together they bring different skills, businesses and specializations ranging from hairdressing to specializing in meats and breads.

loans.use: The loan will be invested in buying goods such as fabric, thread, meat, drinks, milk, cooking oil, pasta, rice, flour, baking power, beauty shop supplies, hair accessories, cleaning products and feed for cattle

loans.name: Nhóm Chị Hồng - Cụm Vọng Nguyệt Xã Tam Giang Group

texts.vi:
Mrs Hồng, group leader, is 31 years old. She has 3 children who are still in school.She supplies construction material to local consumers. Her husband is a truck driver. Her family income is 6.25 USD a day. She request this loan to buy bricks.
Mrs Bảo will use the loan to buy pork.
Mrs Loan will use the loan to buy pig mash.
Mrs Oanh will use the loan to stock her grocery store.
Mrs Tiền will use the loan to buy waste metal to resell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunterr.

Chị Hồng 31 tuổi, có 3 con đang đi học. Chị làm nghề chở vật liệu xây dựng cho các gia đình trong địa phương. Chồng chị lái xe chở vật liệu. Thu nhập trung bình của gia đình chị khoảng 100000 đồng/ngày. Chị vay vốn để mua thêm gạch.
Chị Bảo vay vốn để thêm vốn bán thực phẩm (thịt lợn).
Chị Loan vay để mua thức ăn cho lợn.
Chị Oanh vay vốn để bán hàng tạp hoá.
Cô Tiền vay để đi chợ sắt.

loans.use: to buy bricks, pork, pig mash, grocery, waste metal

loans.name: Lelis

texts.en:
Lelis P. F. runs a general store near the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali. There she sells goods that are popular with her neighbors and purchased daily. Lelis has a well-placed central location in her neighborhood. Her many loyal clients enjoy purchasing their everyday goods from her instead of traveling a longer distance to the main market.

Lelis is a mother of 3 and is happily married. She is proud of her business. Now Lelis has greater independence and doesn’t need to ask her husband when she wants to buy something for herself or her children. Lelis will continue to save and invest in her store and the children’s future.

A member of the community bank Las Lumbreras, Lelis is requesting a loan of s/1200 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to restock her store with rice, sugar, salt, oil, eggs, beer, and sodas.

loans.use: To restock a general store

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline is 32 years old and the single mother of a unique school-going 12-year-old son.  After her husband left, Joseline had to quickly find a way to survive and take care of her son, so she started a small business selling perfumes, shoes, silver jewels and other goods.  In a few years, she hopes she will have earned sufficient money to rent or buy a small shop.
With her loan of $175, this entrepreneur will purchase more goods to add to her stock, her goal being to maintain a comfortable life for her son.

loans.use: To acquire perfumes, jewels and shoes for a small business.

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.es:
Raymunda sells different American products and vitamins with the namebrand FOREVER. This is a namebrand with products such as pills, vitamins, lotions and beauty products. The selling is done through catalogs. A friend told Raymunda about this business, and this is how she began to attend meetings to learn how to sell these products.

Raymundo has been a FOREVER distributor for the past 3 years and says that she makes pretty good commissions. She also takes care of ill people since she's also a geriatric nurse. With the previous loans, Raymunda has been able to buy products to sell to friends. She would one day like to open up a phone booth in Manchay but still sell her FOREVER products.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

Raymunda se dedica a la venta de productos y vitaminas americanas FOREVER. Esta marca consta de una gama de productos como pastillas, vitaminas, cremas, nutrientes e hidratantes de belleza. La venta es por catálogo. Ella conoció sobre este negocio por medio de una amiga, y fue así que empezó a participar de las reuniones donde se difunde esta línea de productos importados. Raymunda ya tiene tres años como distribuidora de FOREVER y dice que le ha ido bien con las comisiones de venta que ella gana. Además, ella se ayuda económicamente cuidando enfermos, ya que es enfermera geriátrica. Con los préstamos que ha pedido, Raymunda ha comprado productos para ofrecer a sus amistades. A ella le gustaría abrir un locutorio en Manchay, pero sin descuidar las ventas de productos FOREVER.

loans.use: To purchase more FOREVER products

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel Munoz dedicates her efforts to her business of selling clothing in the city of Chinandega where she sells her products at the central market.

She is a hard working person who is looking for a way to succeed in her business so that she can provide for her family. For this simple reason she is calling upon Ceprodel for a loan that will allow her to purchase merchandise to sell to her clients so that she may be able to continue supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Maribel M. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de ropa en la ciudad de Chinandega donde vende sus productos en el mercado Central de esta ciudad.

Actualmente ella es una persona esforzada que busca la manera de salir adelante en su negocio para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Por esta sencilla razón es que acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario que le permita obtener la mercadería para luego ofertarla a sus clientes en su tramo y de esta manera continuar con el sustento de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing.

loans.name: Vang

texts.en:
Mrs. Vang N., 58, is a widow who lives in a small village across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has seven children, five sons and two daughters. Three of her children are married and live outside the family home. One son is a construction worker, another one sells silk products, and the last one weaves silk at home.

Since she was young, Mrs. Vang has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

She is requesting a loan of US$ 600 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Rehema S. is a twenty-eight-year-old married woman from Dar es Salaam. Rehema owns and operates a small stall, which she established six months ago, from which she sells roasted fish. She buys fresh fish daily from local fishermen as they come in with their morning catch. Rehema roasts and sells these fish either in the fish market or along the roads of Dar. Given its location along the Indian Ocean, fish is plentiful in the waters around Dar es Salaam and is a staple of the local Tanzanian diet. Rehema is an enterprising micro-entrepreneur who is taking advantage of a local need to make monthly profits of 120 USD. She is currently requesting a loan of 225 USD in order to purchase fish in larger quantities. In the future, Rehema plans to open another stall to sell her delectable treats.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies of fish in bulk

loans.name: Mwanaid

texts.en:
Mwanaid is 29 years old and is married with 3 children between the ages of 9 and 2. She also cares for a 55 year old. She has been selling clothes since 1999. She works everyday from 8am to 3.30pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Mwanaid is now requesting a loan to improve her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.use: To improve her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa lives in the area of Burj Al Barajneh in Suburban Beirut. A mother of four, she sells cosmetic products on a door-to-door basis. Pursuing this business since 2004, Wafaa has been able to improve her living standards by buying furniture for her home and providing her children with a better education. Today, two of her children are now married. She plans to borrow $1,000 to buy more products and continue on selling her products to her neighbors and friends.

loans.use: Wafaa would like to buy more inventory of cosmetics to continue her door-to-door sales business.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Amakuru (Greetings) from Ernest S. in Ruhengeri in the northern part of Rwanda! Ernest is 29 years old, married with 2 children.

Ernest owns a stock of sorghum. He buys the sorghum during the harvest time and keeps it in the store until the prices increase when it is in short supply and he can sell it to local breweries for making beer and to small local beer producers. The common local brew produced out of sorghum is Urwagwa, which is mostly drunk by local people in rural areas especially during wedding celebrations.

Besides the buying and selling of sorghum, Ernest also grows potatoes, which are commonly produced in the area where he lives because of the fertile volcanic soils in the region. He earns about US$ 140 every month from all his commercial activities. He employs 4 people in both his farm and in the selling of sorghum.

He is looking for a loan worth 515,000 Frws to buy more sorghum to increase his stock since he has the market to sell it to the local breweries, who otherwise make banana beer. This loan will be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: To Increase his stocks of sorghum

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase trade area

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa es comerciante, su esposo se dedica a la elaboración de muebles y ella se encarga de realizar los contratos y ofertar sus productos de carpintería a pedido.
Vive en la zona Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz como cuidadora, es decir vive en unas dos habitaciones sin pagar alquiler a cambio de cuidar esa vivienda. tiene tres hijos que están en edad escolar. El crédito que ahora solicita es para la compra de madera, venesta y barniz para continuar en el negocio de elaboración de muebles junto con su esposo.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Felipa is a storekeeper. Her husband makes furniture and she is in charge of making contracts and offering their products to the workshops that order them. She lives in the zone Irpavi II in the city of La Paz as a nanny. This means she lives in two houses without paying rent in exchange for taking care of the homes. She has three children that are of school age. The loan that she is requesting is for buying wood, plywood, and varnish in order to continue the business of making furniture with her husband. This is the second time she has requested a loan with Impro. Her credit history qualifies her for a client rating 1 with Impro, which means that she has an excellent repayment history of her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying wood, plywood and varnish for her furniture-making business

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en:
Nguon M., 30, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She grows bananas and sells them in the village market, earning approximately US$3.50 each day. Her husband is a horse-cart driver who makes around US$11 each day. This couple has three children, one of whom attends school.

Mrs. Nguon M. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to make two investments. She will use US$500 to buy a bigger and healthier horse for her husband, and she will use the rest to rent a banana farm.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and rent a banana farm.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu has owned a small charcoal store in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for many years. She belongs to the Nia njema loan group, and currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her busines for 14 hours. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal to sell to her customers. She is hoping that this loan will allow her to increase her profits and grow her business.    

Tatu is 33 years old, married, and has three children ages 4, 7 and 13.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Tika Llajta Group

texts.es: El grupo " Tika Llajta " esta representado por la señora Margot y conformado por 13 miembros dedicados principalmente al comercio de productos como artesanías, atención en tiendas de barrio, comida, cosméticos, licores, comida y al transporte público. Pese a la competencia los socios (as) saben como salir adelante con su experiencia y con la voluntad de trabajar y esforzarse para sacar adelante a sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de materiales e insumos para incrementar sus negocios y mejorar su producto. Los socios (as) conocen del trabajo con grupos solidarios ya que trabajaron con instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital por lo que tienen amplio conocimiento de la responsabilidad y el cumplimiento que necesitan para cumplir con sus obligaciones y crecer en sus negocios mejorando la calida de vida de sus familias. Dentro del grupo existe un parentesco entre la señora Silvia Janeth y el señor Jose luis ambos son hermanos pero con ingresos totalmente independientes por lo que no existe riesgo en el grupo.
texts.en:
The group "Tika Llajta" is represented by Ms. Margot and is made of 13 members. They are principally involved in selling handicrafts, especially related to neighborhoods, food, cosmetics, liquor and public transportation. It is up to the members to know how to move forward with experience and keep working and move their families forward. This financing is for buying materials, increasing business and improving products. The members know form working in supportive groups and working with groups similar to Foundation Agrocapital how to work with lots of responsibility, fulfill their obligations, grow their business and improve the quality of life for their families. There is a relationship between Ms. Silvia Janeth and Mr. Jose Luis and the group (two siblings), but they have independent loans and because of this have no risk in the group.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Operacions

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina R. is currently in the business of selling milk and is requesting a loan to buy more cows for milk production. Zeina is 40 years old and is married to her husband who is a cattle keeper. She has 4 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a paddock system for rearing animals.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more cows for milk production

loans.name: Pross' Group

texts.en: Z. Pross is a member of Tusuubira group in Lugazi. She is a hard working lady who has had a salon that she mans in Lugazi town for 8 years so far. She makes lady’s hair, plaits it using braids as well as applying chemicals to make it soft and manageable. She has been able to buy driers that she uses in her salon, combs plus other accessories and this enables her to attend to four customers at a time. Pross needs a loan to help with buying more chemicals and braids for her salon plus paying school fees for her five children and one dependent. Pross has future plans of buying another plot of land and building rental homes for increasing her revenue.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and braids for her salon.

loans.name: Mrs. Kheim Sout Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people living in Romon village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purpose.

Mrs. Kheim S. is the 37-year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. She also breeds chickens in the house. Her husband, Mr. Duong Vanna, is a motor taxi driver. Although they try to work hard they still earn insufficient income to support their family living. Thus, Mrs. Kheim S. decided to ask for a loan to bU. more chickens and she would use the rest of the loan to bU. piglets for breeding. She has two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school.

Five members in this group are applying for end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those receiving EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and to buy piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Bravo Plus Group

texts.fr: Thérèse M. a une boutique d’articles divers et vend du bois. Elle a acheté avec le crédit reçu au mois de mai courant, 100 bottes de bois à revendre en vue d’accroitre son revenu. Elle a été initiée au commerce par sa grande sœur en 1975 à l’âge de 13 ans. C’est en 1984 qu’elle s’est engagée à vendre ses propres produits, un bassin de 50 pains avec un capital initial de $5. De 1984 – 1990, par un dur travail et une bonne gestion, elle est arrivée à diversifier son activité en y ajoutant du sucre, du pétrole etc… qui totalisaient un montant de $200. De 1990 – 2002, Thérèse a encore diversifié son affaire en y ajoutant des mèches qui ont augmenté son capital à $1150. De 2002 – 2006, Thérèse a rencontré des difficultés d’écoulement de ses produits dans son quartier à cause de la saturation.  Cela l’a amenée de 2006 jusqu’à ce jour, d’ouvert un autre point de vente en dehors de son quartier. Actuellement, son affaire lui génère un bénéfice de $220 par mois. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une pharmacie à cause de la demande qui est grande dans son milieu à l’ouest de Kinshasa. Thérèse a 47 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants âgés de 18 à 29 ans dont le plus âgé est indépendant et les trois autres étudient.
texts.en:
Thérèse M. has a shop for various goods, and she sells wood. She used the loan received in May to buy 100 bales of wood to resell with the goal of growing her revenues. She was introduced to commerce by her older sister in 1975 at the age of 13. It was in 1984 that she dedicated herself to selling her own merchandise, fifty loaves of bread in a basin, with $5 of initial capital. From 1984-1990, through hard work and good managing, she came to diversity her business by including sugar, kerosene, etc... which totaled $200. From 1990-2002, she diversified again by including hair extensions that increased her capital to $1,150. From 2002-2006, she ran into difficulties with the turnover of goods in her district due to saturation. What has carried her from 2006 to today was opening another sales outlet outside her district. Currently her business generates a monthly profit of $220. Her ambition is to open a pharmacy because of the demand, which is big in her area west of Kinshasa. Thérèse is 47 years old, married, and the mother of four children, ages 18 to 29. The eldest is on his own, and the other three are students.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 100 bales of wood for resale

loans.name: Zulfiniso

texts.en:
Zulfiniso is married with 8 children. She sells nice, quality fabrics for national dresses in a big local market. Her family is actively helping her with her business, which she started about 14 years ago. Zulfiniso would like to ask for a loan of 6000 Somoni to increase her inventory which will help supply her until the spring season. She believes this timely investment will help her generate additional income and increase the family budget. We think Zulfiniso’s responsibility and strong character will assist her in the current loan repayment.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase of new fabrics to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine R. is 45 years old, married, and has seven children. She resides at Locsoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental.

Josephine’s loan is intended to purchase vitamins and feed for her hogs. She admitted that, with the help of PMPC Microfinance Program, her business has grown in such a way that she has a better income now than before.

Josephine’s husband works at corn planting and helps in raising the hogs. Through the help of each other, they make their activities easier and more comfortable. The family hopes to have a comfortable life someday and be able to send their children to school and have their own decent life in the future.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Folake

texts.en: Folake is 37 years old and married with two children. She tailors beautiful clothes for men and women, and she also sells sarongs. Folake is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase a sewing and weaving machine. She says this will enable her to serve her customers better. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing and weaving machine

loans.name: Edamaria

texts.es:
La señora Edelmira M. P. reside en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega donde ha unido sus esfuerzos para lograr un sueño que por mucho tiempo ha tenido como lo es la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus cuatro hijos que requieren del apoyo de su madre.

Ella ha decidido invertir en la compra de los materiales de construcción y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito oportuno ya que le urge continuar con la obra de reconstrucción y al final ver logrado su sueño de beneficiar a sus pequeños en su nivel de vida y brindarles un techo digno donde habitar.
texts.en:
Señora Edelmira M. P. resides in the municipality of Somotillo of the city of Chinandega where she has focused all her efforts to achieve a dream that she has had for a long time, namely the reconstruction of her house. The purpose of the loan is to improve the living conditions of her four children that require the support of their mother. She has decided to invest in the purchase of the building materials and for this she has approached Ceprodel to request credit since she is hard-pressed to continue with the work of reconstruction. In the end she would like to see her dream achieved to benefit her small children in their standard of living and to offer them a worthy home to live in.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her home.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a member of the Hadhina borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 43 years old woman,she is separated from her husband and a mother of 2 children,Her children are aged 21 and 18 years.

Prisca started her own food business selling tomatoes,potatoes,onions, 10 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Prisca`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000Tsh in order to buy more tomatoes,potatoes etc for sale .

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Prisca hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes,onions,potatoes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy farm supllies and equipment for market gardening

loans.name: Virginie

texts.fr: C. Virginie est née vers 1953 à Allada. Virginie veuve. Virginie a à sa charge cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont quatre sont les tiens. Virginie réside depuis onze  ans à Fridjrossè Kpota, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Virginie les charges de sa famille. C’est des boissons liqueurs que Virginie vend. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Béatrice et à Lomé, Capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin que Virginie achète ses produits et elle va à Comè, dans le Département du Mono pour les vendre. Virginie a déjà neuf ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Virginie a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Virginie demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de cartons de boissons liqueurs.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is a 40 married with three children aged between 3 and 12 years. Her children go to school .She takes care of additional family members. Rehema resides and rents a one roomed house where she is staying with four people. There is electricity and no piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala in Ndeeba zone. Rehema works seven days a week. She buys yellow bananas from the very place she works and doesn’t incur extra transport costs to and from shopping.  She doesn’t pay rent but pays monthly market dues.She sells to all categories of people both on retail and whole sale Rehema has been in this business for 12 years and with MCDT for five, servicing her fourteenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches and clusters of yellow bananas and. Rehema is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and start buying  directly from farmers

loans.use: to buy more yellow bananas

loans.name: Elizabeth Mbulwa

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married to Salim and they have two children: Antony and Carolyne, who are 15 and 7 years old respectively.

She was introduced to KADET through existing clients and has no previous credit history. Elizabeth has been in the embroidery business for six years. She will use her loan to start a cereal sales business (maize) in order to diversify her income.

She runs her business is in a slum that is highly populated. Elizabeth's clients are residents of the area. Elizabeth also supplies embroidery items to other towns. 

With the extra profits, she intends to buy more machines for embroidery. In the future, Elizabeth aspires to open an embroidery school. She describes herself as hardworking.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. For more information on KADET, visit www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Starting a cereal sales business to diversify her income

loans.name: C2584 Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Laurent K. is 34 years old and is married with four children aged between 5 and 12 years. He lives in the Gasabo district near Kigali, the capital of Rwanda. He is the president of a group called Twitezimbere. This group has sold agricultural foodstuffs (sorghum, beans, etc.) for the past four years and it employs five people working from 5 a.m. to 10 p.m. every day. 

This group is now requesting its first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding their business. They will use the loan to purchase additional and larger quantities of foodstuffs needed by a number of their customers.

With this loan, and assuming they are successful, they hope to get enough profit to allow them to buy their own warehouse and provide more food and a better standard of living for their families.

loans.use: To purchase additional and larger quantities of foodstuffs

loans.name: Beatrice Nyamboke

texts.en:
Beatrice is 56 years old and married with four children. She is building some rental houses to add to what she has in Mwiki center. She has been in the business for about one year and earns a profit of approximately $240 a month.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend after moving from another micro-finance agency. She wants to use this loan to finish the construction of her rental houses in order to meet her clients' demands. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To finish construction of rental houses for her rental business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuelas de hoy II”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 28 años de edad y es casada. Se dedica a la artesanía. 
La señora Lucia estudió secundaria completa y tiene 1 hijo.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año atrás.
Su primer préstamo fue de  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la adquisiciòn de  materiales los que emplearà en sus artesanías.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.1700.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de lanas.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener su tienda de artesanías en Tacna y que su hijo sea profesional.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Ms. Lucia is a member of Community Bank “Manuelas de hoy II.” She lives in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 28 years old and is married. She is an artisan. Ms. Lucia finished secondary school and has one child. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. Her first loan was for $175 (500 PEN) which she used to buy materials which she uses in her crafts. She is asking for a loan of $600 (1700 PEN) which she will use to buy wool. Her wish for the future is to have a craft store in Tacna and for her son to be a professional. What she likes the most about Community Bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: La señora Paulina se dedica a la crianza y venta de chanchos, desde hace un año, tambien trabaja en una Empresa procesadora de A., la señora tiene casa propia en la zona de el Abra, recibe la ayuda de su esposo que es chofer de transporte publico, tiene un hijo que le ayuda en la crianza de los animales, mientra ella esta trabajando.
texts.en:
Sra. Paulina started raising and selling pigs a year ago. She also works at a company that processes almonds. She has her own home in the district of El Abra and receives assistance from her husband, who is a public transportation driver. Paulina has a son who helps her with raising the animals while she is working.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Fonofaavae

texts.en:
Fonofaavae A. is 32 and married with 4 children (ages 8 - 22years).  She owns a business venture, catching large fish.  Fonofaavae has 3 years of experience in this business.  Fonofaavae needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase fishing boat and a fishing net.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 tala or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Fonofaavae joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Fonofaavae's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Fonofaavae A. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase fishing boat and a fishing net

loans.name: Samoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Samoeurn T. is 41 years old and she lives in Roneam Tnaot village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sombo T., are farmers who own 3 hectares (7.5 acres) of field on which they cultivate rice.

However hard this couple tries to work, they still earn less income than needed to support their family. In order to improve their living standards, Mrs. Samoeurn T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a plowing machine for her husband.
