He would use the plowing machine to plow their field and it will be hired by the villagers.

Mrs. Samoeurn T. is the mother of two children who are both students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a plowing machine for her husband

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Doña Elena de 46 años de edad,  habita en la comarca El Caracol junto a su familia compuesta por su esposo el señor Armando Guerra y sus 6 hijos, el mayor de 26 años, otro de 22 años, de 19 años, de 16 años, de 13 años y el menor de 10 años, de estos solamente los 2 menores estan estudiando la primaria, los mayores apoyan con trabajo productivo de la finca. Esta solicitando su 3er credito esperando ser beneficiada con kiva para compra  de terneros de desarrollo, los cuales pretende engordar para comercializarlos cuando obtengan un buen peso, y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan el sosten familiar. Doña Elena desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la actividad ganadera, lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia, su voluntad y anhelo es aprovechar su propiedad, ya que con el poco ganado propio no le aprovecha a capacidad sus recursos de su finca
texts.en:
Elena is 46 years old, and lives in the El Caracol area together with her family, composed of her husband Armando Guerra and their 6 children. The oldest is 26, and the others are 22, 19, 16. 13 and 10. Of these, only the 2 youngest are studying at primary school - the older ones support the family by working on the farm. Elena is seeking her third loan, hoping to be favoured by Kiva to purchase calves to raise, which she will fatten to sell when they reach a good weight. In this way she will obtain better earnings that permit her to sustain her family. Since Elena was very young she has dedicated herself to farming activities, which have allowed her to improve her family's situation. Her will and yearning is to make the most of her property, as with the little she earns she doesn't make the most of the farm's resources.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves to raise

loans.name: Shanta

texts.en:
Mrs. Shanta T. lives in a single family with her husband and three children. Both Mrs. T. and Mr. T. are engaged in agriculture. They own their own land for farming. Mostly they grow green vegetables on their land. They sell their vegetables at the local market in the morning and evening daily. They meet all the needs of their family with the income from their farming. 

Mrs. Shanta T. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishepati. Sainbu-Bhaishepati is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. She has two daughters and one son. All of her children are now working.

Mrs. T. is requesting a 10,000 Nepalese rupee loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for the farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah has a wheelbarrow that she uses to hawk Nigerian cooked foods. Her customers love her cooked foods and she has high patronage. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is married with five children and she is 42 years old. Her husband is a civil servant and he supports their home. She hopes to grow her business. She is requesting a loan of N120,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Yoeuk

texts.en: The lady in the photo is Yoeuk K.. She is 38 years old and married Chan Hun, 43, many years ago. The couple has four school-aged children. They have a small fishing business in and around Tunle Sap River. By fishing, the couple is able to generate a small income of $5 USD each day, which they use to feed their family. Yoeuk K. is requesting a loan to purchase more fishing accessories for their fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sales of food items and basic needs items

loans.name: Ngoyangi Group

texts.en:
Korpo B. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Ngoyangi. She is 45 years old, single, and has two children aged 22 and 26. She also cares for other relatives living with her. Korpo did not have the opportunity to go to school.
For the last five years, Korpo has been selling charcoal at the Oldest Congo Town in Paynesville, Liberia. She started her business with 10,000 LRD as working capital but now has more than 20,000 LRD as working capital. She has a good stock in order to encourage customers to continue returning. Korpo sometimes faces problems with transporting goods from one place to another. Her goal and dream is to build a house in the near future. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to purchase more charcoal to improve her business.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Korpo is holding the sign. Richard is inset lower right.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Por Una Vida Digna Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Por una Vida Digna” se encuentra ubicada en la zona D. Santa Anita, departamento D. Lima, está conformado por 9 socios, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desD. hace 6 años. Sus miembros realizan diversas actividades D. producción, comercio y servicio.
Elsa quien a su vez asume el cargo D. tesorera, tiene 52 años, es casada, tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales uno esta en la Universidad, se dedica al alquiler D. vestuarios (danzas folklóricas), desD. hace 5 años, se inicio en esta actividad porque sus hijas son profesoras D. danzas, con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria Elsa ha construido el tercer piso D. su vivienda. Su gran sueño es formar una agrupación que difunda el folklor a nivel nacional. El reciente préstamo lo utilizará en la compra D. vestuarios.  
Todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y están comprometidos a cumplir con los pagos según el cronograma otorgado por prosperidad. (En la foto niños hijos D. los socios).
texts.en:
The community bank “Por una Vida Digna” is located in Santa Anita in the departament of Lima. It is maD. up of nine members who have worked with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for six years. The members are involved in diverse production, commercial and service industries. Elsa is the group's treasurer. She is 52, married and has 5 children, one of whom studies at university. She has been renting out folk dance costumes for five years. She started this business because her daughters are dance teachers. As a result of her daily efforts, Elsa has added a third floor to her house. Her dream is to form a group that will take folklore to a national level. She will use this loan to buy costumes. All the group members are thankful for the support they receive and are committed to repaying their installments on time. The children featured in this photo are the children of the group members.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of costumes

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
Arcelie V. is from the village of Holy Friday. She is 49 years old. Arcelie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Arcelie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Arcelie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Arcelie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Arcelie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Arcelie is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Arcelie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.en:
Eliseo D. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 45 years old. Eliseo is single. To make a living, Eliseo owns & operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. Eliseo has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eliseo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eliseo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Eliseo is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a set of tires for his motorcycle and for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle to continue his transport business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Eliseo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and to repair and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a 44-year-old lady who is married to a farmer. She sells scrap metals which are later recycled. In additon, she sells fruit to earn extra income. Regina is a mother of four, and she works hard to provide a quality education for her two children who are in school. For this reason, she wants to stabilize her business to increase her income so that she can afford school fees. She has been an active member of Ngumbau group in Faulu Kenya, whose members are responsible for any member who takes out a loan. She is requesting 25,000 KES through the group. She wants to use the loan to buy more oranges for resale. In ten years, she wants to own a truck to transport fruit to the market.

loans.use: To buy oranges for resale

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is 24 years old, married, and has one 6-month-old child. He is a farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for the last four years and has employed one farmhand. His main product is milk, which he sells to the local market, and tea which he sells to the tea estate. He also earns income from his pool table business in the same area.

Hassan's biggest challenge has been lack of enough animal feed and lack of enough knowledge on animal diseases and pest control.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will increase his source of income through the sale of milk and this will help him meet the needs of his family.

He would like to improve his farming in the future by acquiring a high yielding dairy cow and build a dairy unit. He is grateful to Juhudi for their support and requests more funding in the future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en: Mary Cris V. is from the village of Centro Sur, Alcala, Cagayan. She is 40 years old. Mary Cris is married and has three young children. To make a living, Mary Cris sells home products. The main source of income for the business comes from selling kitchen supplies and home products to local community members. Mary Cris has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Mary Cris joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Cris is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Mary Cris from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda E. is from the town of Banga. She is 28 years old. Chanda is married and has a 5-year-old child. To make a living, Chanda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Chanda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years. Like most farmers in her town, she wants her farm to be productive.

Chanda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Chanda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Chanda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Chanda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Estrengel

texts.en:
Estrengel R.' main source of income comes from fattening pigs for sale. He is 30 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Calinaoan. Estrengel has been in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Estrengel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Estrengel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Vannat

texts.en:
Mr. Vannat K. (pictured with his mother) is 25 years old and a widower. He lives with his widowed mother in a village along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Vannat has been a carver for two years. He does not have his own transportation, so traveling is a big expense for him. Therefore, Vannat is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Mahamadou Rahama

texts.fr: Mahamadou Rahama est un homme célibataire. il y a quelques années il a abandonné les études, afin de pouvoir se prendre en charge, il a ouvert une salle de jeux qu'il exploite pour son propre compte.  les jeunes de son quartier affluent tous les soirs et surtout les weekend dans sa salle de jeux; satisfaire tout le monde il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat d'une télé et d'une console Playstation.
texts.en: Mahamadou Rahama is a bachelor. Several years ago he left his studies in order to provide for himself. He opened a games room which he operates himself. The youths in his quarter pour into the games room on evenings and weekends. In order to meet demand, he is requesting a loan from WAGES so he can purchase another television and Playstation console.

loans.use: achat d'une télé et d'une console playstation.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with one grown son. She sells women's clothing. Her business is located at a department store where she rents some space. Olga is able to make her business a success by offering a large assortment and excellent client service. 

Olga is requesting 10,000 Grivnas to purchase seasonal inventories. She hopes to increase her sales and make additional profits to take better care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock more bags of sugar and onions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cutlasses, hinges, nails, hammers, knives, and shovels

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok N., age 51, is a mother blessed with three children. Two of the children are single, and one is married. One of her children is a worker who works in a bread shop, and has a regular salary about $25 per month. Sok N. currently generates an income of approximately $2.5 per day by selling Khmer cake. Sok N. has a life partner in her husband who is a local farmer in Kompong Cham Province. Presently, her selling business is running very well and she wishes to expand her business. So that Sok N. requests a loan as additional capital to buy raw material for making Khmer cake for selling. Sok N. and her husband are pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To buy raw material for making Khmer cake for selling.

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maria; La socia tiene 56 años D. edad, es casada, y tiene 6 hijos, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta D. artesanía, la socia elabora a mano trabajos D. arcilla con motivos andinos, los pinta y da todos los acabados finales, ella trabaja en el centro artesanal Inti Pakareq; La socia trabaja  con su esposo y parte D. sus hijos, este se convirtió en un negocio familiar los últimos dos años. La socia requiere el crédito para poder comprar mercadería y materia prima para la adquisición D. arcilla D. primera y pinturas vegetales. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. materia prima.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “INTI QUILLA.”  The bank is located in the Huanchac District of the Province and Department of Cusco.

The member's name is Sra. Maria.  She is 56 years old, married and has 6 children.  She makes her living buying and selling handicrafts.  She makes hand-maD. Andean-style pottery, paints the pottery herself and adds all the finishing touches. She works in the artisan center of Inti Pakareq.  Sra. Maria works with her husband and some of her children; it became a family business in the last two years.  She needs the loan in order to purchase merchandise and raw materials like high-quality clay and vegetable-based paints.  She is requesting the loan in order to invest in the purchase of raw materials.

Sra. Maria is happy with the loan that has been granted, and she promises to make her payments in accordance with the established re-payment schedule.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan in order to invest in the purchase of raw materials.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a thirty-seven-year-old married male with five children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in a retail business for the last two years which he started with a capital of 1,000,000 UGX and increased to 5,000,000 UGX. His hardships include competition plus rising prices for goods. His vision is expanding his business to a supermarket plus educating his children. George needs the loan to buy soft drinks, bread, rice and sugar for resale.

loans.use: Buying soft drinks, bread, rice and sugar for resale

loans.name: Vera Gema

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Niquinohomo del Departamento de Masaya la señora Vera Gema P. L., diariamente labora en la Alcaldía Municipal de esa localidad como Promotora Social en el que ya tiene seis años de antigüedad en su puesto. Es madre soltera a su cargo tiene dos niñas a quienes con el sudor de su frente las sustenta y les brinda de todo lo necesario para que tengan un crecimiento saludable.

Esta señora tiene un sueño que el de ir realizando mejora en su casa de habitación para brindarles las condiciones necesarias para sus menores, es por esta razón que ahora ella está visitando las oficinas de CEPRODEL para solicitar un crédito y realizar el mejoramiento de vivienda.

Ella quiere que sus niñas crezcan en un ambiente sano y saludable para que lleguen a ser personas de bien en el futuro.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Niquinohomo, in the department of Masaya, Mrs. Vera Gema Pavon Lopez works daily at the City Hall. She has worked as a social promoter for the past 6 years. She is a single mother with two daughters in her care. With a great deal of effort she supports them and provides them with all that they need to have a healthy childhood. 

Her dream is to progressively improve their house in order to provide her children with the necessary living conditions. For this reason she has approached Ceprodel and she requests a loan to carry out some hope improvements. 

She wants her daughters to grown up in a healthy and safe environment, so that they will grow up to be upstanding citizens in the future.

loans.use: To carry out some home improvements.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida lives in Faisalabad which is Pakistan’s third largest city and known for its textile industry. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area of Barkatpura. She moved here 10 years ago. She is 46 years old and is a widow who has a 21-year-old son who works in a private company for a reasonable income. 

After the death of her husband, Khalida had to work to support her family. She started a clothes-selling business. She takes orders from her neighborhood clients and fills them by purchasing the clothes from different shops in the city. Because Faisalabad is famous for its textiles, Khalida’s clothes-selling business is going very well. 

She is a very responsible person, and as a mother she is taking care of her family very well. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk which will allow her to offer more variety and to target a wider clientele. 

She has been operating this business for the past 5 years and hopes that the loan investment will bring positive changes to it and she will be able to save some profit from improved income for the marriage of her son in future. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with her hand raised is Khalida.

loans.use: To buy clothes for clothes-selling business

loans.name: Nazmia

texts.en: Nazmia is 40 years old, married and lives in the town of Chtoura with her husband and two children. She makes a living producing and selling curtains, furniture covers and blankets. Nazmia is applying for this loan from Al Majmoua to improve her business by buying more patterns. This is her fifth loan from Al Majmoua, and she has used all of the previous ones to improve her financial situation. She is also very good about making payments on time. Nazmia plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business and care for her family.

loans.use: To buy patterns for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Nhem S., 28, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. S. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 25 on food and USD 25 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a trailer to attach to the motorbike for her husband to provide transportation services. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to attach to the motorbike to provide transportation services.

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en: Chhuon S. is a 27-year-old farmer who lives in Prey Chor commune, Kompong Cham province. Chhuon S. is married to Mr. Kong Kimsroun, age 27, who works with her in the farming business. This couple has years pf experience in the agriculture sector. They can grow their crops accordingly in the rainy season and dry season, and they mostly get great results from their crop-growing business. In addition, Chhuon S. has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn more income. Chhuon S. has requested a loan in order to buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 30-year-old hardworking man living in a rented house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the family rests solely with him, and he desires to have an educated family and to build a house.

Robert started a retail shop three years ago with capital of 100,000 shillings, an amount that has since grown to 800,000 shillings. He needs the loan to buy bread and rice for his shop and dreams of one day becoming a wholesaler. High taxes are his main challenge.

loans.use: to buy bread and rice to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.es:
Teresita M. B. vive cerca de cimarrón de Cartago, ella vende ropa importada en su comunidad.
Desde hace poco tiempo ella encontró un contacto para importar ropa y venderla en su comunidad. Gracias a que el pueblo es lejano el negocio a sido todo un éxito sin embargo no ha podido crecer lo suficiente y la demanda es cada vez mayor. Por eso necesita un préstamo de ₡500 000 ( quinientos mil colones). Para invertir mas y mejorar sus ingresos, esto le permitirá mejorar su situación económica y el estudio de sus hijos.
Ella es socia  de la Empresa de Crédito comunal Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Teresita M. B. lives near Cimarrón de Cartago.  She sells imported clothes in her community.

A short while ago she found a contact to import clothes and sell them in her community.  Thanks to the fact that the town is very far away, the business has been a total success.  Nevertheless, she has not been able to grow enough, and the demand is higher each day.

That is why she needs a loan for 500,000 colones.  She will use it to invest more in her business and improve her earnings.  This will allow her to improve her financial situation and her children’s education.

She is a member of the Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón community loan company which is one of the 110 member companies of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en: Olga, 35 years old, is a mother of three school-aged children. She is married to a farmer. She has a corn farm in her village and she earned PHP 20,000 at the last cropping. She has operated her business for almost four years. She decided to take a loan from KIVA of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional farm inputs for her corn farm. Her profits will be used to pay for the labor of some farmers who will help her till her farm.

loans.use: To purchase additional farm inputs

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 31 years old and married. She has two children aged seven and six. Joan and her husband are both farmers. They work together to keep their farm productive. Rice is the primary crop that they grow. Joan does her best to help provide for her family's needs. She also makes sure her kids eat well and are healthy.

Joan's loan will be used to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: 6 Tân Nam  Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hạnh, the group leader of the 2.12.1.6 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, comprised of six members, is 44 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa, an urban town in Thanh Hoa Province.

Hạnh has been operating a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables for one year. Since her main business hardship is a lack of capital, she is requesting her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women to purchase more vegetables for her business.

In the future, Hạnh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, ensure her business success, and remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor Mario es chofer; es socio propietario en el sindicato Litoral y su esposa trabaja en una empresa privada. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción: cemento, arena, ladrillos y otros ya que construirá una habitación nueva. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Achachicala  de la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Esta es la tercera vez que su crédito es canalizado a través de Kiva
texts.en: Señor Mario es a driver; he is a member of the Litoral union and his wife works in a private company.  The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of construction materials: cement, sand, bricks and other items as he is building a new room.  He lives in his own house located in the Achachicala zone in La Paz city, and is married with four children.  This is the third time that his loan is being channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, to build a new room in his home.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en:
Nilufar is a 44-year-old farmer who lives in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She has two children. In 1998, in order to support her family and cover all expenses, Nilufar decided to start her own land cultivating business. With a starting capital of 50,000 KGS, she managed to expand her business by engaging in cultivating cherries and crab cherries. With her business revenues, she was able to pay for education of her children. 

Nilufar plans to use this loan of 100,000 KGS to buy mineral fertilizers and package materials for harvest transportation. With the revenues from the loan, she plans further broadening of her business. 

About Bai-Tushum and Partners

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. It is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a 24-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur.  He is not married and for the past five years has owned a general store selling rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

He will use this loan to purchase more goods to sell in his store so he can continue to generate more profits.  In the future, he plans to build a house for himself and dreams of having a larger store.

loans.use: to buy goods for sale such as cooking oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  He is 28 years old, married to Ann and they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of Kshs 25,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.  He hopes the income from selling milk will boost his farm income.

In future, Patrick hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zadock

texts.en:
Zadock is 32 years old and has been in farming in Kitale, Western Kenya, for 5 years with two farmhands. His farm produces maize, eggs, and vegetables. He is still single and earns additional income from pool table games in the town.

Zadock has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. He says he has experience with the poultry business and that additional birds will ensure a better income. He hopes to grow his poultry business and venture into the dairy business. He says all of this will contribute to building a strong foundation for a future family.

Zadock says lack of financing is the greatest challenge to farmers. He adds that Juhudi Kilimo's loans are the best.

loans.use: To purchase birds for his poultry business

loans.name: Maria Bersabe

texts.es:
Doña María, vive con su esposo, tiene casa propia, se dedica a vender especias (condimentos), como achiote, pimienta, cominos en el mercado municipal.
Ella quiere diversificar su negocio y por eso está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para que le ayuD. a comprar especias, como pimienta, comino, laurel orégano.
Su objetivo atraer a nuevos clientes para el consumo D. sus productos, mejorando así el negocio, creciendo como comerciante.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband.  She has her own house, and sells spices (condiments), such as achiote (annatto seeds), pepper, and cumin in the municipal market. 

She wants to diversify her business, and that's why she is applying for another loan, to help her buy spices such as pepper, cumin, bay leaf, and oregano. Her aim is to attract new customers for her products, and in this way improve her business, growing as a merchant.

loans.use: To buy condiments: pepper, cumin, bay leaf, and oregano for her business.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée å un couturier. Elle a 02 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le premier a 20 ans et le dernier 18 ans.
Ablavi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 11ans. Elle vend à toute personne dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Ablavi a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes et des habits. 
Dans les prochaines années, Ablavi voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’assurer l’épanouissement de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ablavi is 41 years old. She is married to a tailor. She has two children both of whom have had schooling. The eldest is 20 years old and the youngest is 18. Ablavi has been working as a retailer for the past 11 years. She sells to all persons who enter her shop. She buys her products in Lome.
Ablavi requested her first WAGES loan cycle to buy pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and other clothing.
In the coming years, Ablavi would like to expand her business. She said that with her profits, she plans to ensure her children's personal fulfillment.

loans.use: Buy pagnes and clothing

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira is the leader of this group. She is 42 and married to an entrepreneur. Together they bring up three sons and a daughter. The older son studies at university and other children are in school. The family is engaged in wholesale trade of meat. They started this business is 1996 and since that time Damira together with her husband achieved good results. With the profits gained they were able to build a house. At the moment, Damira applies for the loan because she needs money to purchase two livestock animals for breeding, fattening and further resale. She also plans to purchase feed for livestock. In the future she wishes to purchase a piece of land near to Bishkek to start building a house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Nonghin Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZOENABOU est la représentante du groupe Nonghin. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 10ans. Trois(03) de ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle vend de pagnes depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes, hommes.

Elle veut ajouter de l’argent pour s’acheter une balle de pagnes.

Mme avec ses économies contribue à l’épanouissement de son foyer et épargne un peu. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin de pagnes et aider à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. ZOENABOU is the representative of Nonghin Group. She's married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 19, the youngest is 10. All three of them attend school. She has five persons to support.

She's been selling pagnes (colorful African cloth) for five years. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market in town. Her customers are both women and men.

She would like to have additional money to buy one bale of pagnes. With her savings, she helps her household to thrive. She ambitions to open a large pagnes store and help her children to study.

loans.use: to buy one bale of pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Sonia Elba

texts.es: Sonia Elba D. cuarenta y cinco años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos. Ella posee una pupuseria que es muy conocida en la localidad, pues prepara unas pupusas exquisitas, revueltas, D. queso, chicharrón etc. Todo con material D. calidad y a un buen precio, además el lugar donD. las venD. es muy higiénico; Sonia es una mujer entregada a su trabajo siempre está dispuesta a aprovechar las oportunidades que se le presentan ella piensa que para triunfar hace falta solamente la voluntad D. llegar a la cima, y Sonia tiene la voluntad por delante, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar chicharrón, queso, frijoles, maíz, harina D. arroz, tomates etc. Sonia Elba tiene la confianza que con su esfuerzo lograra darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Sonia Elba is 45 years old and lives with her spouse and children.  She has a pupusa shop that’s very well known in her community because she prepares exquisite revueltas, cheese, pork, etc. pupusas. [The two most common pupusas are the pupusa D. queso (cheese) and more popular pupusa revuelta with mixed ingredients of queso (cheese), frijoles (beans),and chicharrón. Pupusas are typically served with curtido (lightly fermented cabbage slaw with red chilies and vinegar) and a watery tomato salsa.]  

All of her ingredients are good quality and her prices are affordable.  Besides, the place she sells them at is very hygienic.  Sonia is a woman who is dedicated to her work; she’s always ready to take advantage of opportunities that present themselves.  She thinks that to be successful all one needs is the will to reach the top and Sonia has will to spare.  This is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy pork, cheese, beans, corn, rice flour, tomatoes, etc.  Sonia Elba is confident that with her efforts she’ll be able to give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy pork, cheese, beans, corn, rice flour and tomatoes.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a 44-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be neat and patient. She operates a grocery store where she sells kale, onions, tomatoes, cabbages and other green vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are restaurants. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the 20,0000 Kenyan shilling loan to increase stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to grow it into a wholesale one within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will grow the business and construct a permanent premises where she will be able to run her business smoothly.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Mairamkhan

texts.ru: Майрамхан целеустремленная и трудолюбивая женщина. Более 17 лет она занимается продажей продуктов питания. У неё широкий ассортимент товаров, разные виды сладостей, консервные продукты, сахар, мука, макароны и т.д. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес, и хочет открыт еще одну торговую точку в центре рынка, который позволит ей получать хорошую прибыль. С этой целью она запрашивает займ, и заранее благодарит вас всех за поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Mairamkhan is a goal-oriented and hardworking woman. For more then 17 years she has been managing a grocery stall. She has a wide range of goods for sale: sweets, canned food, sugar, flour, pasta and the like. She wants to expand her business and open a second stall at the center of the towns' market, which is sure to yield good profits. For this purpose Mairamkhan is requesting a loan and would like to thank in advance fo your support and help.

loans.use: to expand her business and open a new store in the center of the market

loans.name: Esther Alouch

texts.en:
Esther is 27 years old, married and has three children ranging from four to eleven years old. She describes herself as a humble, talkative and God-fearing woman. 
She has been selling clothes and vegetables for the last ten years. Her business is faced with the challenge of the increased price of goods. 
Esther will be using the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of vegetables and used clothes. In the future, Esther wants to run a boutique.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes and vegetables.

loans.name: Consolate

texts.en:
Consolate is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has five children. For the past ten years, Consolate has been working hard to manage her dairy farm, which sells milk produced by her cows. 

To help expand her business, Consolate has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cows to produce milk for resale and will help Consolate generate increased profits and buy food to feed her family. Consolate hopes that in the future she will be able to construct a large cattle ranch. 

Consolate is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Consolate who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cows to produce milk for resale.

loans.name: Luceta

texts.en:
Luceta is 65 years old, married, and has five children. 

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Luceta is borrowing 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

Luceta has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from a sari sari (general) store. 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 35 years old and married to Lucy. They have two children.

Elijah has been in his current business for the last ten years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000. He hopes to use these funds to buy more donkeys for water supply transport and to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more donkeys for water supply transport.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, 39, is a farmer as well as a Khmer noodle seller who carries her noodles and its soup with a yoke, going through the village every day. She typically earns an average of $5.00 per day to cover her daily expenses. She has been blessed with a single child, who is studying in grade 9 in a local public junior high school in the Baray district. 

In the past, she used to buy stocks of rice from local farmers after harvesting season to store it up for her future business. However, she won’t be able to keep this business running without sufficient capital. Thus, Mao would like to borrow some funds from HKL to purchase stocks of rice for future sale, when its market demand increases. In the future, she hopes to expand this business, and she wants to be the owner of a big stock of rice in the province.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of rice for future sale.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia, age 35, is the hard-working single mother of three children. She started as a local gin distiller and saved her money to build the houses that she now offers for rent. Her primary challenge is when tenants do not pay on time. 

Her family goal is to see her children educated, and her business goal is to expand her business to new markets. 

Olivia intends to use the loan to renovate her rental houses.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Céline

texts.fr: Céline âgée de 49 ans,a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Céline est mariée à un entrepreneur du nom de Michel. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et trois à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, Céline vend depuis vingt ans, des mèches dans sa boutique sise à son domicile. Parallèlement à son activité, Céline vend aussi divers produits. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Céline sollicite pour une sixième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés

loans.use: Acheter des mèches.

loans.name: Midemahoudo Group

texts.fr: MIDEMAHOUDO est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Pascal (celui qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgé de 53 ans. Pascal est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Victoire. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Pascal  et sa femme. Pour cette raison, Pascal vend des fagots de bois depuis une dizaine d'année ; qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Parallèlement à son activité, Pascal vend aussi de l'huile de palme. Pascal s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Pascal sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MIDEMAHOUDO, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des fagots de bois et de l'huile de palme.

loans.name: Elias David

texts.en:
David is 48 years old and lives in the municipality of Sahagun. He has a son who helps him a lot in his work and to provide for the family, so he feels very proud of him. 2 years ago he started a stationery where he sells a great amount of products, something he learned from his brother in law.

The inputs can be really expensive and he wants to invest in his business, but right now he doesn’t have the money to do this. He expects that the investment will help him improve the conditions of the stationery and make it sustainable. He’s asking for a loan so he can make some adjustments to the stationery and to pay for some work force. 

David wants also to improve his house, something he hopes the business will let him do. Help David now with the loan he needs.

loans.use: make some adjustments to the stationery and to pay for some work force

loans.name: Suepasi

texts.en: Suepasi is a married lady with 7 children, all attending district schools due to cheaper of school fees. With her first loan in January 2004, she has developed her taro plantation, which is their main source of income that is financing her children’s education. She can now also afford to bring her children to the National Hospital in town where her children are been given good medications that are not available in the village. Suepasi’s husband is her right hand with the business, he’s the one responsible for selling taro twice a week, mainly on Friday and Saturday.

loans.use:
Buy chemicals, weed killer and fertilizer.       
Home Improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his horticulture and trading business

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Mr. Yao A. was born on 19 December 1980 in Havé. Having become a mechanic after three years of apprenticeship, he married a dressmaker, with whom he has two children. Dynamic and a master of his job, he is a good entrepreneur and has managed his previous loans and repaid them without incident.

To be able to carry out his work efficiently and make it profitable, he is asking for a loan of $750 which will serve to buy wrenches and other work materials. This will allow him to increase his income in order to better support his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Yao est né le 19 décembre 1980 à Havé. Devenu mécanicien après trois ans d’apprentissage, il s’est marié à une couturière avec qui il a fait deux enfants. Dynamique et maîtrisant son métier, il est un bon entrepreneur et a su gérer les crédits obtenus et les a remboursé sans aucun incident.

Pour pouvoir accomplir efficacement son travail et rentabiliser celui-ci, il sollicite un crédit de $750 qui servira à l’achat des clés et autres matériels de travail. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus afin de mieux entretenir sa famille.

loans.use: To buy wrenches and other work materials

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is married with two children. She is a religious person who practices good morals in the community. She is very hardworking and has benefited a lot from our lady of unity women group. She has a small retail shop which is the only source of income. She started her business with the help of a small group loan. She is applying a loan to buy goods in order to meet her customer’s needs. She is willing to repay her loan on monthly basis.

loans.use: Naomi would like to buy house hold goods for her retail shop.

loans.name: Dilara

texts.en: Dilara A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in south-western Azerbaijan. She is an Internally Displaced Person from Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. She is 47 years old, and married with 3 children. Dilara has worked as a chemist  for a long time. Now she rents a chemist's shop in Beylagan. She applied to Normicro for a loan of $700 to expand her business.

loans.use: To Expand Business

loans.name: Maleyka

texts.en: Maleyka G. is an Internally Displaced Person from Khojavend city in Azerbaijan. Now she is settled with her husband and two children in Beylagan, a small city in south western Azerbaijan. They are engaged in cattle-breeding. Maleyka wants to increase the number of her cows. She needs a $500 loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Sala

texts.en: Sala is a mother of 3 and is 41 years of age. She started the Levili Toefuataina centre. Her business is a flea market stall selling handicrafts and Samoan food just in front of her house. She earns more than $100.00- $200.00 WST ($40-80 USD) a week. Her husband works as one of the security guards in town but Sala never relies on his pay for her family remittances.

loans.use: To restock her flea market stall

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Mrs. Elsa belongs to the Nuevo Eden communal bank located in the district of Yarina Cocha in the neighborhood of Ucayal. She is 55 years old. She is mother of 9 children, 6 are adults and 3 still live with her. She is married and her husband is a chainsaw mechanic. With the first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles that she received she decided to invest in the sale of typical food of the region.

Presently she works for herself and operates a small restaurant out of her house. She has to wake up really early to go to the market and buy ingredients for the food that she prepares to sell in the afternoons.

With the loan of 1,500 Peruvian Soles, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will invest in some essential ingredients that she needs to make her business grow. She will purchase 1 large bag of rice, a large slab of meat, 10 kilograms of salted meat, 10 kilograms of sausage, fish, 1 large bag of charcoal, 3 boxes of eggs, 1 large bag of sugar and other necessary items.

Elsa is very happy. During the time that she has been working with Manuela Ramos she has done very well and she is very grateful to the organization for all of the support she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Gabe of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Elsa pertenece al banco comunal Nuevo Edén, ubicado en Jr. 7 de Junio 415, distrito de Yarina Cocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 55 años, es madre de 9 hijos, 6 son mayores de edad y 3 tres aún viven con ella, es casada y su esposo es mecánico de motosierras. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en la venta de comidas típicas de la región.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de comidas en su casa, para lo cual se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado y comprar los insumos para la preparación de los platos y en la tarde sale a vender.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, carne de monte, 10 kilos de cecinas, 10 kilos de chorizo, pescados, 1 saco de carbón, 3 cajas de huevos, 1 saco de azúcar, etc.

Elsa se siente bien. Durante todo el tiempo que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos le va muy bien y está muy agradecida de la Institución por el apoyo que recibe.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients (sugar, rice, meat, and other necessary items)

loans.name: Nhóm Chị Thư - Cụm Vọng Nguyệt - Tam Giang Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Thư 33 years old, has two children who are still going to school. She is breeding pigs. Besides that, she and her husband also work on the rice field, and make wine. Her family income is 4.5-5 USD/day. Other members of the group also have different ideas to use the borrowed money.
Mrs. Huệ buys chicken-feed and veterinary medicines for her chickens.
Mrs. Đảmbuys more merchandise for her general store.
Mrs. Giao buys more pigs.
Mrs. Hà buys chicken-feed for her chickens.
Mrs.Giang buys wasted-metal material and also makes tofu to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Thư, 33 tuổi có 2 con đang đi học. Chị nuôi rất nhiều lợn thịt. Chị mua cám cho lợn ăn, N.ài chăn nuôi lợn, vợ chồng chị còn làm ruộng, nấu rượu. Thu nhập trung bình của gia đình chị khoảng 70 - 80 000 đồng/ngày. Các thành viên còn lại trong nhóm có mục đích sử dụng vốn rất đa dạng.
Chị Huệ thêm vốn mua cám, thuốc thu y cho gà đẻ của gia đình.
Chị Đảm thêm vốn mua hàng tạp hoá bán tại nhà.
Chị Giao thêm vốn mua lợn giống.
Chị Hà vay vốn để mua cám cho đàn gà đẻ.
Chị Giang vay vốn để đi chợ sắt vụn và làm đậu phụ bán.

loans.use: to buy pig mash, chicken-feed, veterinary medicine, merchandise for general store

loans.name: Mujeres Rukux Ulew Group

texts.en:
The Rukux Ulew trust bank is composed of 14 women, most of them mothers with young children. They all live in Aldea Saquitacaj, which is an isolated rural village deep in the department of Chimaltenango. Impressively, the majority can read and write. Together, they are more than just a “Banco Comunal,” but a tightly knit social group. They chat freely in both Spanish and their native tongue, Kaq’ichel. Hope for a better tomorrow is a common theme. It has united them.

Today is a day of excitement for this group of clients because they are going to receive their first loan at Friendship Bridge. Finally, the women of Rukux Ulew are going to have a chance to expand their business and, at least, attempt to have a sustainable source of income.

Almost all of the women have sustained themselves by raising animals and tending crops. These ladies believe that their 1350 Quetzales loan (an average of US $178), can launch them into the more lucrative business of Guatemalan weaving.

The loan would be used to buy fabric for their weaving. The women plan to do all the weaving themselves, and the finished fabrics would be sold in the nearby market in San Jose Poaquil.

It is impressive how most of these women have more than one business. Portfolio diversification is a strategy they are currently managing. This shows that, even though these women live in a remote area, they have managed to learn updated and sophisticated managerial skills.

These women hope that their future investment will increase their daily income and will help them achieve a better future, a future in which education for their kids is not just a dream, but a possibility.

loans.use: To buy thread and fabric to weave traditional Guatemalan blouses

loans.name: Francis Kwabena

texts.en:
A. Francis Kwabena is a successful carpenter. He is married and has 2 children. Business is good, but he needs additional capital to match his rising customer demand and high production costs.

He is asking for $525 to buy more raw materials for production.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for production.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa M., 26, is married and has four children. Currently, her husband does contract work and contributes money to the family every fortnight. Luisa has been in the business of making pancakes for the last year, and sells her cooking to locals who stop by her food stall on the road near her village six days a week. She has no previous loans from SPBD, but does bring in a weekly net cash flow of about $125. SPBD loans are Luisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy a gas oven, wok, bags of flour, a bag of sugar and oil

loans.name: Didi

texts.es:
Didi is 42 years old and the father of three small children. His kids are his inspiration for hard work. Didi owns a motor taxi business. He also works as a mechanic from his small shop when he has time between transporting passengers, or when he has requests. He used to work buying and selling wood before he started this business. He wants to continue to build his new business. He is requesting a loan to expand his shop and make necessary repairs to his motor taxi, so he can continue to grow his income and support his family.

El señor Didi de 42 años de edad, es padre de 03 pequeños, quienes son su inspiración para alcanzar el progreso, es propietario de un mototaxi y se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, también tiene un pequeño taller mecánico en donde en sus ratos libres o cuando le solicitan algún servicio apertura.Anteriormente se dedicaba a la compra y venta de madera. Se caracteriza por ser un padre emprendedor y decidido que quiere seguir creciendo sin embargo requiere de un préstamo para mandar a ampliar su taller y reparar su vehículo para no disminuir las ganancias de su labor tan útiles para su familia.

loans.use: TO MAKE REPAIRS TO HIS MOTOR TAXI AND EXPAND HIS AUTO MECHANIC BUSINESS.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is the wife of M. and lives in the city of Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. She has lived in a two-room brick house for the last 22 years, and is the mother of four sons. Her oldest son works in a factory. The next oldest son raises buffalos. Her younger children are enrolled in a local neighborhood school. Her husband is a land owner who farms for a living.

Naseem baji contributes to the family income by running a milk business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan) and is applying for a new loan to buy a buffalo to expand her small company. She is making this application with two other people. Sharifan baji also wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Yanet Rosa

texts.es:
Yanet is 33 years old and a single mother who lives with her four children: Mery, who is 12, Yeni, 10 years old, Esther, 4 years of age, and Albino, who is only one. Yanet was born in the Pusi district, but has lived in the city of Juliaca for four years now. She did not finish her education given that she had to start work at a young age to help out her family financially. Yanet has dedicated herself to a number of occupations which is how, two years ago, she began selling clothing door-to-door throughout Juliaca. She enjoys this business because the clothing is much sought-after by local residents. The most difficult part is moving her merchandise around to sell. Thanks to God, she counts on the support of her children who are always close to help her with her daily sales which she carries out all day. Yanet had to help her children get ahead single-handedly, and wants to bring them better opportunities as they grow and become men and women. With the money from her loan, she thinks she will purchase more merchandise so she can in that way increase her income. In addition, she would like to open a clothing store so she can feel successful as a person and to provide a better quality of life for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

Yanet tiene 33 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus cuatro hijos; Mery de 12, Yeni de 10, Esther de 4 y Albino de 1 añito. Yanet nació en el distrito de Pusi, pero reside en la ciudad de Juliaca hace 4 años, no terminó sus estudios primarios debido a que se tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a su familia con la economía. Yanet se ha dedicado a trabajar en diferentes ocupaciones, es así, que hace dos años se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de Juliaca, gustándole este negocio ya que la ropa es muy solicitada por la gente, lo más difícil es tener que trasladar la mercadería hasta el lugar de venta, gracias a Dios cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, los cuales siempre están cerca para ayudarla durante la venta que es todo el día. Yanet tuvo que sacar adelante a sus cuatro hijos sola, ella quiere brindarles un mejor porvenir para que sean hombres y mujeres de provecho. Con el dinero del préstamo piensa adquirir mercadería y así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos, además desea abrir una tienda de ropa, para sentirse exitosa como persona y para brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell (clothing) and, later own, establish her own store.

loans.name: Mame Anta

texts.fr: Mame Anta N. est une femme mariée agée de 27 ans.elle habite à la cité lamy de thiés et gére une boutique depuis deux ans. elle sollicite ce pret pour le renforcement de sa boutique d'alimentation générale.
texts.en:
Mame Anta N. is a married 27-year-old woman. She lives in the Cité Lamy district of Thiés and has been managing a shop for two years. She is requesting this loan to bolster her shop selling food items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her shop

loans.name: Sabougnouman (Porte Bonheur) Group

texts.fr:
Sabougnouman est un regroupement de neuf (9) femmes (constitué de 3 veuves et de 6 mariés) ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames traditionnelles dans le quartier bamanan kin de kirango dans la sous préfecture de Markala (quatrième région administrative du Mali).
Appartenant toutes à la même association traditionnelle d’entraide et à la une même activité génératrice de revenu à savoir l’achat vente du poisson et des céréales, les femmes du groupe Sabougnouman décidèrent ensemble de rejoindre l’institution depuis maintenant deux ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés les deux prêts précédents, le groupe est à son troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).
Elles comptent utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, 50 paniers de poisson, 5 barres de glace, 12 sacs de mil, 4 sacs de riz et 2 sacs d’haricot. Tandis qu’elles s’approvisionnent en poisson au bord du fleuve Niger à l’entrée du barrage de Markala auprès des pêcheurs,  les céréales quant à elles au marché hebdomadaire de Diamarabougou les dimanches auprès des forains grossistes. Si une partie du poisson est vendue à l’état frais (à une clientèle féminine), l’autre partie est fumée à domicile sur des foyers traditionnels conçus spécialement pour cette activité, pour ensuite être vendus en détail parfois au marché journalier de Kirango Markala, à Ségou et à Bamako (capitale du Mali) à des grossistes. Les grains de céréales sont vendus au marché de Diamarabougou à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes et généralement en détail et au comptant.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 32.000FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour la prise en charge des frais scolaires des enfants et aider les époux à subvenir aux charges familiales. Elles ont pour ambition d’acheter une maison à usage d’habitation surtout pour les orphelins.
texts.en:
Sabougnouman (meaning 'good luck charm') is a group of nine women (of whom three are widows and six are married). The group members average 41 years of age and five children. They live in traditional polygamous families in the Bamanan Kin district of Kirango, in the sub-prefecture of Markala (fourth administrative region of Mali). Each belonging to the same traditional mutual-aid association and doing the same income-generating work, namely buying and selling fish and grain, the women of the Sabougnouman group decided jointly to sign up with the institution two years ago. After having correctly repaid their two preceding loans, the group is on its third solidarity loan (group loan). They intend to use this new loan to buy: 50 baskets of fish, 5 slabs of ice, 12 sacks of millet, 4 sacks of rice, and 2 sacks of beans. While they get their supplies of fish from fishermen on the River Niger at the entrance of the Markala Dam, the grain is gotten from wholesale vendors at the weekly marketplace of Diamarabougou on Sundays. If a portion of the fish is sold fresh (to women customers), the rest is smoked at home over traditional hearths designed especially for this, in order to be sold retail to bulk merchants, sometimes at the daily marketplace of Kirango Markala, in Ségou and in Bamako (the capital of Mali). The grain is sold at the Diamarabougou marketplace to customers composed of women and men and generally in cash at the retail level. They each hope to realize an average profit of 32,000 francs CFA each month that will be used for covering the children's school fees and to help their husbands meet family expenses. Their ambition is to buy a house in which to live, especially for the orphans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fish and grain

loans.name: Helena Bernardo

texts.pt:
Helena Bernardo M. natural do distrito da manhiça um dos distritos nortenhos da província do Maputo, tem 54 anos de idade, mãe de 3 filhos com idade entre o primeiro tem 30 anos e o ultimo tem 25 anos. Para alem dos filhos vive com mais duas pessoas na sua casa que ela sustenta.

Helena estudou até 9ºclasse e parou por situações profissionais, dado que ela fez as ultimas classes enquanto trabalha. Helena vive de negocio que consiste na venda de carne qual compra o quilo por 80,00mt e vende por 95,00mt;   Amendoim que compra o saco por 900,00mt e vende por 1600,00mt. Tem um rendimento mensal de 28000,00mt.

Para Helena este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com este pretende aumentar a mercadoria para responder a demande na quadra festiva que se avizinha. Futuramente pretende melhorar as condições habitacionais.
texts.en:
Helena Bernardo M., originally from the district of Manhiça – one of the Northern districts of the province of Maputa – is 54 years old and has 3 children, the oldest of which is 30 and the youngest, 25. As well as her children, she also lives with another two people whom she supports.

Helena studied until the 9th grade, stopping for professional reasons and then finished the last few years whilst working at the same time. Helena lives off her business selling meat, which she buys for 80,00 MZN and sells for 95,00 MZN as well as peanuts, which she buys at 900,00 MZN per bag and sells at 1600,00 MZN per bag. She has a monthly income of 28000,00 MZN.

This is Helena’s first loan from Hluvuku and from Kiva. She intends to increase her stock in order to meet demand in the coming festive season. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock of food for sale in festive season

loans.name: Nneka

texts.en: Nneka sells electrical materials such as fuses, switches, bulbs, wires and more. Nneka is 27 years old and married. Nneka lives in the state of Lagos, Nigeria. She needs a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more electrical materials to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and resell Christmas trees

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Шомуродов Дильшод житель Гиссарского района. Возраст 27 лет, женат . Пока детей не имеет. По профессии шофер. Работает водителем маршрутного такси. Имеет автомашину марки "Газель".Его дело приносит неплохой доход , но в данный момент он должен произвести капитальный ремонт автомашины. Поэтому он решил получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dilshod S. lives in the Gissar region. He is 27 years old, married and does not yet have any children. He works as a taxi driver and owns a 'Gazelle' make of car. His business makes a decent profit but at the moment he needs to have a big auto-service done on the car. He plans to use the loan for this service and to repay it in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car service and repair

loans.name: Tusichukiane Group

texts.en:
For the last three years Asha has owned a small store in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar, where she sells firewood and various food items. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $310 by working 14 hours a day.  She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood to sell to her customers. She is hoping that this loan will allow her to increase her profits and grow her business.  

Asha is 30 years old, married and has three children ages 8, 2 and 8 months. She also cares for three other dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, whose names are Mtumwa, Nizuma, Tatu and Sada. Each woman also runs a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for her business.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie T., 31 years old, is married and is blessed with four children. She lives in Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province in Southern Philippines. Three of her children are in school and the eldest is in fourth grade. Their main source of income is the tricycle that they own. Her husband is the tricycle driver. (Tricycles are the mode of transportation in their province.) 

Currently, their tricycle is not working due to problems with the wheels and some spare parts that are not functioning. Her husband has started an art and sign printing business to earn an income while the tricycle is not working. She wants to repair the tricycle, so she needs PHP 5,000 for repair and maintenance. This will be her first loan from HSPFI and if it is granted, they can have a good and comfortable living.

loans.use: To purchase wheels and spare parts for their tricycle

loans.name: Susana Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario tiene su domicilio en la comarca de Pacayita, del municipio de Masaya, los tres se dedican a la misma actividad de elaboración y venta de muebles,sus talleres están ubicados en los patios de sus casas y venden en los mercados del país, generalmente tienen clientes fijos que se llevan toda la producción, ellos compran los materiales juntos para que estos les salgan más baratos. Son muy unidos, solidarios y de buenas recomendaciones.


Doña Susana es artesana en madera desde muy joven, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres. Es madre soltera de dos niños de 4 y 6 años, esto le ha instado a salir adelante para lograr darles educación y sus manutención; trabaja con su hermano menor que también es soltero y se han organizado para manejar el negocio, tiene 4 trabajadores y las máquinas son de ella, tiene casa propia que poco a poco ha ido construyendo. Los productos que elaboran son puertas, juegos de muebles, mesas y comedores, en muchos casos los encargos son un poco extraños pero se aprenden a elaborarlos.
Espera seguir creciendo con Adim, se siente muy satisfecha de poder trabajar por sí sola y haber obtenido créditos en base a la confianza.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is located in the region of Pacayita in the Masaya municipality. The three members all work making and selling furniture. Their workshops are located in their home patios and they sell in the country markets. Generally, they have fixed customers who buy all of their products. They buy their materials together to get them cheaper. They are very united and have good recommendations. Susana has been a wood craftswoman since she was very young; she learned this activity from her parents. She is a single mother with a four-year-old and a six-year-old, which is what drives her to succeed so she can give them an education and provide for them. She works with her younger brother who is also single, and they have organized themselves to manage the business. They have four workers, and Susana owns the machinery. She has her own house, which she has been building little by little. The products they make are doors, furniture sets, tables and dining tables. In many cases, the orders are strange, but they learn to make them. She hopes to keep growing with Adim; she is very satisfied that she is able to work for herself and to have obtained credit based on trust.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu is 37 years old and married with a child. She sells cooked food and drinks. She requests a loan of N 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 26-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, in southern Lebanon. Hanan has owned a bakery for three years.

She makes “saj” and “mankoucheh.” The “saj” is a metA. oven where she makes saj bread. It is a traditionA. Lebanese cooking dome that is also used to make Markouk (“thinned”) bread and doughy confections, or Mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza, and the most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it any time of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning.

Hanan requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase merchandise and raw materials for her bakery. This is the first time that Hanan has requested a loan.

Hanan is speciA. in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and she is known for the good taste of her mankoucheh. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and tourists. When she first started, she didn’t have startup capitA.. Hanan decided on doing her business because she wanted to be independent and prove to herself that she was able to handle her work. She was also self-confident. In the future, she plans on expanding her business by purchasing a new machine to do French baguettes.

loans.use: Hanan will use the loan to purchase merchandise and raw materials for her bakery.

loans.name: Sétou

texts.fr:
Madame  Sétou D. est une   veuve  de 62 ans, qui vit en location avec ses 5 enfants  dans le quartier Bagadadji de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Technicienne de santé à la retraite, elle est venue au commerce grâce à sa mère qui vendait des céréales. Elle commença ses activités génératrices de revenus par le tricotage des habits  pour enfants, le commerce d’articles divers etc. Très vite elle opte pour la fabrication et la vente des jus de boissons locaux non alcoolisés et de la glace. Elle mène cette activité depuis une dizaine d’année et  jouit   d’une grande renommée  dans le quartier et même dans la ville de Ségou. 
Pour préparer des jus, elle utilise 2 kg de sucre,  4 sachets de poudre de jus  plus  6 sachets de sucre vanille et des arômes.  
Afin d’acheter un congélateur d’une grande capacité pour  satisfaire sa clientèle, elle  fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso depuis 36 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 1 prêt individuel  tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel.
