Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter un congélateur sur place à Ségou auprès des commerçants qui se sont spécialisés  dans le domaine  de l’électroménager. Madame  Sétou D.  vend au comptant et à crédit chez elle à domicile et en ambulant à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants.   
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour épargner et subvenir à certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Ms. Sétou D. is a 62-year-old widow who is renting her place with her five children in the Bagadadji district of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). A retired health technician, she came into commerce thanks to her mother, who used to sell grains. She started her income-generating business with the knitting of clothing for children, commerce in various goods, etc. She very soon opted for making and selling local non-alcoholic juice drinks and ice cream. She has been in this business for a dozen years and enjoys great fame in her area, and even in the city of Ségou. To make juices, she uses 2 kg of sugar, 4 bags of juice powder, 6 bags of vanilla sugar, and some flavorings. In order to buy a large-capacity freezer for satisfying her customers, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso 36 months ago. After four solidarity loans and an individual loan, all correctly repaid, she is now on her second individual loan. This loan will be used to buy a freezer, locally in Ségou, from merchants who specialize in household appliances. Ms. D. makes her sales out of her home and door-to-door, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of men, women, and children. She intends to realize an average monthly profit of 37,000 francs CFA that will be put into savings and covering certain family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy  freezer

loans.name: Flordiliza

texts.en: Flordiliza is married to Danilo B. and they lived in the rural village of Buliwao Quezon Nueva Vicaya.  Farming is their major source of income in their village.  They help each generate a daily income to support the education of their children and for their daily living.  She is very eager to develop her business so she will able to earn a higher income. Flordiliza is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to acquire more products to sell.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Barfiyamo

texts.ru: Барфиямо Шодмонова проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 42 года. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Барфиямо имеет арендованную, торговую точку на рынке, где торгует морожным, напитками и т.д. Муж находится в России на заработках. Клиент просит кредит, для расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Barfiyamo S. lives in the Yavan district. She is 42 years old, married and has 3 children. Barfiyamo leases a retail stand at the market, where she sells ice-cream, drinks, etc. Her husband is working in Russia. Our client is requesting this loan for business expansion.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Jypar's Group

texts.en:
Jypar is the group’s leader. Jypar has one son and one daughter. Both of her children go to college and don’t work. At the age of 49, she works as a commander of the guard. She used to run a little farm. About a year ago she sold one calf and started selling summer hats. To spend $350 at once was a large sum for her, but she overcame her doubts and invested in hats. As a result, she earned around $200 and this allows her to pay for her children’s education.

Jypar has a desire to expand her business and to do that she needs a loan. With half of the loan she wants to buy men’s and women’s hats, and with the other half she wants to purchase children’s Panama hats. She plans to get a container and achieve $1,200 turnover. As her children grow, so do her expenses for their education. Owning and running her own container would let her meet her growing needs. 

The other members of the group are Guljamal, Jailobai and Tojihon. Guljamal is 42. She has been selling women’s clothes and has raised six children. Her spouse works as an unskilled laborer. Guljamal needs a loan to make a repair at her house, since summer is the best time to do this.

Jailobai, 38, is married. He is occupied with selling cosmetics, household goods, detergents and women’s hygienic cleansers. Four years ago he obtained a loan and started his business. So far he has bought a house and livestock. Now he needs another loan to buy different brands of detergents.

Tojihon is 29. Together with her husband, she sells men’s clothing, pants and jogging trousers. After nine years of hard work, they were able to buy a house. They want to purchase more items of clothing to attract more customers and eventually increase family income, since they intend to save funds for their sole daughter’s education.  But to do that they need to obtain a loan.


======================================
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept:  People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase men's, women's and kids' hats for the store

loans.name: Heydi Lizeth

texts.es: La joven Heydi Liseth U. Álvarez , tiene la edad de 21 años , habita en el barrio Pilas Orientales , ubicado en Masaya , junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace tres años ella  trabaja como agricultora , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de su suegro . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para obtener una buena producción y poder ofertar al mercado a buen precio.
texts.en:
The young Heydi Liseth U. Álvarez is 21 years old and lives in the neighborhood called Pilas Orientales, located in Masaya, along with her husband which she supports with the expenses of the home. She has two children in her care. The plans with regard to her family is to improve their living conditions. For three years she has worked as a farmer. The greatest difficulty that she is presented with is the lack of financing. She began this activity with the support of her father-in-law. With the loan she is going to buy fertilizers and supplies to obtain a good production and to be able to offer her crops to the market for a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en:
Mrs. Sovann C. is a villager in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates both rice and vegetables. In this plantation, she faces some problems because her field is infertile and she does not have enough money to pay for paddy farming. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, gasoline, and to hire laborers to work on the field.

Mrs. Sovann C.’s husband, Mr. Art Sophal, is a construction worker. He is shown on the right in the photo. This couple has a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, gasoline, and to hire laborers to work on the field

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet   sells planks. She is 50 years old and married with 4 children. She has been in the business for sometime now. She is requesting for the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more planks to sells. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Agonhoue Lucie

texts.fr: F. Agonhoue Lucie est née le 01/01/1984 à Abomey. Lucie est mariée à EZIN Saturnin, un agent de l’Office des Poste et Télécommunication du Bénin. Ce couple a à sa charge cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont quatre sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis vingt deux ans à Fridjrossè Kpota, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. C’est le mari de Lucie qui assure les charges de la famille. Ceci permet à Lucie d’utiliser les revenus de son activité pour mieux développer celle-ci. Lucie vend des vivres (maïs, mil, sorgho, sucre en poudre, riz, farine de manioc, haricot, huile d’arachide, etc.) et du charbon de bois. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Béatrice achète ses produits. Lucie a déjà sept ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Lucie a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Lucie demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs, de haricot, de riz et de bidons d’huile d’arachide.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is thirty-two years old. She is married and has two children, both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Faustina is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies to other retailers and beverage sellers in her community. She buys bags of flour and other ingredients from Kumasi. Faustina hawks items in her community. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy flour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies in bulk

loans.name: Kayode

texts.en:
Kayode sells drinks of different kinds. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. He is 38 and married with seven children. Kayode has been in this business for over 16 years because he loves selling drinks. He assists his family with part of his profit. 

Kayode hopes for a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more drinks and a generator to cool drinks. With this, he will attract more customers and meet their demand. He is grateful to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and a generator for cool drinks

loans.name: Méta Niassé

texts.fr: Méta Niassé MANE est une femme de 44 ans; elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont elle a la charge. Depuis 7 ans et demi elle milite dans le Banc Villageois de KANDE BANETO et y a fait des performances remarquables. Elle est vendeuse d'huile de palme et de cacahouètes, son crédit lui permettra de renforcer ses activités afin de se procurer des bénéfices afin de pouvoir participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Méta Niassé Mané, aged 44, is married and the mother of six children whom she supports. She has been an active member of the village bank Kandé Banéto with remarkable achievements for seven and a half years. Méta Niassé is active in the sale of palm oil and peanuts. This loan will enable her to strengthen her business. She will use her profit to be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her business finances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries in bulk

loans.name: Mariuxi Del Rocio

texts.es:
En el Banco Comunal Colón se reúne en la parroquia Colón perteneciente a la ciudad de Portoviejo, en este banco pudimos conversar con la señora 

Casada desde hace 14 años, tiene tres hijos ella nació en Colón, hace 5 años empezó con las ventas de Yanbal (Cosméticos vendidos por catalogo), a la señora Mariuxi siempre le han gustado los negocios antes ella tenia las ventas de artículos del hogar pero se le presentó la oportunidad de empezar algo nuevo y la hermana le ayuda a que ingrese en las ventas de los productos de Yanbal aprendió del negocio y después ella se puso lo propio continuando con las ventas de estos productos.

Todos los meses hace los pedidos según lo que los clientes deseen hay veces que tiene que invertir hasta 500  dólares en pedidos, ya tiene sus clientes fijos que son muy responsables  para esta época del año es cuando más vende.

Mariuxi es una mujer muy trabajadora no descansa con este préstamo que va a recibir de la fundación, invertirá en gran parte para los productos y la otra parte en el negocio de los boyo (Plátano verde con maní y carne) que es un plato típico de la zona de Manabí, ella junto a la tía del esposo ya tiene algún tiempo trabajando en la preparación de este delicioso plato, tiene sus pedidos que han llegado hasta preparar 1300 bollos en una semana, y es una manera de ayudarse con esta venta.
texts.en:
The communal group Colón meets in a church named Colon located in Portoviejo. It was here we could talk with the client.

She has been married for 14 years and has three children. She was born in Colón and 5 years ago started selling Yanbal cosmetics from a catalog. Señora Mariuxi always has liked this business. Before she sold household items. The opportunity presented itself to start something new and with the help of her sister, she started selling Yanbal products. She learned this business and after started selling these products alone.

Every month there are times when she must invest up to $500 in orders. Already she has regular clients who are very dependable in this part of the year with the most sales.

Mariuxi is a very hard working woman who won’t rest with this loan she is going to receive from the Foundacion. She is going to invest most of it in products and the other part in her boyo business (green bananas with noodles and beef) which is a typical dish from the Manabí zone. She, together with the aunt of her husband, have been working making this delicious dish for some time now. Her orders have reached 1300 bollos a week and this loan will help with these sales.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfumes, lip sticks and Yambal products

loans.name: Ñamba'apo Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité Ñamba'apo Oñondivepa nace hace poco más de 1 año después que varias señoras que ya se tenían experiencia en trabajo en comité decidieron empezar de nuevo. 
Las mismas son del asentamiento Marquetalia, son bastante estrictas y rigurosas en cuanto al cumplimiento en el comité, gracias a ello han logrado cancelar de manera excelente todos sus créditos.   
En promedio reciben cada una  635,924 gs., el cual será invertido en la compra de artículos que serán vendidos en sus respectivas actividades comerciales.
Este es un asentamiento con familias muy pobres pero que a pesar de todo lograron sobre llevar toda las necesidades que cada familia pasa, mediante el esfuerzo especialmente de las madres que realizan cualquier trabajo para mantener y alimentar a sus hijos.
Así como Ña Mercedes existe mucho en el asentamiento ella es una señora madre soltera de tres hijos quien se dedica al reciclaje y actualmente con el crédito de la Fundación pudo poner un puesto de ventas de empanadas y gracias a eso ya no necesitan sacrificarse tanto y por ello agradece a la fundación.

texts.en:
The group Ñamba'apo Oñondivepa ("Let's work together" in Guarani) was born a year ago after some women who already had experience working in a group, decided to start anew. The women come from the hamlet of Marquetalia, and are strict about following the rules of the group, thanks to which they have been able to pay all of their loans with an excellent record. On average, each member receives Gs. 635,924 (approx. U$D 140) which will buy supplies and products that each member will sell in their respective business. The hamlet's families are very poor, but still they have continued to survive and fulfill the needs that every family has thanks to the effort of the women who will take on any job to support and feed their children. There are many women in this community like Mercedes, who is a single mother of three children. She currently collects materials to recycle, but with a loan from Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya, she was able to start a business selling "empanadas" (turnovers) at a street vending stand. Thanks to her stand, she no longer needs to make so many sacrifices and for that, she is thankful to the Fundación. 1) Limpia G. - Snack bar 2) Maria F. - Clothing sales 3) Norma M. - Beverage and food sales 4) Teofila Avalo - Fruit and vegetable sales 5) Beatriz D. - Fruit and vegetable sales 6) Mercedes I. - "Empanada" sales 7) Sixta A. - Beverage sales 8) Expedita B. - Food sales 9) Mirian R. - Children clothing sales 10) Dolores B. - Food sales 11) Norma A. - Food sales 12) Evangelista Z. - Charcoal sales 13) Adelina Cañete - Sweets and candy sales 14) Liz Ocampos - Clothing sales 15) Teodosia C. - Perfume sales 16) Juana V. - Clothing sales 17) Mercedes Z. - Clothing sales

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products to increase their sales

loans.name: Feri

texts.en:
Feri L. is 22 and married with 2 children (ages 6 and 11).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Feri has 4 years of experience in this business.  Feri needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 230 tala or US $96 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Feri joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Feri's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Feri L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2.23 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

You can view pictures of a typical plantation in Samoa, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at:   http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/SamoanPlantation

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru: Одинаева Латофат проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 36 лет. Разведена, имеет 4 детей. Одинаева Латофат арендует торговую точку. В области торговли работает более 6 лет. Одинаева Латофат продает детскую одежду. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Latofat O. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 36 years old, divorced and has 4 children. Latofat leases a retail outlet. She has been working in the retail sales field for over 6 years. Latofat sells children's clothing. She is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Aidee  Ninfa Giménez quien invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras.

La Sra. Maria D. la Cruz P. se dedica a la venta D. bebidas, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. bebidas al por mayor, logrando D. ese modo ofrecer mayor variedad D. bebidas frescas a sus clientes.

La Sra. Aidee Ninfa Giménez se dedica a la venta D. comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. ingredientes para la elaboración D. los comestibles, logrando obtener mayor variedad D. minutas  que ofrecer a su clientela.

La Sra. Juana D. la Cruz O. se dedica a la venta D. Frutas, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. Frutas en general, obteniendo así mayor variedad D. frutas para ofrecer a sus clientes.

La Sra. Irma Concepción M. se dedica a la venta D. Producto D. Limpieza, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. insumo para la elaboración D. los productos D. limpieza, logrando D. ese modo ofrecer mayor  variedad D. productos D. limpieza a sus clientes.

La Sra. Gloria Ramona M. se dedica a la venta D. comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. ingredientes para la elaboración D. los comestible, logrando ofrecer variedad y calidad D. minutas a sus clientes.

La Sra. Yenny Elizabeth B. se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. esos productos en general, logrando D. ese modo  ofrecer buena calidad y variedad D. cosméticos a su clientela.

La Sra. Izabel B. se dedica a la venta D. helados,  invirtió el dinero en la compra D. Helados al por mayor, logrando ofrecer  buenos y variados sabores D. helados a sus clientes.

La Sra. Angelica Maria I. se dedica a la venta D. gas, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. gas al por mayor, logrando ofrecer calidad D. gas a su clientela

La Sra. Gloria Graciela C. es costurera, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. materiales para su trabajo ( telas, hilos, tijeras, etc.) logrando ofrecer buena variedad D.  prendas  a sus clientes.

La Sra. Lucia B. se dedica ala venta D. bebidas en general,  invirtió el dinero en la compra D. bebidas en general, logrando D. ese modo ofrecer mayor variedad D. bebidas frescas a sus clientes.

La Sra. Maria Lourdes B. se dedica a la venta D. Comestibles, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. ingredientes para la elaboración D. los comestibles, logrando D. eso modo ofrecer una buena variedad D. minutas a sus clientes.

La Sra. Aurora A. es costurera, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. elementos para su trabajo (telas, goma, hilos, accesorios, etc.) ofreciendo  calidad y variedad D. prendas a su clientela.

La Sra. Emilce Elizabeth S. posee una despensa, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. mercaderías en general ( embutidos, panificados, bebidas, lácteos, etc.),logrando ofrecer una  buena variedad D. mercaderías a sus clientes.

La Sra. Nancy Petrona B. se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir, invirtió el  dinero en la compra D. prendas D. vestir, logrando ofrecer D. ese modo buena variedad D. prendas D. vestir a sus clientes.

La Sra. Cristina Marisol N. se dedica a la venta D. bebidas              en general, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. bebidas en general, logrando así ofrecer una buena variedad D. bebidas frescas a sus clientes. 

La Sra. Verónica Aguilera D. O. posee un kiosco, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. mercadería en general (lácteos, comestibles, bebidas, panificados, etc.) logrando ofrecer una buena variedad D. mercaderías a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group started when Sra. Aidee Ninfa Giménez contacted her friends and invited them to organize a committee to join the Women’s Entrepreneurship Program.

Sra. Maria D. la Cruz P. sells beverages and will use her loan to buy more beverages in bulk so that she can offer a greater variety of cold drinks to her customers.

Sra. Aidee Ninfa Giménez sells prepared foods and will use her loan to buy ingredients for preparing her dishes and offering customers a wider variety of items on her menu.

Sra. Juana D. la Cruz O. sells fruit and will use her loan to buy more fruit and proviD. her customers with a wider variety.

Sra. Irma Concepción M. sells cleaning products and will use her loan to buy the supplies needed to make these products. She also hopes to offer her customers with a wider variety of cleaning products.

Sra. Gloria Ramona M. sells prepared foods and will use her loan to buy ingredients for preparing her dishes and offering customers a wider variety of items on her menu.

Sra. Yenny Elizabeth B. sells cosmetics and will use her loan to buy more of these products so that she offer her customers a wider variety of cosmetics that are of good quality.

Sra. Izabel B. sells ice cream and will use her loan to buy ice cream at wholesale with hopes of providing her customers a good product in a variety of flavors.

Sra. Angelica Maria I. sells gas and will use her loan to buy more gas at wholesale prices and continue offering this product to her customers.

Sra. Gloria Graciela C. is a seamstress and will use her loan to buy materials (fabric, thread, scissors, etc.) needed for her work. She hopes to offer her customers a variety of garments.

Sra. Lucia B. sells beverages and will use her loan to buy more of them so that she can offer her customers a variety of cold drinks.

Sra. Maria Lourdes B. sells prepared foods and will use her loan to buy ingredients for preparing her dishes and offering customers a wider variety of items on her menu.

Sra. Aurora A. is a seamstress and will use her loan to buy materials (fabric, elastic, thread, accessories, etc.) needed for her work. She hopes to offer her customers a variety of garments.

Sra. Emilce Elizabeth S. has a convenience store and will use her loan to buy general merchandise (sausages, baked goods, beverages, dairy products, etc.) so that she can offer a wider variety of products to her customers.

Sra. Nancy Petrona B. sells clothing and will user her loan to buy more inventory so that she can offer her customers a wider selection.

Sra. Cristina Marisol N. sells beverages and will use her loan to buy more of them so that she can offer her customers a variety of cold drinks.

Sra. Verónica Aguilera D. O. has a kiosk from which she sells general merchandise (dairy products, snacks, beverages, baked goods, etc.). She will use her loan to buy more of these products so that she can offer her customers a wider variety.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Obadiah

texts.en:
Obadiah is 31 years old and married and has one child who attends school. He has been running a textile business for eight years. Previously, he worked  for the G4S Security Group, but currently he has no extra source of income.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business and has become financially stable. He hopes to supply masses of clothes and other  textiles country-wide. He describes himself as hardworking and hopes to provide a better education to his children.

He has requested a loan of Kes 90,000 to add to his stock of children’s clothes.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Rustambek

texts.en:
Born in Istaravshan town in 1941, Rustambek now lives with his wife and their adult children. A teacher by profession, Rustambek is also a farmer. Recognized by the people of the neighborhood as a serious man, Rustambek would like to expand his business into a viable source of income. In order to do that, he needs a loan of 10 000 Somoni to buy seeds and fertilizer to expand his crop. With part of the loan, he will buy young cattle. The income from it will help him cope with the needs of his large family. Rustambek is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle, seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Mrs. Ry C. is 56 years old and she is a villager who lives in Boeng Krum Leu village in Kandal province. She is a pig breeder who can earn a small income to support her family.  She needs a loan to buy pig food and to dig a well for selling water. Her husband, Mr. Son Chhim, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field to cultivate rice. 

This couple has six children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is staying at home and supports the parents' businesses while the other three are students in the local school. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: Pig feed and well digging

loans.name: Ndiamé

texts.fr: Ndiamé N. est âgée de 32 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 5 ans et demi et a reçu 11 fois de suite de crédit et en a fait toujours une bonne gestion et remboursé à temps. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine, elle va acheter 10 moutons et les engraisser pendant 5 mois pour les revendre dans les marchés locaux. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndiamé N. is 32 years old, married and the mother of five children, all under her care. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” for 5 ½ years and has been granted 11 successive loans which she always managed well and reimbursed on time. She fattens sheep and will buy 10 sheep to fatten for five months, and resell them in local markets. She participates in the improvement of her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her self-financing capability

loans.name: C5252 Seeds Of Vision Group

texts.en:
Adeline is 28 years old and is married with three children. She is the president of a team called “Seed Of Vision” and this group is commonly known in the business of selling a variety of goods such as drinks, foodstuffs, and some other goods usually sold in a shop.

Adeline and her team are now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their business with the target of wholesaling to the retailers who operate the same business.

With this business expansion, Adeline and her team will hopefully earn more profits which in turn will allow each member of the group to start saving for a better future.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods such as drinks, foodstuffs, and some other goods

loans.name: Francisco Wilberto

texts.es:
Francisco Wilberto L. H., es casado y con su mujer habita en el barrio Medardo Andino, su esposa se desempeña como conserje, apoyando con sus ingresos a la economía del hogar, ellos tienen 3 hijos adolecentes que cursan la escuela secundaria, Don Francisco se desempeña como Guarda de Seguridad, ellos son una familia de recursos limitados que ambicionan con la apertura de una pulpería y la mejora de la infraestructura del hogar.

Con el apoyo de Kiva el Señor L., espera mejorar las condiciones en las que su familia actualmente habita, razon por la cual solicita este prestamo para las reparaciones de la habitación donde moran, las paredes y el techo presentan una decadencia que amenaza la seguridad e los miembros de la familia, con el préstamo desea comprar los materiales de construcción y así mismo construir una habitación màs, con el fin para mejorar las comodidades y condiciones en las que habitan, este apoyo les apura puesto que se acercan las temporadas de lluvias y vientos fuertes que debilitan aun más la estabilidad en la infraestructura  del hogar.
texts.en:
Francisco Wilberto L. H. is married, and lives with his wife in the Medardo Andino neighborhood. His wife works as a janitor, helping out with the household expenses. They have 3 adolescent children who are in secondary school. Don Francisco works as a security guard. They are a family of limited means that aspires to open a grocery store and improve the infrastructure of their home. With the support of Kiva, Señor L. hopes to improve the conditions in which the family currently lives. For this reason he requests this loan to repair their dwelling. The walls and roof are deteriorated such that they threaten the security of the members of the family. With the loan he hopes to buy construction materials and also add another room, in order to improve the comfort and conditions of the home that they live in. They need this support quickly, since the season of rain and strong winds is approaching, which would further weaken the stability of the infrastructure of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sheets of metal for roofing and cement

loans.name: Sok Khy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Khy C. is a 31-year-old married woman and a villager who lives in Chong Kaoh village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Roeun Chom, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow crops. For this farm, Mrs. Sok Khy C. decided to ask for loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline to support her crops.

Aside from farming, Mr. Roeun Chom is a fisherman who is able to earn a small income to support his family. He is shown in the photo with his wife. This couple has three children: two are attending the local school while the youngest one is four years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa N., a 52-year-old resident of Hinaplanon, Iligan City, is married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan, her fourth, for 13000 PHP to be used for the same purpose. Elsa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 58 años, vive en su casa propia, con 2 de sus 4 hijos, pues lo mayores tienen sus propias familias y son independientes.Desde hace 15 años, se dedica a la venta de productos naturales en su  puesto ubicado en el mercado de la zona por donde vive, y por el  tiempo que tiene en este negocio tiene muchos clientes que la visitan frecuentemente. Su trabajo empieza desde muy temprano, todos los días, y se extiende hasta las 5 de la tarde. Aunque su negocio  la tiene muy satisfecha, lo que le disgusta son las largas horas que tiene que permanecer bajo los rayos del sol en el mercado; pero no se desanima y continúa trabajando duro. A pesar de que hace algunos años, enfrento una dura prueba, pues  su puesto se quemo y el hecho le causo algunas heridas, siente que tiene mucho por delante. Para el futuro tiene pensado mejorar su puesto para implementarlo mejor y además quiere renovar las maderas de su puesto, para presentar una mejor imagen ante su clientela.Es el onceavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y siempre ha sido muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, porque tiene muchas ganas de continuar progresando.Julia tiene planeado invertir el  dinero solicitado en la compra  de mayor cantidad de productos naturales, con lo cual espera obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Julia, 58, lives in her own home with two of her four children because the oldest ones have their own families and are independent. For the past 15 years she has sold natural products in a sales stall she has in one of the markets near her home. Because of the long time she has been in business, she has quite a few regular customers that visit her frequently. She is open for business daily from very early in the morning until 5pm. Although her work is very satisfying what she dislikes about it is spending long hours under the relentless sun in the market. However, she doesn’t become discouraged and continues to work hard. Despite facing quite a hardship a few years ago when her stall burned down and she was injured in the fire she feels she still has much to look forward to. For the future, she plans to improve her stall both by stocking it better and by replacing the lumber in it in order to improve its appearance and make it more appealing to her customers. This is her 11th loan with MFP. She has always repaid on time because she wants to continue to make progress. Julia plans to use the funds to buy larger amounts of natural products hoping thereby to obtain increased earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural products for her business.

loans.name: Mrs. Norm Ouch Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has 19 people who live in Trapeang Dang Tuek village in Takeo province. Mrs. Norm O. is 43 years old and is a village bank president. She was selected by the other members, who will use their portion of the loan in various ways. Mrs. O. is a pig breeder and a cake seller while her husband, Mr. Yav Born, is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where he cultivates rice to sell to support his family. He is also a farming laborer. Since her business is going well she wants to expand. To improve her pig breeding, Mrs. Norm O. is requesting a loan to buy more piglets and to buy fertilizer. She is a mother of three children, who are studying in local public school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and fertilizer

loans.name: Rodelisa

texts.en:
Rodelisa S. is from the village of San Miguel, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old. Rodelisa is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rodelisa owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rodelisa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rodelisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rodelisa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rodelisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: San Miguel, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of red oil.

loans.name: Sem Pean's Group

texts.en:
There are four borrowers who are taking this loan together. The group's leader, Mrs. Sem P., is 55 years old, married and has two children. She has built a store in front of her house where she sells a few items such as cooked ingredients and sweets to the neighbors for a profit. Her husband, Pek Veth, manages their business as well as fishing at the river. Sem P. will be using her loan from Kiva to purchase extra grocery items to sell. This will allow her to accrue a profit to better meet her entire family’s daily expenses. The other borrowers include:
Mr. C., a fisherman, is asking for a loan to support his business.
Mrs. C. will be using her loan to buy nets and traps for fishing.
Mr. T., a fish catcher, is applying for a loan to buy more tools for fishing activities. (Mr. T. was not available when the photo was taken, so his wife is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase extra grocery items to sell

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.es:
La Sra. Nicasia D. Leon  es cliente antigua  D. nuestra entidad, es casada y vive en casa propia. 
La titular cuenta con una mercería hace 7 años, contando con buena clientela formada a la fecha, dicho negocio se encuentra en su domicilio.
 Dicho préstamo la titular ha retirado para la compra D. juguetes, ropas y artículos D. librería. A la fecha la Sra. Nicasia ha retirado 6 prestamos desD. el año  2005.
Dicho préstamo la titular considera que le dejara un mejor margen D. ganancia a su negocio y a la vez le dará un  mejor nivel D. vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nicasia D. Leon is a long-time client of ours, is married, and lives in her own home. She has had a dry-goods store for 7 years, and currently has a loyal customer base. She operates the business out of her home. She has requested this loan to purchase toys, clothing, and stationery items. Since 2005, she has taken out 6 loans. The borrower believes that this loan will allow her a wider profit margin for her business and also proviD. her with a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de mercaderias ropas, juguetes, y articulos de libreria.

loans.name: Adela De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Adela de Los Ángeles H. O. de 34 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, la cual se dedica a la carpintería para poder ganarse la vida. Ella vive sola en casa propia, en Jiquilisco, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Desde hace 4 años que Adela posee su propia carpintería en donde trabajo junto a un empleado, el cual es de gran ayuda para ella, ya que en muchas ocasiones el trabajo es bastante. A pesar de ser un oficio bastante duro, Adela ha sabido superar esto y desempeñar un buen papel como carpintera, trabajo en el cual posee varios clientes. Ella trabajo por pedidos previos, elaborando: muebles para la sala, roperos, chineros, sillas, mesas, y otros más. Adela solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de madera de muy buena calidad, así mismo comprar pegamento, serruchos y otras herramientas más.
texts.en:
Adela de Los Ángeles H. O. is 34 years old and is a very hardworking person who works in carpentry to make a living. She lives alone is her own house in Jiquilisco, located in the department of Usulután. For the past four years, Adela has had her own carpenter’s workshop where she works with an employee. He is a great help to her because many times, there is a lot of work. Despite it being difficult work, Adela has known how to overcome this and be a good carpenter, a business in which she has several customers. She works on orders made ahead of time such as living room furniture, closets, china cabinets, chairs, tables, and other items.

Adela is requesting a loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of good-quality wood, as well as glue, saws, and other tools.

loans.use: To purchase wood and raw material for making furniture.

loans.name: Four Roses Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cuatro Rosa está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es doña Sonia A. quien desde hace tiempo se dedica a la realización de sopas los fines de semana ya sea de hueso, de res, mondongo, de pollo, queso…etc. Ella con el crédito comprara carne, las verduras como yuca, quequisque, repollo, ayote, chayote, chilote, cebolla, etc. 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Estela de Jesús D. se dedica al destace de cerdo desde hace 10 años el vende tanto la carne como realiza frito, nacatamales, chicharrón y moronga, y Manuela del Carmen O. vende manualidades especialmente Hamacas  desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
The group named "Cuatro Rosa" is made up of three hard working women. One of them is Sonia A.. For some time she has been cooking soups on the weekends, either bone soup, beef soup, stew, chicken soup, cheese soup, etc. With her loan she will purchase meat and various vegetables.  

Another member of the group is Estela Jesus D. and she has been butchering pigs since she was 10 yeas old. She sells meat, but also prepared foods such as fried meat, tamales, pork rinds, and blood sausage.  Manuela del Carmen O. is also a member of the group and she has sold crafts, especially hammocks, since she was 10 years old.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare foods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer as well as covering part of the payment for a plot of land

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo vive en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es artesano, realiza trabajos de artesanía en cotillones de cartulina, esponja, para acontecimientos sociales (en Bolivia denominamos cotillones a todos los productos como piñatas, mixturas, serpentinas, etc., que usan para adornar en los acontecimientos sociales).
Es viudo y todos sus hijos son independientes.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de, cartulina, esponja, cola, y papel para continuar su negocio. 
Es la décima primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la sexta vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva. Su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Arturo lives in the zone of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. He is an artisan. He makes party decorations for social events out of foam core and cardboard (in Bolivia parties include products such as piñatas, confetti, streamers, etc. that they use to decorate for social occasions). Arturo is a widower and all his sons are living on their own.
This loan will be used to buy cardboard, foam core, paste and paper in order to maintain his business.
This is his eleventh loan that he has requested from Impro and the sixth time he has asked for support from KIVA. His background qualifies him as a good borrower and he always pays his loans on time.

loans.use: He will buy cardboard, foam core, and paste for his business of making party decorations for social events.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cloth.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet P., from the village of Western, Wao, Lanao del Sur, is 49 years old, married and has five grown children. To make a living, Juliet owns and operates a mini-restaurant serving a variety of meals, including chicken pork adobo, in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 6500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant, she is requesting her second loan for 8000 PHP to purchase additional raw ingredients and use as working capital. Juliet plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the restaurant.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional raw ingredients & working capital

loans.name: Yang

texts.en: Yang M., age 37, is a good mother to four children, and she always spends most of her time managing daily activities. Her daily duties include cooking meals, cleaning house, caring for her children, and controlling other property in and around her house. She has a life partner in her husband who works in the construction industry. She has one daughter who often generates income for Yang M. by working as a mobile hairdresser. Yang M.’s daughter wants to open a small shop to provide hairdressing services. Yang M. really wants to help her daughter but she doesn't have enough money to do so. Therefore, Yang M. is applying for a loan from Kiva to help her daughter open a small beauty salon.

loans.use: to help her daughter open a small shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an electric compressor engine

loans.name: Fredy Agustin

texts.es: Fredy tiene 34 años de edad, soltero, carpintero, solicita su primer prestamo en ASDIR para incrementar su capital de trabajo, especificamente compra de materiales como: tablas, reglas y material en general, para carpinteria, en la actividad tiene 10 años de experiencia, lo cual le ha ayudado salir adelante con sus necesidades basicas, su actividad lo inicio ayudando a sus padres quienes desde su niñez le enseñanron el manejo y desarrollo de la misma, en su comunidad es conocido como una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo.
texts.en: Fredy is 34 years old, single and a carpenter.  He is requesting his first loan from ASDIR since he is very committed to his work.  He needs this help to buy materials and thereby provide a better service.

loans.use: Compra de materiales para fabricar muebles

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman who lives in Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by fishing and fish vending. Her husband Rogelio, who is 46 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have seven children who are between 2 and 19 years old. 

Elsa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elsa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 23,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 23,000 to buy fishing gear and equipment so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and purchase additional fishing boats. Elsa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Adolphe Alphath

texts.fr:
Homme marié de 33ans et  père de 3 enfants dont l’âge varie de 02 à 18 ans et ayant 2 personnes à sa charge dont 2 enfants vont à l’école. Après la fin de sa formation d’une école de menuiserie, il se lance dans la menuiserie en 2003 avec un capital de 700.000frs et s’approvisionne dans le département de la Likouala. Ses ventes sont de 18.000frs par jour.

Avec le prêt, il compte acheter des planches qui été transformées en meubles, peinture.

Sa vision s’est de racheté sa propre machine qui lui a été pillée lors des événements derniers. Il aimera aussi devenir entrepreneur et avoir sa propre exposition.

Pour sa famille il souhaite léguer tout son héritage à ses enfants. Il jouit d’une bonne moralité.
texts.en:
A married man, 33 years old, he is the father of three children, from 2 to 18 years of age. He has two dependent children who go to school. After finishing his training as a carpenter, he has launched his own shop in 2003, with a starting capital of 700,000 West African francs. He stocks up in the Likouala Department. His daily receipts are about 18,000 francs.

With this loan, he plans to purchase wood planks to be used for making furniture as well as paint. His goal is to be able to buy a new woodworking machine, as his old one was looted during the recent events. He would like to become an entrepreneur and have his own showroom. As to his family, he would like to leave a good legacy to his children. He is of good moral character.

loans.use: Purchasing wood and paint

loans.name: Yung

texts.en:
Yung S. is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. 

S. produces palm roof, earning an income of US $2.5 per day. Her husband is employed to cut wood at a furniture shop, earning an income of US $3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend US $24 on food and US $50 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to start a new business as a motor-taxi driver. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a new business

loans.name: Mayra Segovia

texts.es: LA SEÑORA G. LABORA COMO ANALISTA COMERCIAL, TIENE SEIS PERSONA A SU CARGO, ES EL PRIMER CREDITO QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, AGRADECE EL APOYO QUE LE BRINDA POR QUE CON ESTE DESEMBOLSO VA PODER RESOLVER GASTO DE CONSUMO  FAMILIA COMO PAGO DE ENERGIA Y OTROS
texts.en: Ms. Gonzales is a business analyst. She has six people in her care. This is the first loan she has been granted by CEPRODEL. She is thankful for the support provided because thanks to this credit she will be able to pay for family expenses such as electricity bill and others.

loans.use: To pay for family expenses.

loans.name: Audencia Zaqueu

texts.pt:
Audencia Zaqueu M. nasceu na cidade da Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique solteira e mãe de 2 filhos  de 22 e 25 anos de idade todos ainda vao a escola. Fez somente 6ª classe nao continuou porque os pais nao tinham condicoes financeiras para ela continuar. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e nao sustenta mais ninguem para alem da sua familia.

Nunca saiu de Maputo, tem um negocio proprio em sua casa e desenvolve ha mais de 6 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento mensal de cerca de  6.000.00mt a 7.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte mensalmente em sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus amigos que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (Guarda fatos, mesa, cadeiras, estantes, comodas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock. O emprestimo anterior foi de 15.000.00 e foi aplicado para o comercio.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para construir um salao de cabeleirero e uma banca comercial.
texts.en:
Audencia Zaqueu M. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique.  She is a single mother of two children ages 22 and 25, who are still in school.  She only completed school through the sixth grade because her parents did not have the financial resources for her to continue.  She lives in her own home with her family and does not support anyone else.  

She has never lived anywhere other than Maputo.  She has had her own business out of her home for more than 6 years.  She does not have any employees and she earns around 6.000.00mt to 7.000.00mt per month, which she uses for household expenses.  She also saves some of her monthly earnings in her bank account.  

Audencia has never had loans in other banks.  She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku, for 20.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase products (wardrobes, tables, chairs, shelves, dressers, etc.) to increase her inventory.  Her prior loan was for 15.000.00 and was used for her business. 

She promises to make her payments on time in order to have access to other loans in the future.  She plans to request new loans to build a hair salon and a bank.

loans.use: to purchase products (wardrobes, tables, chairs, shelves, dressers, etc.).

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana de 45 años, es una mujer muy influyente en su familia que ella trabaja de servicios domésticos en casa en casa.

Ella labora diariamente prestando sus servicios a personas que la necesitan y la conocen . Su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad. Tienen 4 hijos que cual ellos le dan de todo para ayudarlos. Con la ayuda del préstamo ella desea comprar materiales de construcción como cemento piedras arena. Ella anhela terminar su vivienda para tener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 45 years old and is very influential in her family.  She works as a maid from house to house.

She works daily, providing her services to people who know her and need her.  Her husband works as a security guard.  They have four children to whom they give their all.  She wants to buy building materials such as with the help of this loan cement, stone, and sand with the help of this loan.  Her goal is to have a better home so that her family can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Ubaldo

texts.en:
Ubaldo, age 58, owns and operates a business offering motor transport services. Ubaldo has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. He and his wife have one grown child and live in the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin Misamis Occidental. 

Earlier this year, Ubaldo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. He hoped to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Ubaldo is requesting his first loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
Johnny is 42 years old and is married with 2 children. He is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. He has been growing rice for 25 years. Johnny earns about 5000 PHP per month from farming. Aside from rice farming, Johnny also raises pigs in his backyard. The family also has a sari-sari (variety) store that his wife manages.

Johnny's loan will be used to buy fertilizer, piglets and feed. He hopes for his businesses to prosper and for his family's living situation to improve.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, piglets and feed

loans.name: Ansam

texts.en:
Ansam is a 40-year-old woman from Tulkarem city in Palestine. Her youngest son had an accident when he was young and suffers from a disability in the lower part of his body. He is 12 years old now. 

Ansam took out a loan from FATEN to fix her son's wheelchair and install an electronic stick to help him control his movement independently. 

Ansam's husband can't afford to buy a new wheelchair or pay to repair the existing one as he works on a daily wage basis. 

Ansam appears in the picture here in FATEN's branch in Tulkarem.

loans.use: to repair and upgrade a wheelchair her son

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es: Nélida tiene 47 años, es madre soltera de una niña y vive en una propiedad que cuida en la que actualmente vive. Tiene 8 años de experiencia en la venta de cosméticos, y lo hace a domicilio, de esta manera todos los días sale a  ofrecer sus productos que muestra por catálogo. La marca que vende es de prestigio y eso la favorece en sus ventas, además su gran entusiasmo que tiene ha cumplido sus propias metas que la satisfacen personalmente y se propone tener ventas mayores para asegurarse en sus ganancias. Una de las ventajas que ha visto de su negocio es que recibe premios de la marca que vende por catálogo siempre y cuando supera la cantidad de productos, así puede incrementar sus ganancias. Son 4 ciclos de crédito que tiene con MFP de la cuales considera que es su mejor aliada para crecer y afrontar de manera oportuna su negocio, además cuando le ofrecen los cosméticos a un precio bajo por ello necesita ser comprada al contado. Por tanto espera el apoyo de todos ustedes. Con este dinero comprará más mercadería en cosméticos.
texts.en:
47 year-old Nélida is a single mother and has one daughter.  She lives in a property which she is looking after.  She has eight years experience selling cosmetics and makes her sales door to door.  Every day she goes out to sell the products that she shows her customers through her catalogs.  The brand she sells is a well known one and this favors her when it comes to making her sales.  Through her great enthusiasm, she has accomplished her own goals which makes her happy.  She plans to make more sales in order to safeguard her profits.

One of the advantages that Nélida has seen in this business is that she receives prizes from the brand that make the cosmetics she sells whenever she exceeds a certain quantity of products sold and this enables her to increase her profits.

Nélida has been working with MFP for four loan cycles.  She considers MFP to be her best ally in growing her business and responding to her customers in a timely manner.  When the company offers her cosmetics at a low price, she needs to pay for them in cash.  Nélida hopes to receive your support.  She will use this loan money to buy more cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products

loans.name: Warsiti

texts.en: Warsiti is a soft drink agent. She began this business in 1998 and has had as many as 21 loan cycles with VFI. She started her business small and has become a big agent. As a result, she has been able to educate her children, buy a motorcycle, and even a house. Her current loan from VFI is being used to increase the stock of soft drinks, also for gas and equipping the inside of her shop. She has future plans to renovate her place of business. She is very happy with the VFI loan because of the easy access and loan processes.

loans.use: to pay for soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Johannes

texts.en: Johannes is 25 years old and single with no children. He runs a provision and beverage shop in Lumley – a neighborhood in Freetown. He has been in this business for three years and sells sugar, milk, bread, cigarettes and soft drinks at his store. His business is the main source of income he has. He says that the main challenge to his business is lack of sufficient financing for him to expand. He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more provisions and soft drinks. Johannes says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his standard of living. In the future, he plans to import goods from abroad.

loans.use: To purchase more milk, cigarettes, and soft drinks

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia has five children. All of the children are in school. She is a widow. She has been in this business for two years. She took a loan from BRAC South Sudan to expand her business. The profit that she will earn from the business, she will use to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more cold water and soda to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther  lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sister and her children).  Esther has a business of a food stall . She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Esther sells her products at the market. 

Esther has requested  for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, cassava and Irish potatoes. The main business challenges for Esther include seasonality, thieves and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to  sell at wholesale only and  to start going to villages for food staffs.    Esther lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, cassava and  Irish potatoes

loans.name: Francisca Elizabeth

texts.es:
Francisca, vive con su familia conformada por su esposo y cuatro hijos D. los cuales solo dos dependen D. sus ingresos, viven en una vivienda alquilada. Francisca se dedica a la venta D. productos lácteos, comenzó este negocio con el apoyo D. unas amistades,  actualmente tiene experiencia y desea invertir en el negocio.

Por segunda ocasión solicita un préstamo que le permita comprar leche para la producción D. queso, crema, cuajada.
Su objetivo es crecer, ampliar el negocio, comprar casa propia, para vivir más cómodamente con su familia.
texts.en: Francisca lives with her husband and four children in a rented home, and all depend on her support. Francisca sells dairy products, a business that she started with the help of friends; she has gained experience and now wants to invest in her business.   This is her second loan, which will allow her to buy milk to process into cheese, cream and curds.  Her goal is to grow and expand her business, and to buy her own house for her family to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy milk to process into cheese, cream and curds

loans.name: Julissa

texts.es:
Julissa nació en el departamento del Cusco al sur del Perú. Actualmente, Julissa tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera y aun no tiene hijos.

Actualmente, Julissa vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades, ella trabaja como empleada del hogar. En esta oportunidad Julissa requiere el préstamo para construir su casa. 

El Banco Comunal “Virgen de las Nieves” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Julissa was born in the Department of Cusco, in the South of Peru. Currently, Julissa is 35 years old.  She is single, and has no children as of yet.

Julissa lives today in the city where she was born, and this is where she works. She works as a housekeeper. On this occasion, Julissa is requesting the loan to build a house for herself.

The "Virgen de las Nieves" Communal Bank meets monthly in the city of Cusco (in Peru). Cusco is well-known for being an area with much tourism and commerce, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and also because it is the location of Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to build a house for herself.

loans.name: Kelementina

texts.en:
Kelementina is a 50 year-old married woman with seven children, two of whom are in the school. She has a business of selling simsim and beans in the Hai Mahad branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for ten years.

Kelementina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more simsim, beans and onions for sale

loans.name: Leena

texts.en: Leena is a 30 year old young woman.  She is married with one son, and her husband is a doctor and has a medical laboratory.  The family also has another source of income from agriculture.  Leena wants to help her husband in purchasing some medical equipment for the laboratory, but the amount of money she has is not enough to pay for it.  So she needs to take a loan in the amount of $2,000 from FATEN.  When Leena gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, that will enable her to help her husband get the medical equipment.  This equipment will help to expand and improve his work and increase his income which will help to provide better life conditions for the family.  Leena is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in his laboratory.

loans.use: To purchase laboratory medical equipment for the laboratory that her husband owns.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 58 years old and is married with six children.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Myrna has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Myrna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Solidario Victoria 3 Group

texts.es:
Solidario Victoria 3.
Este grupo esta Conformado por Tres Señoras muy trabajadoras y nuy luchadoras por tener un futuro mejor cada dia,una de ellas es la lider de este solidario quen es Victoria,de 35 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos ella se dedica a la confeccion de tejidos tipicos desde hace 10 años,ella nos cuenta que es una actividad que realisa dia a dia para asi obtener un ingreso que ayude a la mantencion de su hijos,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos tipicos.al igual que las siguientes socias estan solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio,y asi continuar con un capital mas grande y obtener mejores ganacias.
texts.en:
Group Victoria 3
This group is made up of three very hard working women who have fought to have a better future every day. One of them, named Victoria, is the leader of the group.  She is 35 years old and has two children . She has worked for the past ten years making traditional fabrics.  She tells us that it is an activity completed day by day in order to obtain an income that will help in maintaining her children.  She is requesting a loan in order to buy raw materials used in making traditional fabrics.  In the same way, the other group members are asking for a loan in order to purchase products for their businesses, and thus continue with greater capital and obtain better earnings.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making traditional fabrics

loans.name: Quy

texts.en: Quy is 38 years old. She lives in Cho town, Yen Phong, Bac Ninh.  She is married and has two children who are going to school. She always wants to have a better standard of living and  to have her children have a better education. So she tries to work hard. She has a store where she sells cobbler. She has a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamdong(VND).  She has participated in SEDA since 2007 and always repaid punctually.  In this loan cycL. she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products and other things to invest in her store.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products and other things for her store.

loans.name: Jonita

texts.en:
Jonita is 39 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Jonita has a tailoring shop that makes and repairs school and office uniforms, dresses and pillow cases. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 in order to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

Jonita has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jonita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

loans.name: Andrea Estefania

texts.es:
Andrea es madre soltera de 35 años. Ella tiene un hijo menor de edad, Andrea  se dedica a la venta de postres, ya que que su tía le enseño lo que es la elaboración de tortas , (empanadas, alfajores, etc) desde joven,  ella es una mujer responsable, honesta y con muchas de sacar adelante a su familia, empezó en este negocio desde hace 2 años y gana un promedio de S/. 200.00 soles semanales, con el crédito que le otorgará Kiva de S/. 2000,00 soles lo invertirá para la compra de  moldes, maquetas, . Uno de sus sueños sería tener su negocio en un sitio mejor ( donde no halla delincuencia), para que pudiera tener mas ingresos en su negocio y seguir cursos de repostería para que en un futuro no muy lejano tenga su propia empresa para que sea reconocida a a nivel nacional y que su familia pudiera tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Andrea vive y trabaja en Imperial (Cañete), commonly known simply as Cañete, Perú. Located about an hour and a half hours south of Lima, Cañete, with its sandy beaches, pre-Incan ruins, and production of Perú’s adored national liquor Pisco (a kind of grape brandy) has long been a tourist destination for wealthy Peruvians. But the real Cañete is a warm and peaceful town with a large Afro-Peruvian population, remnants of an indigenous path, and influences from the Spanish empire. The city, along with others near the Pacific coast, was damaged during the 2001 and 2007 Peru earthquakes, but has preserved as it has for much of its history.
texts.en:
Andrea, 35, is a single mother; she has a minor son.  Andrea sells desserts since her aunt taught her how to make baked goods (turnovers, sponge cake, etc.) since she was a young woman.  She is a responsible, honest woman who very much wants to get ahead with her family.  She started the business two years ago and earns approximately 200 soles per week.  She will use the 2000 sol loan from Kiva to buy cake molds.  One of her dreams is to have her business in a better location (where there is no crime) so that she can earn more income in her business and take pastry making courses so that in the not too distant future she can have her own firm and be known nationally so that her family can have a better quality of life.

Andrea lives and works in Imperial (Cañete), commonly known simply as Cañete, Perú. Located about an hour and a half hours south of Lima, Cañete, with its sandy beaches, pre-Incan ruins, and production of Perú’s adored national liquor Pisco (a kind of grape brandy) has long been a tourist destination for wealthy Peruvians. But the real Cañete is a warm and peaceful town with a large Afro-Peruvian population, remnants of an indigenous path, and influences from the Spanish empire. The city, along with others near the Pacific coast, was damaged during the 2001 and 2007 Peru earthquakes, but has preserved as it has for much of its history.

loans.use: to buy cake molds.

loans.name: Borik

texts.ru:
Борик родился 1952 г., окончил среднюю школу в деревне  Арцваник, после окончание школы поступил и окончил Капанский строительный техникум.
Борик женат и у него трое детей: две дочери и сын. Обе дочери замужем и живут отдельно от родителей, а сын Борика сейчас служит в армии. 
Борик занимается сельским хозяйством более 10 лет в деревне Чапни, Сьюникского региона. Он выращивает овощи и фрукты, а также занимается пчеловодством. Выращенные овощи и фрукты Борик реализует в городах Капане и Каджаране, но особенной популярностью пользуется его мед, так как он всегда высокого качества. Благодаря занятию сельским хозяйством, Борик имеет возможность содержать свою семью. 
Сумма кредита в размере 1.000.000 драм необходима Борику для приобретения нескольких новых ульев, парафина для рамок, а также для покупки самих рамок для меда. 
Данный кредит является третьим по счету, получаемым Бориком от организации Нор Оризон.
texts.en:
Borik was born in 1952.  He graduated from high school in the Artsvanik village.  Upon completing his studies, Borik entered the Kapansky Civil Engineering College where he got his degree.  

Borik is married and has three children – two daughters and one son.  His daughters are married and live away from the parental home.  Borik's son is currently serving in the Army.  

Borik has been farming for over 10 years in the Chapni village of the Syunik area.  He grows fruit and vegetables and is also a beekeeper.  Borik sells the fruit and vegetables that he grows in Kapan and Kadzharan, but it is his honey that is particularly sought after because of its consistently high quality.  His farming business allows Borik to provide for his family.  

Borik needs a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 AMD to buy some new beehives, wax for the frames and frames for the honey.  This will be the third loan granted to him by Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy some new beehives, wax and frames for his beekeeping business

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Navy is a tailor specializing in formal and traditional Khmer clothing for weddings and other occasions. However, she has neither her own sewing machine or tailoring shop but instead is hired for fees. Her husband, Vanthan, is a construction worker.

Residing in a Phnom Penh suburb, the couple has been married for seven years and have two daughters, one of whom attends school while the other is yet too young to attend. Navy is now requesting a loan of $1000 to assist her husband’s construction business through the purchase of construction materials.

loans.use: to assist her husband’s construction business through the purchase of construction materials.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
