Mrs. Chea is 48 years old and is in the business of raising hogs in Baray district. She generates approximately $6.00 each day through the business. 

Mrs. Chea has been engaged in her business for more than 4 years. She has gained good experience from it and is able to manage her work well to keep her pigs from illness and to keep them clean.

Mrs. Chea has five children, two of whom are married, while the remaining three are now working. With the amount she has requested from HKL, she will use it to purchase a used motorbike for her three employed children to commute to their workplaces. For her business goal, she plans to expand her farmland and increase her output for both her own daily food use and for sale.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorbike

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en: Choeurn, 34, is married. She resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her husband has been involved in breeding pigs for over six years. He has extensive experience and is successful in his career. One of her children is a construction worker. In order to improve her family economy, Choeurn is requesting for a loan of USD 700 to purchase more sows to breed in order to produce more piglets to sell. By doing so, her family income will be increased. In the future, she would like to expand her husband's business, renew her house and support her children to study until they get Bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more sows to breed in order to produce piglets to sell.

loans.name: Agustine  Ochieng

texts.en:
Augustine was born in Kolwa west Kisumu District . He has been doing business using a rented motorcycle for  for two years. He is married with two children and he is happy to own his own bike. Augustine has committed to   provide transport to CHWs targeting the youth and prevention of drug abuse. He is also interested in supporting youth groups counseling on HIV/AIDs prevention. 

The motorcycle will enable Augustine provide for his family and support the community as well, He hopes to encourage other motorcycle taxi drivers enroll in the CHW support programme in order to adequately cover all remote locations of Kisumu county.

Augustine is an experienced motorcycle taxi trader and he hopes to make money and buy another motorcycle in 10 months and support two CHWs.

loans.use: To pay for Motorcycle for Community Health work and Livelihoods

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 48 years old, married and has seven children.  

She is in the agricultural business raising pig in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Melanie has been raising pig for 4 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy one-day old chicks, their feeds and medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and prepare his land for commercial farming

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina has a small truck which her husband drives. They use it to buy and sell sand and stone and also have a moving business. They live in the Irpavil II neighborhood in La Paz. This is the fourth loan she has requested from IMPRO. She has been a first-class borrower, meaning that she has a good history of repayment. This loan will pay for vehicle maintenance and to buy new tires and coverings for the seats. Her work experience and borrowing record recommend her for this loan and her cash flow will be adequate to repay it.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Justina tiene una volqueta (es un pequeño camión) que su esposo maneja. Su negocio es usar la volqueta para la compra y venta de arena, piedra, y mudanzas de clientes que contratan sus servicios. Vive en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz y es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito con IMPRO. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para el mantenimiento de su volqueta y la compra de llantas y tapizado de asientos. Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio y el análisis de su flujo de caja muestra resultados satisfactorios para el cumplimiento de su obligación financiera.

loans.use: To maintain a truck and purchase tires.

loans.name: Bébé

texts.fr:
Bébé A. was born in 1977 in Yohono. She is very hard-working and has ten years of experience selling farm implements such as hoes, machetes and shears which her husband makes. Demand for these tools now outstrips her husband's production so Bébé has started buying from other craftsmen as well to maintain her stocks. This year she is asking for a loan of $800 to restock her business and increase her sales.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Madame A. Bébé est née en 1977 à Yohono u. Très dévouée, elle s’est donnée au commerce des outils agricole (houe, coupe-coupe, couteaux) et autres fabriqués par son mari. C’est un commerce qu’elle exerce il y a maintenant 10 ans, ce qui lui confère une grande expérience en la matière. La production de son mari étant très insuffisante pour satisfaire la demande sans cesse croissante, elle est obligée d’acheter auprès d’autres fabricants. Elle fait généralement des stocks de ces outils avant de les revendre. Cette année, elle demande un crédit de $800 afin de pouvoir redynamiser son commerce et améliorer son revenu.

loans.use: To buy farm inplements for resale.

loans.name: Ali Rashid

texts.en:
The R. family lives in Khudat town, in the Khachmaz region. Ali is 50 years old, married and has five children. Four  years ago he started his own business.   He has a lot of regular clients. All come to his café to forget their problems.
He is requesting a loan of $825  to buy  glasses and other necessary things for his cafe.

loans.use: To buy  glasses and other necessary things for his cafe

loans.name: Twiga Group

texts.en:
Prosper P., age 55, is married with 7 children (ages 30, 25, 20, 17, 15, 10 and 7). Prosper has been working as a part-time construction mason for over 35 years. From this job, he earns around $320-360 per month. He and his wife also run a fruit and vegetable stand, which they started 7 years ago. This business makes about $18 a day. The stand, opened from 7am to 8pm, attracts around 60 customers a day.

Prosper is the leader of the loan group “Twiga” (Swahili for “giraffe”), which has 16 members. The other members of his group have businesses dealing with sales of food, table tops, clothing, wood work, cattle, fish, and charcoal. Prosper knows every member of his group personA., since they are all neighbors and have businesses in the same locality. This group borrowed a previous loan together (minus 8 members who were replaced after the loan was repaid), and was able to pay it back successfully. They now hope for a new loan.

Prosper used the previous loan to buy fruits and vegetables for his stand. With the new loan, he hopes to purchase more stock and also enlarge his stall.

loans.use: To expand businesses

loans.name: Moega

texts.en: Moega is a 49-year-old mother from the Vavau village. She has two children and she is one of the old members of the centre. Her first loan she used to buy materials for her taro plantation. She is now applying for another loan to fix the wall of her house and to help out with her plantation.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies for her plantation and for home improvements

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Señora Sonia belongs to the community bank called 'Banco Comunal Cesar Vallejo' which is located in Calleria, Ucayali. She is 46 years old. She has 2 children who still depend on her financially. She's married and her husband is a salesman. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open up a small business of selling and buying metals.

She currently runs her business of selling and buying all types of metals. She also raises chickens and she also rents rooms. She gets up at 5:00 in the morning to feed her chickens, she then prepares breakfast for her family and lastly she attends to her business of selling and buying metals which she runs from home.

With this loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she would like to purchase metals such as copper, bronze and aluminium. She will also fix up the rooms that she rents, and she will purchase more food for her chickens.

Sonia thinks of herself as an entrepreneur because she started all of these businesses and she administrates them on her own. This is why she's very thankful to Manuela Ramos for all the support she's giving her.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sonia pertenece al Banco Comunal Cesar Vallejo, ubicado en Jr Maya D. Brito 673, distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 46 años, es madre D. 2 hijos que aún dependen D. ella, es casada y su esposo es comerciante. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300 que recibió D. Manuela Ramos deciD. invertir en un negocio D. compra y venta D. metales. En la actualidad cuenta con un negocio D. compra y venta D. todo tipo D. metales, además posee un galpón D. pollos y con un negocio D. alquiler D. habitaciones. Se levanta a las 5 D. la mañana para colocarles agua y comida a sus pollos, luego prepara el desayuno D. su esposo y el D. sus hijos y por último se dedica a atender su negocio D. compra y venta D. metales en su casa. Con el préstamo D. S/. 2,500, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra D. metales tales como cobre, bronce, aluminio; también invertirá en la refacción D. las habitaciones que alquila y en la compra D. comida para sus pollos. Sonia se considera una mujer emprendedora porque posee varios negocios que ella misma los administra, es por ello que está muy agradecida por todo el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To purchase metals such as copper, bronze, aluminium and to fix up her rentals

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is a 32-year-old mother of 3, and a resident of Tandika. She sells wood and carpentry materials for construction purposes. She orders it from the Morogoro region and the Rufigi area. Recently, the forest authority has restricted deforestation, and this has affected her business. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business into other areas.

loans.use: Expand her construction business

loans.name: Mercedes Lilian

texts.en:
She lives in the The Liberty with her family that is composed of four people who depend on her financially. She is dedicated to the making of typical food such as tamales (stuffed corn breads), and others that she distributes to her neighbors and plant workers. It is near her home and has been running for five years. Her clients know the restaurant and search it out. The income she earns from this works provides her children with an education and helps to get more products to prepare and sell. This is her first loan with the institution, and it will help her to be able to buy materials to diversify the range of products she offers her clients. Investments like this have helped her in the past and will give her what is necessary to help her continue.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Actualmente vive en La libertad su grupo familiar lo componen cuatro personas que dependen económicamente de la solicitante, la señora se dedica a la elaboración de comida típica tales como tamales pasteles y otros que distribuye con vecinos y trabajadores de una planta asfáltica que esta pegado a su vivienda tiene aproximadamente cinco años de dedicarse al negocio, su clientes ya la conocen y la buscan, el negocio le a aportado los ingresos necesarios para poder dar educación a sus hijas que son dos ellas le ayudan en la preparación de materiales y la venta de los mismos , este es su primer crédito con la institución , el crédito le ayudara a poder comprar mas materia prima y poder surtir a la misma vez con otros productos que vende tales como ropa para dama y caballeros, estas inversiones son las que le han ayudado durante estos años atrás y le darán lo necesario para seguir adelante.

loans.use: Credit to buy raw materials to make tamales (corn bread stuffed with meat)

loans.name: Khadija's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Khadija is 34 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 14, 12, 5 and 3 years old. She and her husband also take care of 1 other child, 13 years old. Khadija owns a small shop, which she started in 2002. Every day, she works from 6 am to 10 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (juice, soda, maize flour and rice) for her shop. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mary, who has a business dealing in food sales to the market.

loans.use: To buy more items (juice, soda, maize flour, and rice) for her shop

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mrs. Mach C. and her husband, Mr. Vichet Saroeyn were married in 2006. They have one daughter. The couple lives with their parents about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Mach and her husband work for a company. Besides their full time work, both husband and wife also raise pigs at home. Now Mrs. Mach is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase piglets and feed for raising pigs.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed for raising pigs.

loans.name: Dewa Ayu Rai Arti

texts.id:
Dewa Ayu Rai Arto is a housewife that also operates a small kiosk at her home. To supplement her income, Dewa Ayu Rai tried to farm pigs with financial and technical help from DINARI. She bought one breeding pig and feeds with her first loan. That pig gave birth to 10 piglets in 6 months. She sold those 10 piglets for $27 total. Dewa Ayu RAi earned $44 more than she used to. So she decided to seek second loan from DINARI. This second loan will be used to purchase another breeder pig., so her farm will produce more piglets that she can sell. With training and guidance from DINARI, Dewa Ayu Rai hopes to earn higher income than before.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Dewa Ayu Rai Arti adalah seorang Ibu rumah tangga yang sehari-hari berjualan di warung miliknya di rumah. Untuk menambah penghasilan warungnya Dewa Ayu Rai mencoba beternak babi dengan meminjam ke DINARI. Dari pinjaman periode pertama dibelikannya seekor induk babi beserta pakannya kemudian dipelihara selama 6 bulan dan melahirkan 10 ekor anak babi. Setelah penjualan 10 anak babi tersebut dimana per ekor laku dijual sebesar Rp.250.000,- Dewa Ayu Rai memperoleh peningkatan pendapatan sebesar Rp. 400.000,-. Sehingga Dewa Ayu Rai memutuskan untuk melanjutkan pinjaman ke DINARI untuk periode kedua dengan jumlah pinjaman yang sama. Pinjaman kedua ini nantinya akan dibelikan seekor induk babi lagi sehingga akan terjadi penambahan jumlah anak babi yang dilahirkan. Dengan bimbingan dan pelatihan dari DINARI nantinya Dewa Ayu Rai berharap akan mendapatkan hasil yang lebih tinggi lagi dari sebelumnya.

loans.use: Purchase feeds and breeding pig

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly is a good client, very hard-working.  She has three children to support; her husband is a driver.  She works from very early in the morning until very late at night, in different parts of the city of El Alto.  She's an unassuming woman and very commited to working because she wants her children to know that with a little sacrifice one can get ahead in life in an honest way.
Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
Es una buena cliente es muy trabajadora ella tiene tres niños que mantiene, su esposo se dedica a 

manejar una movilidad, trabaja desde muy temprano hasta muy altas horas de la noche en distintas 

zonas de la Ciudad de el Alto es de clase sencilla y muy responsable en su trabajo, ya que quiere 

demostrar a sus hijos que con un poco de sacrificio se puede salir en la vida en una forma honesta.

loans.use: Increase working capital.

loans.name: Isabel Violeta

texts.es:
Isabel is 23 years old and lives with her brother and father. Half a year ago, she opened her phone shop realizing that there was an opportunity in her area for phone service as well as internet access. She runs her shop from Monday to Friday, resting on the weekends as she is pregnant. Her brother takes care of the shop on Saturdays and Sundays. isabel likes the business which allows her to take care of her family. As the baby's father is irresponsible, she will have to take care of her baby on her own. In the future she would like to open more locations for her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase phone cards, as well as apply for the licensing she needs from her municipality.

Isabel tiene 23 años, vive con su hermana y su padre, ella está actualmente embarazada. En sus enormes deseos de superación decide abrir su locutorio hace mas de medio año, invirtiendo así, adecuadamente su capital, con buen ojo se percató que ese servicio era lo que necesitaba su localidad.También agregó cabinas de Internet, atiende de lunes a viernes, los fines de semana descansa dejando a su hermana en el cuidado y atención, Isabel está satisfecha de este trabajo que le permite el sustento de su familia y con el que podrá mantener a su bebe, ya que se valdrá sola, debido a la irresponsabilidad del que fue su pareja. En el futuro quiere tener varios establecimientos, y adicionalmente una botica. Isabel solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles, el cual invertirá en la compra de tarjetas telefónicas, recargas virtuales y también realizar el trámite para la licencia de funcionamiento municipal.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE PHONE CARDS FOR HER BUSINESS, AS WELL AS PAY FOR THE APPLICATION TO OBTAIN A LICENSE FOR HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme mariée agée de 52 ans.elle fait du petit commerce de tissus, parfums,huile de palme etc depuis quinze ans
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou D. is 52 years old and married. She has kept up a small business selling fabrics, perfumes palm oil etc for fifteen years.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of fabrics

loans.name: Sihaba

texts.en: Sihaba has had a shop selling dresses, charcoal, and bananas in Zanzibar since 2004. She is 37 years old, married, and has two children, ages 4 and 10. She works daily from 7:00am to 6:00pm which allows her to earn a profit of approximately $65 each month. She is hoping that this loan will allow her to expand her business and increase her profit.

loans.use: Sihaba would like to buy more products for her business.

loans.name: Zuhur

texts.en:
Zuhur M. is 33 years old, married and has three children. Zuhur has a middle special education in engineering but he earns his living in agriculture. He earns a small salary used to feed his family and pay for his children’s education. Zuhur works hard to cultivate his products such as apples, pear, and grapes. He works from early morning until late at night hoping to have a rich harvest. Zuhur sells his harvest in the market where they are always in high demand due to their good quality. His works fills him with great optimism and allows him to help his beloved children. His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural products even more and to grow his business. 

 Zuhur is requesting a loan of $750 USD for the term of 12 months to buy necessary materials for storing his products so that he can sell them at a later date when the price for them will increase.

loans.use: Purchasing necessary materials for storing his products

loans.name: Nobar

texts.en:
Nobar I., who lives with her husband and four children, manages the shop she opened three years ago selling home supplies to contribute to her family's income and standard of living. Her husband works as a labourer in their village.

She now sees the potential for a significant business expansion by purchasing additional inventories of kitchen supplies and so is requesting a loan of $1200. The resulting increase in profits will allow her to start saving money for her children's education. Nobar thanks you for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her store.

loans.name: Nelson Franklin

texts.es:
Nelson se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y  la producción de legumbres, cereales y flores cuya producción  lo comercializa en uno de los mercados mas populares de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Vive. en la comunidad Palomar de la Provincia Murillo del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su madre, la cual posee una carnicería en el pueblo con lo que colabora a los ingresos de la familia. Quien por descuido y la falta de atención medica se fue agravando una infección en el ojo, pero con la ayuda de médicos cubanos que generalmente hacen su recorrido por las comunidades le hicieron una operación gratuita y ya se encuentra en proceso de recuperación
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera de  mediana calidad y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Nelson raises dairy cattle and also grows vegetables, grains and flowers which he sells in one of the most popular markets of the city of La Paz. He lives in the Palomar community of the province of Murillo of the department of La Paz, which is located two hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his mother, who has a meat market in the town which adds to the income of the family. Due to carelessness and lack of medical care, his mother had an eye infection that was getting progressively worse. With the help of Cuban doctors, who travel through the communities, she had a free operation and is in the process of recuperating. The loan will be used for the purchase of a dairy cow of average quality. This will increase the milk production and therefore his income. This is the first loan with Impro. The credit evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Babirye Sumayiya's Group

texts.en:
Sumayiya is the leader of a five member group. She is 35 years old and married with four children, who are between the ages of 2 and 12. Two of her children go to school. She also takes care of her old parents. She resides in a rented three-roomed house in which eight people stay. They have electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets two meals a day.

Sumayiya works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She sells charcoal from her home in Mengo Mackay, which is one of the city suburbs. She works seven days a week and doesn’t have any transport costs. She sells to an average of 20 customers a day and to all categories of people. She is faced with the challenge of the rainy season and defaulting of her would-be customers.

Sumayiya has been in this business for the last seven years and in MCDT for one and half years. She is servicing her second loan, working all along with the same groupmates. Sumayiya‘s monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family. She wants to use this loan to buy a more sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long K. is 34 years old and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make US$ 2 a day. Long has one child and so far she is still living with her elderly mother. Lately, she has requested a loan to purchase a grinding machine. This mill will be a service to the local farmers to take off the rice husk and an income-generating business for Long. (Long's husband is pictured at their home.)

loans.use: To purchase a grinding machine

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhen L. (took a picture with her daughter), 62, was married in 1966 and has six children: four sons and two daughters. Two of them were married and live outside the family house, two daughters are silk weavers and one son works in a garment factory that produce jean. Besides her children Chhen also has two sons in-law and two grandchildren are living with her. The family lives on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 
 
Chhen has been a silk weaver since she was sixteen years old. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes it to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Chhen hopes to continue her weaving business, it’s a main business for her to earn income to support her family that why she is applying for her first loan of $400 to purchase silk materials for her purpose.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.en:
Since she was very young, Marta has worked alongside her family in the production of candles. In addition she makes and sells clothes such as güipiles (traditional Guatemalan weavings) with specific designs from the area of San Pedro. 

She originally started making and selling candles in San Pedro, where she lives, but then began to sell them in nearby towns like Chimaltenango, Pachalum, and San Antonio Aguas Calientes. When she has time, she always weaves at home. 

As her business has grown, Marta sees the potential that more capital can offer. In spite of the economic situation, she has continued working hard and struggling, although her candle workshop still lacks many things. With her loan she will invest in purchasing materials such as wax, the basic material used to make the candles. 

In addition, the cost of the thread that she uses to make the güipiles has risen. She would like to use part of her loan to purchase thread in bulk so that she has enough materials to meet the demands of her clients who continue to place orders. Her goal is to continue moving forward so that she can provide for her children and improve their situation day by day. 

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Fellow


Doña Marta desde muy pequeña junto a su familia se dedican a la elaboración de candelas y veladoras también a la venta y elaboración de tejidos como güipiles San Pedranos. El tejido siempre lo hace en casa. El negocio elaborar y vender las candelas lo inicio en el pueblo de San Pedro donde ella vive, pero luego empezó en otros pueblos como Chimaltenango, Pachalum, y San Antonio Aguas Calientes. Por tal motivo ve la necesidad de mas capital, a pesar de la situación económica siguen luchando pero faltan muchas cosas aun para invertir en el taller donde fabrican las candelas y veladores, necesita mas capital para comprar parafina que es el material básico para las candelas. También el hilo para los güipiles ha subido por tal motivo desea comprar mas ya que siempre sus manos no han descansado en hacerlos ya que tiene clientes que le hacen pedidos a quienes entrega lo que piden. Su meta es salir adelante para que sus hijos tengan lo necesario y que pueda mejorar cada día.

loans.use: Materials for candle-making and weaving

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 49 years old and a resident of San Juan, Quirino, Isabela. She is married to Romeo D. V., and they are blessed with four children: Joseph, 28; Romnick, 25; Junmark, 23; and Jordan, 21. They were not able to pursue their college education but still she is thankful that they grew up as responsible individuals.

She runs a sari-sari store (community-based store) business in their village. She is glad that she can earn a daily income of 300 PHP. To meet the needs of her customers and increase her income, she is requesting a loan for $225 (10,000 PHP) that she can use as additional capital for her store. They sometimes experience financial difficulties in the family, but through their joint efforts, her husband and children were able to surpass the crisis. She wants to be more productive and to become successful in her field of endeavor. She wants to have her business grow so she can help her family.

loans.use: Purchase more goods to sell in sari-sari store

loans.name: Rahmatboy

texts.ru:
Рахматбой Тураев  уже около 11 лет занимается животноводством.
 Место его деятельности, его дом. Помогают ему в откорме скота и переработке молока его дети и жена. Рахматбой хочет получить займ 1200 сомони на 6 месяцев, для того чтобы использовать его в животноводстве.
 Он проживает в Ганчинском районе вместе со своей семьей.
texts.en:
Rahmatboy T. has raised livestock for nearly 11 years, and works out of his home. His wife and children help him to feed the cattle and process the milk. Rahmatboy wants to take out a six-month loan in the amount of 1200 somoni to use for livestock. He lives together with his family in the Ganchin district.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle and selling dairy products

loans.name: Sharaf

texts.ru: Азизов Шараф житель района Варзоб. Возраст 29 лет, холост. Живет  с родителями и семьей брата. Работает на Врзобской гидроэлектростанции охранником. Кроме того в свободное он занимается животноводством.Имеет небольшое хозяйство. Планирует получить кредит на который хочет купить дойную корову.Ухаживать за коровой будет его мать. Молоко , которое будут получать смогут использовать в хозяйстве , а часть даже смогут продавать.
texts.en:
Sharaf A. lives in the Varzob district. He is 29 years old and a bachelor. He lives with his parents and brother's family, and works as a security guard at the Vrzobskaya hydroelectric station. In his free time he also raises livestock on a small scale. He would like to use a loan to buy a dairy cow, which his mother will care for. Milk from the cow will be used by the family, and maybe part will even be sold.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand number of livestock

loans.name: Sherimar

texts.en:
Sherimar is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 from Kiva that she will utilize in maintaining her direct-selling business of Avon, Natasha and MSE products. She would like to grow her business to be able to continue to support her family.

Sherimar generates an income of at least PHP 4,000 monthly and, according to her, it is really a great help to her family. She also manufactures homemade peanut butter as another source of income. Her brothers and sisters are still studying and she works hard to give them the support they expect from her. She hopes not to disappoint them on that matter and she believes that, “If there’s a will, there’s a way”.

Sherimar is 27 years old and is a resident of Barangay San Manuel of Naguilian, Isabela. She is still single and is the eldest child of her parents and graduated from high school. She once worked in Taiwan as a domestic helper for six months and in Jordan for three years. She is a very responsible child to her parents and a good sister to her siblings. She supports her parents and seven sisters and brothers in their schooling through investing her saved income and from the revenue from her businesses.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah A. is a widow with two children. She has received no formal education. Hannah sells fish, which she buys from the fishermen and sends to her home to process before selling it at the market. She does her business at Kormantse near Cape Coast, which she has done since 1985.

Hannah uses her income to pay for her grandchildren’s education. Hannah will use the loan to buy more fish for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to further expand her fish-selling business.

loans.use: to buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Lưu's Group

texts.en:
H. Lưu Thị is a 27-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a six-member group through SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Phù Lưu 06.


H. is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, H. owns and operates a general store.  While not the onL. means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primariL. from selling daiL. use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community.  H. has been engaged in this business for more than five years and earns approximateL. 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfulL. repaid a previous loan of 3,186,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5,152,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her famiL.'s income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị L. is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


2.  Nguyễn Thị T.nh is a 23-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


4.  Trần Thị T. is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


5.  Nguyễn Thị D. is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costL., Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Lưu Thị là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Phù Lưu 06 (6).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2008, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.186.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị L. là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


2.  Nguyễn Thị T.nh là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


4.  Trần Thị T. là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


5.  Nguyễn Thị D. là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dioselina

texts.es:
Dioselina es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.
Dioselina es soltera, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Dioselina vende productos de limpieza y ferretería, sus ventas son al por mayor y los realiza a las diferentes tiendas y ferreterías de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Andahuaylas. Además Dioselina vende artículos de electricidad en diferente ferias de la región.
Diocelina necesita un préstamo de 3500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de escobas.
Diocelina sueña con tener distribuidoras en otros departamentos y tener una tienda mayorista de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Dioselina is a member of Buena Suerte Communal Bank (Buena Suerte translates to "Good luck"). Dioselina is single, twenty-seven years old, and the mother one. Dioselina sells cleaning products and hardware,in wholesale, to different shops and hardware stores in Ayacucho, Andahuaylas. In addition, Dioselina sells electronics at different fairs in the area. Diocelina needs a loan of S./ 3500, which she will use to buy brooms. Diocelina dreams of having doing wholesale in other areas, and of having a wholesale grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing brooms

loans.name: Koem En

texts.en:
Mrs. Koem En P. lives in Poun village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to plow the rice field and to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

Mrs. Koem En P. is 26 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Sam Sopheak, is a motorbike taxi driver and he is shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: To pay for plowing the rice field and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Gie Mayor Group

texts.fr: Nous sommes venus pour demander le renouvellement du prêt numéro 25243, dont nous avons fini le remboursement depuis fort longtemps. Nous attendions le moment propice pour nous remettre au travail que nous avions suspendu pour faire les travaux champêtres, qui se font traditionnellement pendant l'hivernage dans notre pays.maintenant, nous voulons reprendre les activité pour lesquelles vous nous avez donné un premier financement(réf:25243). il faut dire au passage, que nous sommes très satisfaites du premier prêt qui nous à aider à pouvoir faire face aux difficultés liées à l'hivernage. Maintenant que nous sommes plus expérimentés, nous allons acheter des produits dont les populations ont vraiment besoins, puisque maintenant nous connaissons leurs besoins.
texts.en:
We came to request for renewal of loan number 25243 of which we finished repayment a long time ago. We have been waiting for the right moment to go back to work that we suspended in order to do our farm work which is done traditionally during the raining season in our country. We now want to resume the business for which you gave us the first financing (ref: 25243). It must be said, by the way, that we are pleased with the first loan which helped us to be able to meet the difficulties associated with the farming season . Now that we are more experienced, we will purchase items that the people really want, since we know their needs

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of domeatic products and foodstuffs

loans.name: Loice

texts.en: K. Loice has a Mimi super market in Nateete area. She is a dynamic lady of twenty-nine years old. She is married with one child. She has been doing this business for four years. She is using the loan to purchase variety of supermarket items such as kitchen stuffs, utensils, food, cereals, fruits, drinks, to mention but a few to expand the business for more customers. Her aim is to educate her child in good schools up to university level.

loans.use: To purchase varienty supermarket items such as kitchen stuffs, utensils, food, cereals, fruits, drinks, to mention but a few to expand the business for more customers.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a 49 year old woman who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with her husband and their child. Randa has been sewing and selling clothes from her house since 2000. She mainly sells women and lingerie. Randa requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase new clothes to sell. This is her second cycle and she has paid her first loan back on time. 
Randa is special in her work because she sells good quality of clothes, as well as she keeps current styles. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have a lot of cash to expand her stock but worked hard to succeed. Randa decided on doing her business because she has a large network. In the future, she plans to keep on working hard and becoming financially successful.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sim Chhit Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank loA. consists of sixteen people and they all live in Phngeas village in Takeo province. Sim C., a village chief, is president and was selected by the members. His wife, Nat Nhorn is a rice farmer who owns a plot of land. She faces a problem because her field is infertile. Sim C. decided to ask for a loA. to buy fertilizers to renew the field.

Chanthorn U., who is sharing in the loA. is not present in the photo.  Her husband is pictured.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to support the field to make a crop more productive.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
For about a year, Fatima Q. has prepared and sold fried yam with fried fish and pepper sauce at Elmina near Atabadzi. Fatima has two children. She has received a junior high education. Fatima uses her income toward the payment of apartment rent and utility bills.

Fatima will use the loan to purchase more yams for use in her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fatima plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more yams for use in her food business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria D. is 43 years old, and has been married to Isacio Santacruz, who is 45 years old, for 19 years. They have two children, 17 and 8 years old, who are both in school.

Maria started her business 22 years ago, before she was married. She has built up a loyal clientele for her business, working with colleges, schools, companies, making uniforms and shirts with their logos. Her husband works in agriculture and has a truck that he uses to transport his produce from his farm to a local factory.

Maria will use this loan to buy more fabric, which she needs to satisfy all her orders this year.

loans.use: To buy fabric and materials.

loans.name: Giovani

texts.es:
Giovani  es una socia  emprendedora y muy dinámica; vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años, madre de 2 hijos adolescentes y se dedica a la venta de ladrillos al por mayor y menor; cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en una fàbrica de ladrillos.
Siente que su negocio ha mejorado ya que sus ventas son mayores.
Giovany es una de las integrantes del Banco Comunal “Las Lomas de Yarina” desde hace siete años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuewos soles, que le permitieron invertir en la compra de polos para vender a sus conocidos. 
Ahora Giovanni necesita un crédito de 3,000.00 soles, que serán utilizados para comprar seis millares de ladrillos para vender. 
La meta de Giovany es tener una tienda de prendas de vestir y accesoR. para damas.
texts.en:
Giovani is one our enterprising and dynamic members. She lives in the District of Yarina Cocha, Ucayali region. Giovani is 33 years old and the mother of two teenage children.

She sells bricks wholesale and retail. Giovani has the support of her husband, who works at a brick factory. She has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Lomas de Yarina” for seven years. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles, which allowed her to purchase polo shirts to sell to acquaintances. Giovani is now requesting a loan of 3000 soles to purchase 6000 bricks to sell.

Her goal is open a store where she can sell women’s clothing and accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 6000 bricks to sell

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
El Señor Freddy C. Alarcón, tiene la edad de 39 años, Labora como Responsable de Bodega en el Centro de Capacitación CECNA, el tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo, dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con  CEPRODEL durante Seis años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 5 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
 
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en el pago de la mano de obra y en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Zinc, perlines, etc. El cual utilizara para la remodelación del Techo de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de darle mayor seguridad y mejores condición de vida a sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Sr. Freddy C. Alarcón is 39 years old, married, and has four dependent children, two of whom are in school. He is in charge of a warehouse at the CECNA Training Center. Freddy has worked with CEPRODEL for six years. During this time, he has received five loans for making improvements to the house in which he lives. He is an excellent client.

The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for labor and purchase construction materials such as zinc, crossbeams, and other items to remodel the roof of his house. This will provide greater security and better living conditions for his wife and children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for labor & materials to remodel the roof of his house

loans.name: Sala

texts.en:
Sala  T. is 45 and married with no children.  She owns a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Sala  has 3 years of experience in this business.  Sala  needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 tala or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Sala  joined SPBD.    This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Sala 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Sala  T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.54 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.66 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a 37-year-old married woman with a 2-year-old child. She is involved in rice farming and started this business way back in 1990. She wants to expand her 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm so she helps her husband to achieve this. She also raises pigs to add to their income.

Geraldine chose to be a member of CEVI because of its low interest rate. She is now requesting Php 6,000 which will be used for seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa tiene 51 años edad, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que no es el primer financiamiento que obtiene por medio de Fundación León 2000, ya que es por medio de los financiamientos que su negocio ha mejorado notablemente. Ella posee una amplia variedad de  clientes que le solicitan sus diferentes productos como son calzados, vestidos, pantalones, camisas y perfumes a pesar de su edad sabe muy bien hablar con sus clientes y ellos siempre le piden consejos por su edad. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es seguir creciendo con su actividad.
texts.en:
Rosa is 51 years old and she sells general merchandise; because of her business, this is not the first loan that she requests from Fundación León 200; through these loans, her business has improved considerably. She has a wide variety of customers that request her different products such as shoes, dresses, pants, shirts, and perfumes; in spite of her age, she can communicate really well with her customers, and they always seek her advice because of her age. The loan will be invested to buy raw materials. Her wish is to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working  capital

loans.name: Nyoka

texts.en:
Nyoka S. is currently in the business of selling beans and charcoal at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more beans to sell. Nyoka is 49 years old and is widowed. She has three children, and her children go to school.  ith the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more beans to sell

loans.name: Okemute

texts.en:
Okemute sells groceries in her stall. She loves her business because her customers pay cash when they come to purchase groceries. She does not tolerate credit because she does not want to incur debt in her business. 

She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more groceries to sell. She is a widow with three children. She is 55 years old. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to lift her business and her family above poverty. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more rice in bulk

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel Ramírez vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo, el señor Francisco Quispe y su hijo.
La señora Isabel es cocinera, vendiendo almuerzos en un puesto ambulante de su zona, y su esposo trabaja  como chofer de transporte publico.
El crédito es para la conclusión de la construcción de dos habitaciones en su vivienda.
Esta es la novena vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Isabel Ramírez lives in her own house in the region of Pasankeri, to the west side of the city of La Paz with her husband, Francisco Quispe

Isabel is a cook and sells lunches on foot in her area. Her husband works as a chauffeur on public transportation. She would use this loan to finish construction on two rooms of their home.

This is the ninth time that she has asked for a loan and socioeconomic analysis shows they are well qualified and have access to loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing construction on their house

loans.name: Karin Arilmi

texts.es:
Karim, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Viven en casa propia, la cual 
adquirio con sus ahorros como comerciantes. Es una persona muy trabajadora y 
emprendedora; empezo vendiendo ceviche como ambulante en el mercado y ahora cuenta con 
dos negocios en local alquilado; uno de la venta de ceviche y otro de la venta de 
juguetes y accesorios femeninos(ganchos,   esmaltes, etc). Requiere el crédito para 
invertir en la compra de mercadería para la campaña del día de la madre. Su sueño es 
poder adquirir wen un futuro su local propio.
texts.en:
Karin lives with her partner and has two school-aged children. They live in their own home which they purchased with their savings from their jobs as salesmen. She is a hard-working and enterprising person; she started selling ceviche on foot in the market and now has two businesses in a rented space, one is her ceviche sales and the other is sales of toys and female accesories (hooks and nail polishes, etc.). She needs this loan to invest in more inventory for Mother's Day. Her dream is to someday own her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For the “anticrético” (a special type of rental arrangement in Bolivia) of a house

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda C. is happy-looking and feels so excited about the support that she received from Kiva lenders for her fishing business in her previous loan. Melinda prays they all be blessed. She has a sound and solid relationship with the Kiva/ASHI partnership. Now, Melinda is proposing another Kiva loan to continue her fish cage and to support the maintenance of her sari-sari (variety) store. She has been able to improve her businesses due to her access to bigger loans from Kiva lenders. In addition, Melinda revealed the huge impact the loan has made on her family as, with the additional income, she was able to afford to buy desired food items for her family to eat and ensure prompt weekly payment of her obligation to ASHI and other needs. She is also happy because she is able to eat well and support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. What Melinda hopes right now is that their businesses will continue to succeed because this has been their life, providing for their family for more than twenty-six years now. They love what they do in making their business achievements. Melinda’s businesses have been very helpful in achieving her dreams for her children. For her, it is joy to see fulfillment in her businesses and family and, with her children growing up, she will want to see them having the best in life.

loans.use: To continue her fishing business and support the maintenance of her sari-sari store

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites E. is from the village of  Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Marites is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Marites owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marites is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Marites from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en: Annaliza R. is from the city of Estaka, Dipolog City. She is 37 years old. Annaliza is married. To make a living, Annaliza is food supplements supplier. The main source of income for the business comes from selling health and medicinal products in the local community. Annaliza has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Annaliza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annaliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Annaliza is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Annaliza from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel U. is from the village of Annayatan, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 33 years old. Maribel is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Maribel is starting to run a general store where she will be selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Maribel is just starting this business.

Maribel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Maribel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Phok

texts.en: Phok N., 48, lives in Kompong Tom province, Cambodia, where she has owned a plot of land since 1990. She grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year. Phok N. is a good mother to her two school-aged children. Her husband assists on the farm work with her. In view of the fact that rice growing is Phok N.'s main source of income to sustain her family’s living conditions, she is applying for a loan to buy farm supplies to use on her field.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies to use on her field.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of sheet metal, stones, sand, ciment and manual labor

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 39 years old and is married with two children aged 10 and 5. She was previously employed before she started running Joy Kindergarten school. She has now been running her business for one year with two employees.

Esther hopes to enlarge her school and to open a primary school in five years time. She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to construct a classroom.

loans.use: To construct a classroom

loans.name: Vy'a Renda Group

texts.es:
Este comité se inicio mediante una invitación  de la asesora a la Sra. Julia Insaurralde  quien a al mismo tiempo  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Decidieron integrar el comité ya que tiene el deseo de recibir el préstamo e invertirlos en su negocio con el fin de mejorarlo de manera dar un mejor bienestar a sus familias.
La Sra. Ada Estela Martínez  es una de las integrantes  y posee un almacén en su casa el cual atendido con la ayuda de los hijos.
Este negocio es muy importante para ella ya colabora para la alimentación de  la familia.
Ella quiere  invertir el dinero en la compra de mercaderías en general como arroz, fideos, aceite verduras y otros, logrando obtener mayor variedad de mercaderías para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee was started by means of an invitation from Señora Julia Insaurralde who at the same time invited and organized her friends to form part of the Enterprising Women Committee program. They decided to integrate with the committee since they have the desire to receive loans and to invest them in their business in order to improve it and give a better standard of living to their families. Señora Ada Estela Martínez is one of the members. She possesses a store in her house which she tends with the aid of her children. This business is very important for her and provides her family with food. She wants to invest the money in the purchase of merchandise in general such as rice, noodles, oil, vegetables and other things, in order to obtain a greater variety of merchandise to offer her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as rice, noodles, meat, greens, fruit, dairy products, cheese, eggs, coal and other things.

loans.name: Darlyn

texts.en:
Darlyn D. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Darlyn is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Darlyn owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as  lotions & deodorant and some ready to wear items from AVON  and sell the local community. Darlyn has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Darlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Darlyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Darlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fabiana Narcisa

texts.es:
Martha de 28 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas).

Inicio su negocio cuando su esposo la abandono con su hija, por la falta de ingresos ella comenzó a gastar sus ahorros en víveres para venderlo a sus vecinos. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta el anochecer para tener dinero suficiente y darle una mejor vida a su hija de 9 años. Vende arroz, azúcar, bebidas, lácteos etc. Aunque uno de las dificultades ha sido estar sola y mantener el hogar ella sigue trabajando por su hija.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, lácteos, vitrinas para su tienda, también poner un poco mas de seguridad en su negocio ya que la delincuencia esta agrandándose. En el futuro quiere tener una tienda mas surtida.
texts.en:
Martha is 28 years old. She has a small store in the front of her house. She lives in the “Paradise of Guayaquil” (a suburb with dirt roads and houses built on the mountains).
She began this business when her husband deserted her and her daughter. Since she had no income, she used her savings to buy groceries to sell to her neighbors. She works from 6:30am until it gets dark in order to have sufficient money and give a better life to her nine-year-old daughter. She sells rice, sugar, drinks, milk products, etc. Although one of her main problems is supporting a home on her own, she continues to work for the sake of her daughter.
With this loan she would like to buy rice, milk products and cabinets for her store. With a larger store she will feel more secure. In the future she would like to have a store with a greater variety of products.

loans.use: Rice, oil

loans.name: Yomaira Elena

texts.es:
Yomaira D. vive en el barrio San José, al sur D. Barranquilla desD. hace 34 años; ella es una mujer  casada y con 6 hijos en las edades D. 20 a 30 años, para los cuales siempre está en la búsqueda permanente  un mejor estar. Yomaira es muy conocida en su barrio,  porque tiene un negocio D. venta D. mercancía variada, se mueve entre muchos productos, mas exactamente entre los que sus clientes necesitan, en  las líneas para damas, caballeros y  niños y entre ropa, calzad, cosmético, en fin,  todo cuanto le signifique un pedido D. sus clientes. Su sueño emprendedor comenzó en el año 2005, cuando inició  una  cafetería en el barrio El prado al  interior D. una universidad,  en esa actividad  y por razones D. sus buenas relaciones, sostuvo muy buenos clientes que hoy,  en su negocio D. vender mercancía, conforman su mas exclusiva clientela, a los que como conoce muy bien,  les  venD. a crédito y con ellos planea los pagos D. cada uno, D. acuerdo a las condiciones  que con ellos conocerte. La mercancía  variada que Yomaira venD. en mayor cantidad es la ropa y los cosméticos; el credikiva es su tercer  financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprará vestidos femeninos, ropa y productos D. belleza, que tiene encargados por sus  clientes,  para la temporada D. fin D. año que se avecina y que es D. gran movimiento comercial. Con sus anteriores créditos ha logrado tener un capital D. trabajo, para incrementar su compra D. artículos y responder oportunamente a sus compradores. Como su  sueño es tener un almacén muy bien acreditado donD. venda todo tipo D. artículos, Yomaira trabaja persistentemente, es muy cumplida para tener una buena referencia comercial y para abrirse a nuevas posibilidades D. crecimiento empresarial y familiar. 
Su mayor desafío es incrementar el número D. clientes con una mayor cobertura D. barrios en los que trabaja vendiendo su mercancía.   Yomaira  planea renovar su inventario D. mercancías, para vestir alegremente a sus clientes en las fiestas naviD.ñas.
texts.en:
Yomaira D. lives in San José neighborhood, south of Barranquilla.  She has lived there for 34 years.  She is a married woman and she has 6 children aged between 20 and 30 for whom she is always in search of a better life.  Yomaira is very well known in her neighborhood because she has a business selling different merchandise.  She sells many products, more exactly what her customers need, in lines for women, men and children, clothes, footwear, cosmetics, basically anything her customers order.

Her entrepreneurial dream began in 2005 when she set up a café in the El Prado neighborhood, insiD. a university.  In this business activity and owing to her good relations, she attracted and maintained good customers who today, in her business selling merchandise, are her most special customers.  As she knows them very well, she sells to them on credit and together with each one she plans their payments in accordance with the conditions that she arranges with them.  The goods that Yomaira sells most of are clothes and cosmetics.

This Kiva loan is Yomaira's third loan with Fundación Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy women's dresses, clothes and beauty products as she has orders for them from her customers for the end-of-year season which is approaching and sees a lot of sales.  With her previous loans she managed to acquire working capital to increase her purchase of articles and respond appropriately to her buyers.  As her dream is to have a reputable store where she sells all sorts of products, Yomaira is working persistently.  She would like to open up to new possibilities for business and family growth.

Her main challenge is increasing her number of customers with a better coverage of neighborhoods in which she sells her merchandise.  Yomaira is planning to renew her inventory of goods in order to cheerfully dress her customers the the Christmas holidays.

loans.use: To buy women's dresses, clothes and beauty products which her customers have ordered

loans.name: Changamkeni Group

texts.en:
Robert J. is in his early thirties and is married with two children. Robert has been a butcher since 2007. The butcher shop is open between 11:30 am and 8:30 pm and earns Robert a good monthly profit. 

This will be Robert's second Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Mothisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. With his previous loan, Robert increased his stock of meat and enjoyed a healthy level of capital in the business. With his second loan, Robert aims to open a new location in another part of the city.

Robert will share this loan with his loan group Changamkeni, which totals 9 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Robert can be seen wearing white and blue on the far right in the front row.

loans.use: Increase his stock of meat.

loans.name: Jean Chepngetich

texts.en:
Jean Chepngetich is 25 years old, married to Moses Kigen, and they have one child.  Jean has been in a salon business for a period of one year and her monthly income is 28,000 KES. Her business is in Tambach town and most of her clients are from the town and the surrounding area.

She has never borrowed from any other MFI and has applied for her first loan of 30,000 KES which she intends to use as follows: pay rent worth 2,000 KES, buy cosmetics for 6,000 KES, dryer worth 12,000 KES, blow dryer worth 4,000 KES, and buy ribbons for 4,000 KES.    

The anticipated profits from the salon will be used to expand the salon and open other branches. This being her first loan, Jean hopes that it will increase  her profits, thus fulfilling her dreams to build her own home in the near future and own a Range Rover.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase more stock for the salon and to pay rent

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia H. is from the village of Extension, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 52 years old. Arsenia is married and has 10 adult-aged children. To make a living, Arsenia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and snack foods in the local community. She also buys and sells vegetables, like squash and radishes. Arsenia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arsenia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arsenia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Arsenia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional vegetables to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Arsenia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Gloria Matilde

texts.es: Gloria Matilde F. M. de 65 años de edad, reside en Ilopango, en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella vive junto a su hermana y una sobrina menor de edad.  Gloria es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, de no tener una familia propia, ha trabajado muy duro por salir adelante. Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan y golosinas, y también   de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo, y también comercializa verduras a las afueras de su casa. Gloria solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda, así mismo para comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, y verduras, de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad ya que de esta forma podrá contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en: Gloria Matilde F. M. is 65 years old and lives in Ilopango, in the San Salvador department of El Salvador. She lives with her sister and young niece. Gloria is a very responsible and hardworking person. Without having a family of her own, she has worked very hard to get ahead. She owns a store selling foods such as bread and sweets, as well as toiletries such as soap and shampoo. She also sells vegetables outside her house. Gloria is requesting a loan for two uses: half will go towards stocking her store, and the other half for buying more corn and vegetables so she will be able to server her clients better. In this way, she will be able to improve her sales, which is her priority since this will enable her to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy products products for her general store.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a 35-year-old lady, residing in a city called Khanewal, which is famous in Pakistan for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in the area called Abbas Nagar for over 15 years. 

A talented lady, Razia is involved in a clothes-selling business. She purchases clothes from the clothing markets of Khanewal and sells to her community at a profit. She is well known among her customers for her good collection and quality clothes. She has been doing this business for over five years. She utilizes her income to pay the utility bills and also the school fees of her children. 

Her husband's name is M. M. and he works for Pakistan railways on a monthly wage. She has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a school and getting their education.  

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes of different variety in bulk. The bulk purchasing will enable her to offer more variety to her customers and help her to increase her sales. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Phorn S. is 48 years old and she lives in Ta Hing village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Chhoem Thorn, are coffee sellers whereby they can earn a little income to support their family. They also own a food stall for selling groceries. 

Mrs. Phorn S. would like to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to expand her business. With both of these businesses, they hope to increase their income to improve the family's standard of living. 

This couple has seven children. Three are seamstresses in the garment factory and the others are students and also support their parents businesses.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to expand her business.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta V. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 50 years old. Enriqueta is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Enriqueta owns & operates a business selling personal products such as glasses, watches, lotion and perfume in the local community.
