Enriqueta has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Enriqueta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Enriqueta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Enriqueta is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Enriqueta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah has been practicing mixed farming for the last 30 years in Nyamira town, western Kenya. Her mixed farm produces tea, which she sells through Kenya Tea Development Authority, bananas, vegetables and maize, which are all sold locally.

She has requested a loan of 25,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable her to pay school fees for her children and improve the living standards of her family. She would like to increase the number of her dairy cows in the next five years and acquire land that will enable her to expand her farming activities.

Sarah is 53 years old and married with five children whose ages range between 10 and 35. Four of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Chandalis

texts.en:
Mrs. Chandalis T. (pictured with her loom) is 26 years old, and her husband, Mr. Longvanna Ven, is 28 years old. They live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2008 and have one son and one daughter. All of them are still young. 

Chandalis is a weaver. Her husband is a security guard. She is applying for a loan of $700 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Manuel Jesus

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Manuel Jesus; el tiene 54 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de animales menores como cuyes, chanchos y pollos, el socio lo vende en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de animales menores.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar animales menores como gallinas, chanchos y cuyes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sr. Manuel Jesus is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosita de Ayllupampa” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

He is 54 years old, married, and has two children. Manuel divides his time between his daily activities and his business of selling small animals such as guinea pigs, pigs, and chickens. He sells the animals at the market in Urubamba from 9am to 3pm. This business enables his children to get ahead. Manuel wants to expand and improve his business of selling small animals. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs.

Manuel is happy with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: To purchase chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Aniyali Amanyi Group

texts.en:
N. Rebecca, 36, has been engaged in a stone quarry business venture the last four years. Such a business requires an awful lot of elbow grease and most times many people associate it with only men. Rebecca, a mother to two, has however taken it upon herself to manifest that even women can succeed in a male-dominated business. She and her laborers operate from Kikonge in Mityana. 

She says she was introduced to this business by a close friend and she says she is able to make profits to the tune of 80,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) a week. She says with this loan she is going to purchase more hammers to be used in the quarry. At the time the photo was being taken, two group members were not present and are marked as unpictured. One other lady in the photo had her face a little bit obscured and is also marked as unpictured.

loans.use: to buy more hammers to be used in the quarry

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
César una hombre soltero de 36 años de edad que vive en una casa propia  ubicada en el  zona rural del distrito de Morrope, no cuenta  con los servicios de agua y luz; se encuentra a unos 40 minutos del distrito de Chiclayo.  Este distrito se caracteriza por que sus pobladores desarrollan la actividad de agricultura y ganadería

Desde hace varios años César se dedica a la compra, crianza y venta de animales (aves de corral), su corral lo tiene en la parte externa de su casa para mayor seguridad.  Sus aves de corral se venden rápido en los mercados que los ofrece por estar bien alimetadas y criadas con alimentos balanceados,  lo cual le permite a César aumentar sus ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades diarias.

Por lo mismo César a solicitado un préstamo  de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Aleternativa para poder seguir comprando animales (aves de corral) para criarlos y venderlos al por mayor y menor en los distintos mercados del distrito de Morrope, también lova utilizar para comprar alimentos balanceados para poder darles decomerbien a sus animales y  seguir incrementando sus ventas y de paso hacerse mas conicido en los distintos lugares que vende por tener un producto sano y de calidad.

César es conocido por los comerciantes de la zona y de los distintos mercados por ser un hombre honesto, trabajador y con muchas ganas de  mejorar en la vida.
texts.en:
Cesar is a single man, 36 years old, and he owns a house located in the rural region in the district of Morrope. He doesn't have running water or hydro. It is located about 40 minutes from the district of Chiclayo. This district is known for its population who are agriculturists and farmers.

Cesar has been in the business of raising and selling livestock (corral foul) for many years. His corral is located outside his house for greater security. His foul are sold quickly in the markets where he sells because they are well fed and raised with balanced feed. This will increase Cesar's income, used to cover his daily expenses. 

For this business, Cesar requests a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). He will be able to keep purchasing livestock (corral foul) to raise them and resell them in wholesale and retail at the various markets in the district of Morrope. He will also use it to purchase balanced feed to be able to feed his livestock properly and to keep increasing his sales. He will also become better known in the locations where he sells, especially for his healthy and good quality product.

Cesar is known by the merchants of the region and at the different markets for being an honest, hardworking man who is eager to improve his life.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and balanced feed.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old married man living with his wife and five young children. He has been working in the construction field for the past 24 years. His work is specialized in cleaning brick floors.  In parallel, he has worked as a taxi driver since 1986. His work consists in renting a car and transporting customers to their desired location.

 With his requested loan  of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will purchase a car to use rather than renting one in order to proceed with his business operation properly. He notes that with the car ownership he will be able to save money and save more time in serving customers.

loans.use: to purchase a car.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is from the village of Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 33 years old. Merlita is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Merlita sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Merlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Merlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Merlita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Merlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Benton

texts.en: Benton is a 27-year-old born-again Christian. He is single. To earn a living, he operates two retail shops. He has been operating the businesses for one and a half years. In addition, he runs a motorbike transport business to generate more income. Benton says that since he joined Faulu Kenya he has become financially stable and is currently operating two retail shops. In five years, he expects to have grown his business to another level. He has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to open a third retail shop.

loans.use: to open another retail shop

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria; la socia es casada La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras, la socia vende en el mercadillo de tica tica verduras, la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de verduras ella tiene un stand en el mercadillo y vende verduras, la socia requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de verduras al por mayor.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "IMASUMAC II" community bank; the bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Maria, who is married.  The member works buying and selling vegetables, she sells the vegetables in the street market of Tica Tica.   The member works buying and selling vegetables.  She has a stall at the street market where she sells vegetables.  The member requires the loan to invest in buying vegetables at wholesale.

The member is grateful for the support being granted to her, and similarly agrees to comply in a disciplined manner with her repayments.

loans.use: to be able to invest in purchasing vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Wanyange Tusubiira Women's Group

texts.en:
Business adversity invariably borrows its sharpest sting from most people's impatience. Impatience can spell doom for most businesses, especially if it's manifested from the threshold. This means it may most likely be somebody's second nature. That impatience, in most cases, stems from the desire to make profits hastily in a short spell of time. 

Harriet, a 46-year-old affable and high-spirited mother of five has always tried to steer clear of that bug that most people catch to make quick profits. From her perspective, patience in a desire to notch up something may be bitter, but the fruits will always be sweet. That, in essence, means she willingly and slowly takes all the bad and good experiences in stride and she knows that her fortitude in the face of all this, is the key to not only short term but also long term success.

Painstaking and unwavering diligence and tenaciousness have been her precepts in the course of the last two decades as she goes about her business trivial round-to with charcoal sales in Jinja.

Harriet is a happy go lucky lady who set forth in her business with savings from her erstwhile farming business. Prior to that, Harriet was at wits end, mostly doing house chores, as she had no job. Monthly, this business generates 120,000 Ugandan shillings. This Kiva loan, Harriet says, is to help her purchase more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with seven children. Five of the children attend school and two are underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Her major dream is to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 15,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is a single woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a beauty salon business in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Jorge Ivan

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 18 años vive en Cotacachi con sus padres. Jorge se considera una persona alegre, tranquilo y divertido con sus amigos.

Trabaja con su padre en la siembra de tomates de árbol y en la crianza de cerdos, en la siembra de tomates empezó hace 7 meses y los cerdos tiene desde que era niño.

Es la primera vez que trabaja con FODEMI, el préstamo que solicita es para la compra de abono por quintales para su tomate y también lo va a utilizar para la compra de cerdos.

Con esta inversión mejorará la calidad del tomate y podrá mejorar sus ingresos que le ayudará a terminar la casa de sus padres.

Su sueño es crecer económicamente para poder reingresar a los estudios ya que se retiró por falta de dinero.
texts.en:
Jorge is 18 and lives in Cotacachi with his parents. He is considered to be a happy, easygoing and entertaining person by his friends.

He works with his father planting tamarillos [tree tomatoes] and raising pigs. He began planting tamarillos 7 months ago but he has been raising pigs since he was a child.

This is the first time he has worked with FODEMI and he will use the loan to buy fertilizer by the quintales [units of weight equal to approximately 220 lbs or 100 kilograms] for the tamarillos and also to buy pigs.

With this investment, he will improve the quality of the tamarillos and will be able to increase his income, which will help to complete construction on his parent’s home.

His dream is for continued economic growth so that he will be able to go back to his studies since he had to leave school due to a lack of money.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for tree tomatoes and to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia nació en la provincia de Urubamba (Cusco, Perú), ella tiene 46 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades, ella tiene una cantina donde vende diferentes tipos de tragos y la pueden encontrar en el local a partir de las 4 de la tarde hasta altas horas de la noche, ella también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de pan de forma ambulatoria. 

Aurelia requiere el préstamo para comprar mesas para implementar su cantina. 
 
El Banco Comunal “Nueva Visión de Urubamba” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Urubamba (Cusco,  Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Aurelia was born in the province of Urubamba (Cusco, Peru). She is 46 and has a common-law marriage. From this relationship, she has five children. She currently lives in the same city where she was born and where she now works. She has a pub where she sells different kinds of drinks. She can be found in her pub after 4:00 pm until late at night. She also has a small business selling bread in street markets.

Aurelia needs this loan to purchase tables for setting up in her pub.

The “Nueva Visión de Urubamba” ["New Vision of Urubamba"] communal bank meets every month in the city of Urubamba (Cusco, Peru). Cusco is known for being a very touristy area, as well as being a commercial center. It is known for its traditional Inty Raymi festival and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to purchase tables for setting up in her pub.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena nació en el departamento del Cusco. Actualmente, María Elena tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. 

Maria Elena es abogada y desde hace 13 años que ejerce su profesión y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Maria Elena requiere el préstamo para implementar su oficina. Su Sueño de Maria Elena es sacar profesionales a sus hijos.  

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone IV” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Maria Elena was born in Cusco department.  She is 40 years old, married, and has three children from her marriage.

Maria Elena is a lawyer.  She has been working in her profession for 13 years and is doing very well.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to equip her office.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

The 'Comuzone IV' community bank meets once a month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is well known for being a very touristy, commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to equip her law office

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old. She is a married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She has a business of selling dried fish in Hai Mahad branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years. She can also earn some income from selling onions and tomatoes.

Rose requested this loan from BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the profits from this loan for paying the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for sale.

loans.name: Deisis Cristina

texts.es: Desis Cristina tiene su negocio que es una pulpería, desde hace más de 21 años. Uno de sus desafíos ha sido el no tener suficiente capital para comprar una variedad de productos. Inicio este negocio con ciertos ahorros que tenía fue así que logro comprar ciertos productos y poner vitrinas en su vivienda la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a comprar los productos del hogar como granos básicos, detergentes, pan, fósforos, galletas entre otros productos. Desis sueña con llegar a tener una gran pulpería y agrandar su inventario.
texts.en:
Deisis Cristina has had a small general store business for more than 21 years. One of her challenges has been not having sufficient working capital to buy a variety of products. 

She started this business with some savings that she had.  This is how she managed to buy products and install display cases in her home. The majority of her customers come to buy household products such as basic staples, detergents, bread, matches, cookies and other products. 

Deisis dreams about eventually having a large general store, and expanding her inventory.

loans.use: To buy basic staples, detergents, bread, matches, cookies and other products for her store.

loans.name: Yolly

texts.en:
Yolly works hard to support her family. Yolly is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Yolly has been in this business for seven years now.

Yolly requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

In the future, Yolly would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fishing net and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: G.s. Los Jinotepinos Group

texts.es: El señor Danny tiene 29 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos de 6 y 8 años respectivamente. El señor se dedica a la venta de ropa interior, chinelas y trucha, tiene un tramo localizado en el mercado. Su mayor desafío ha sido siempre hacer crecer su negocio lo más que se pueda. El señor inicio el negocio hace ya 4 años debido a la falta de empleo y buscando una propia fuente de trabajo para poder mantenerse él y su familia. Desea invertir este préstamo en el compa de mercadería en general ya que su negocio siempre va cambiando ya que compra lo que esta de auge de acuerdo a temporada. El señor Giovanny, El señor se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, calzado y artículos variados, vende de manera ambulante y en su casa de habitación, el tiene 3 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, inicio en negocio debido a la falta de empleo, buscando una fuente de cómo mantenerse y apoyar a su familia en los gastos familiares. El pretende invertir este crédito en la compra de ropa, calzado, cosméticos, sabanas y ropa interior.
texts.en:
Danny is 29 years old, married and has two children, 6 and 8 years old respectively. He works selling underwear, slippers and trout, and has a small area located in the market. His biggest challenge has been to increase his business as much as he can. He began the business four years ago because he didn’t have employment and was looking for his own source of work to so he could maintain himself and his family. He wants to use this loan to buy general merchandise since his business is always going to change in accordance to what are popular best sellers in the seasonal marketplace.

Giovanny sells new clothing, footwear and miscellaneous items, selling on the street and from his house. He has been in this business for 3 years. He began his business because he was out of a job, and looking for a source of income to maintain and help his family with the household expenses. He plans to spend the money from the loan buying clothing, footwear, cosmetics, sheets and underwear.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, cosmetics, sheets and underwear.

loans.name: Nurullo

texts.ru: Нурулло проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 57 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Нурулло предоставляет услугу. Он арендует помещение, где открыл парикмахерскую. В этой области он шесть лет. Кредит берет для приобретения необходимых инструментов и ремонта помещения.
texts.en:
Nurullo lives in the city of Kulob. He is 57 years old, married and has four children. Nurullo has been working in the service industry for six years. He rents a space were he has opened a barber shop. Nurullo needs to take out this loan to purchase tools and repair the facilities.

Нурулло проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 57 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Нурулло предоставляет услугу. Он арендует помещение, где открыл парикмахерскую. В этой области он шесть лет. Кредит берет для приобретения необходимых инструментов и ремонта помещения.

loans.use: to purchase necessary tools and repair the facilities

loans.name: Bibizar

texts.ru: Бибизар занимается растениеводством. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Ее муж тоже занимается растениеводством, он в основном занимается посевом зерновых культур. Сама Бибизар одиннадцать лет как занимается выращиванием овощей и посевом пшеницы. Она берет кредит для посева озимой пшеницы.
texts.en: Bibizar is involved in agriculture.  She is 50 years old, married and has six children.  Her husband is also involved in agriculture and primarily sows cereal crops.  Bibizar has been involved in growing vegetables and sowing wheat for eleven years.  She is requesting this loan for sowing winter wheat.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa de 40 años, convive hace 8 años con Bernabé, su pareja, con quién tiene 3 hijos de 18, 17 y 5 años. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad de Pueblo Pardo, en el distrito de Chanchamayo. Como mujer trabajadora que es, Elsa labora todos los días en el campo. En sus terrenos propios de cultivo siembra: carambolas, naranjas, tanyarinas, etc., en esta ardua actividad la apoyan su pareja e hijos mayores. 
“La carambola es un fruto rentable. La ventaja es que sale todo el año, en cualquier mes y su precio es estable casi siempre. La java cuesta de 7 a 8 soles. Si me conviene”, señala. Así también se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de naranjas. Dos veces a la semana lleva su mercadería a la ciudad de Villa Rica, y la expende al menudeo, de manera ambulante o haciendo reparticiones a sus clientes conocidos. “Llevo como 14 años en este negocio”, menciona. Elsa es visionaria. Unos años más adelante piensa construir su casa en la ciudad de La Merced, donde tiene un terreno, de esa forma brindará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Sería el préstamo número 7 que obtendría de MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Del mismo modo, continuará firme y constante en el trabajo dentro de su banco comunal, pues sabe que en equipo podrá lograr mejores resultados.
De obtener el dinero, Elsa comprará naranjas al por mayor para venderlas en Villa Rica. “El negocio no para”, puntualiza.
texts.en: Elsa is 40 years old. For the past eight years she has lived with Barnabé. She has three children with him, ages 18, 17 and 5. This family lives in their own house in the Pueblo Pardo Community in the Chanchamayo District. Elsa is a hardworking woman that works every day in the countryside. On their own land they grow star fruit, oranges, tangerines, etc. This arduous activity helps support this couple and their children. The star fruit is a profitable crop. The advantage is that it ripens all year long, in all months, and the price for the fruit is almost always stable. The fruit costs seven or eight soles. They also buy and sell oranges. Two times a week they bring their merchandise to market in the city of Villa Rica. They sell their products retail by foot or they distribute their merchandise to their established clientele. They have been doing this business for the past fourteen years. Elsa is a visionary. In the future she would like to build a house in La Merced City, where they own land. By doing this they will provide their family with a better quality of life. This is the seventh loan she has requested from MFP. She gives her word that she will be punctual with her payments. In the same way, she has been a stable and consistent member of the community bank. She knows that as a member of a team, she can achieve better results. In order to earn money, Elsa will buy oranges wholesale and sell them in Villa Rica.

loans.use: to buy sacks of oranges.

loans.name: Nalangu

texts.en:
Nalangu, a married woman with five children who depend on her, has been farming for a period of seven years, growing maize and selling part of each harvest to earn income.

Having learned about KADET through other women in the area, Nalangu is currently applying for her third loan in order to buy farm supplies such as wheat seeds and fertilizers and to hire labor for the farm. In the long term she hopes to grow a variety of crops and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as wheat seeds.

loans.name: Arbana

texts.en: Beside Araba are drums of palm oil she distribute to retails to sell. She also sells kenkey (fried corn dough) at Efutu. Araba has been into this business for the past 15 years now. She is married to a farmer and has 7  dependents. Araba uses her income to assits the husband to feed their family. Because she sells the oil in large quantiites, she willl need this loan to get more oil from the extrators to sell. With the new profit, Araba will purchase machines to extract the oil herself.

loans.use: buy more oil  from the  oil extractors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy oranges, bananas, and mangoes for sale.

loans.name: Gehobanis Antonio

texts.es:
Gehobanis de 32 años,  es una persona acompañada, ha procreado tres hijos y realizo sus estudios hasta  bachillerato en la ciudad.

 Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa e hijos, quienes asisten a la escuela y dependen de las actividades que realiza.  Èl se dedica a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres.  Para llegar a la parcelas camina 1.5 Km y trabaja durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar las vacas que posee; en la  la noche se dedica a cuidar una finca

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una yunta de bueyes, que necesita para poder arar la tierra donde cultiva y obtener un ingreso adicional por arar otras parcelas, lo que le ayudara a mantener a su familia.

Espera  en un futuro, construir una vivienda digna, para su familia ya que actualmente vive en una de adobe.

loans.use: para comprar una yunta de bueyes, que necesita para poder arar la tierra donde cultiva.

loans.name: Nafissatou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone. La représentante du groupe, nommée Nafissatou  (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 40 ans n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Nafissatou est mariée à un couturier brodeur du nom de Mohamed. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Nafissatou vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. C’est pour cette raison, Nafissatou vend des savons du ghana depuis une vingtaine d’année. Nafissatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Nafissatou ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicite pour une deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des savons.

loans.name: Ubaldo

texts.es: Ubaldo es un hombre trabajador de 38 años que vive junto a su pareja en la localidad rural de Talamolle, que está ubicada en Moquegua. Él se ha dedicado por más de 11 años a la agricultura y a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar vacas orgánicas, espera poder vender su leche a un mejor precio por ser orgánica. En el futuro desea poder contar con mayor cantidad de ganado para incrementar su producción de leche y así mejorar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Para adquirir vacas orgánicas para vender la leche que producen y así incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar su vivienda

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 34 years old and married with one children.  With one children in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, can goods, egg, soft drinks, bread, etc.

Josephine has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as . 

In the future Josephine would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, can goods, egg, soft drinks, bread, etc

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir has been engaged in the selling of food for the past six years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region, relocated to Sumgait city. He is 54 years old and has three children. He owns a small shop where he sells various food products. He borrowed a loan of $400 from Normicro so he could buy new scales and to repair his shop. 
Now Tahir wants a loan for $600 to increase his assortment of fruits.

loans.use: To increase his assortment of fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mosompa intends to buy three steers

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
Massan L. is married and the mother of three. She was born on September 12, 1974 in Amégnran (Vo prefecture). A seamstress by training, she covers more than half of all household expenses because her husband lacks a steady job. Thanks to her courage and dedication, she has so far benefited from a $400 loan for initiating a business selling "pagnes", which are colorful traditional-style cloths typically used as sarongs. She figured out how to manage and repay this loan promptly.

The current loan of $1,000 that she is requesting will be entirely dedicated to selling pagnes, which she can even acquire abroad. This will allow her to make her business profitable and especially to improve the conditions in which her family exists.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, Madame L. Massan est née le 12 septembre 1974 à Amégnran dans la préfecture de Vo. Couturière de formation, elle supporte plus de la moitié des charges de la famille car son mari n’a pas un emploi fixe. Grâce à son courage et à son dévouement, elle a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit de $400 pour initier le commerce de pagnes, crédit qu’elle a su bien gérer et rembourser promptement.

Le présent crédit de $1000 qu’elle sollicite sera entièrement consacré à la vente de pagnes, qu’elle pourra même acheter à l’extérieur du pays. Ceci va lui permettre de rentabiliser ses affaires et surtout d’améliorer les conditions d’existence de la famille.

loans.use: Acquiring pagne cloth to sell

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr:
Mr. Yaovi K. is a 33-year-old married father of seven children. With only a secondary-school education, he left school very early to work in agriculture. Recognized as the principal producer of pineapples in his village, he has enough revenue to cover household expenses. His wife assists him in his work. Over the last few years, Mr. K. has been able to acquire new clients. Demand has grown greatly, and he is seeking a loan of $1000 to buy fertilizer to increase the fertility of his soil. The revenue from the sale of his products will allow him to improve his family’s living conditions from a nutritional, educational and health standpoint.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 33 ans, Monsieur K. Yaovi est aujourd’hui marié et père de sept (7) enfants. Instruit de niveau secondaire, il cessa très tôt les études pour le travail agricole. Reconnu comme le principal producteur d’ananas dans son village, il arrive à subvenir aux charges du ménage à partir de ce revenu. Sa femme l’aide dans ses travaux. Au cours de ces dernières années, Monsieur K. Yaovi a réussi à découvrir d’autres clients. La demande étant devenue très élevée, il sollicite ce crédit de $1000 pour s’acheter de l’engrais afin de rendre ses sols plus fertiles. Après la vente, les revenus lui serviront à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille sur les plans alimentaire, éducatif et sanitaire.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Eduardo Alonzo

texts.es:
Eduardo is married and works as a taxi driver. His wife is a homemaker who takes care of their two children. He began working as a taxi driver due to the difficulty he had finding a job because of high rates of unemployment and because of his age, which complicated the situation even more. As a result, he decided to become self-employed so he could support his family.

6 years ago, he began driving a taxi by renting a car and now, he already has his own vehicle. The car is in use 24 hours a day because at night, he also rents it to a man that uses it for special jobs and long trips.

Eduardo is asking for a loan of $375 for the maintenance of his car. He is offering to pay back the loan within 5 months.

He is very grateful for your support so he can continue working and growing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Eduardo esta casado y trabaja como taxista, su esposa se dedica al hogar, al cuidado de sus dos hijos, él empezó con esta actividad debido a que existía mucho desempleo y por su edad se complicaba más la situación, por ello decidió trabajar como taxi y por su cuenta y así poder mantener a su familia. Hace 6 años empezó rentando un carro y ahora ya tiene su propio vehículo y lo trabaja las 24 horas, ya que el turno de noches el lo renta a un señor para que lo trabaje y a veces le salen trabajos especiales o viajes largos.

Eduardo esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 375 para mantenimiento de su carro y ofrece pagar el pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. Él te agradece mucho el apoyo que le das para poder continuar con su trabajo y poder crecer con el mismo.

loans.use: Maintenance of taxi.

loans.name: Vary

texts.en:
Mrs. U. Vary is 39 years old, and she and her husband married in 1990. They have four children, all of whom are in school studying in grades 3-9. They live in a fertile farming area along the Tonle Bassac (river), a tributary of the Mekong, several kilometers south of Phnom Penh. She is requesting this first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $800. She will use this loan to purchase a contract for the future harvest of two banana farms in her village. In 3 to 4 months she will sell them at a price higher than the agreed-upon price she pays today.

She has been farming since she was a teenager and buying and selling bananas for more than 15 years. Many people of Chinese descent live in Cambodia. During the celebration of Chinese New Year, bananas are used as a traditional offering and the price increases greatly. Vary also grows jasmine for use in Buddhist ceremonies and longan, a fruit similar to lychee. She sells these to retailers at one of the large markets in Phnom Penh.

Vary’s long-term hopes are to keep growing her business. She explained that the loan will allow her to buy a greater number of banana contracts for future sale, allowing her to make more income. As is typical in Cambodia, she plans to use any extra income to help her children continue their studies.

loans.use: To buy a contract to purchase banana tree output from two village plots now at a specified price.  She will harvest in 3-4 months and sell the bananas at the future market rate.

loans.name: Choy

texts.en: Mr. Choy S., 40, is married with four children. He works on his piece of land raising pigs, earning on average about $5.30/day in revenue. His wife is employed at a garment factory making around $2.3/day of income. Three of his children are enrolled in school and another one is employed in Phnom Penh city, giving  his family $50 per month. Additionally, Mr. Choy hopes to use this loan to purchase rice crops to stock in his inventory, waiting for the price to increase at which point he will sell them for a good profit.

loans.use: To purchase rice crops to stock in his inventory, waiting for the price to go up at which point he will sell them for a good profit.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị T., 37 years old, is a member of the TYM Fund, Kim Động branch 4. She lives with her husband and 3 school age children in Phú Cường, Hưng Yên province. They sell construction material and have been in this business for 15 years now. They build enough good reputation that their shop is always busy with customers. The monthly income of the shop is about 240USD. She would like to take out a loan of 950USD to buy more goods.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị T., 37 tuổi, là thành viên Quỹ Tình thương chi nhánh 4 Kim Động. Chị sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại xã Phú Cường, Hưng Yên. Cả 3 cháu nhà chị T. đều đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Kinh doanh nguyên vật liệu là công việc chính của 2 vợ chồng chị. Anh chị làm công việc này được 15 năm. Cửa hàng chuyên bán buôn bán lẻ các loại nguyên vật liệu dùng cho xây dựng. Do buôn bán giữ uy tín nên người dân trong xã khi có nhu cầu đều đến cửa hàng của chị T.. T. nhập bình quân 1 tháng từ cửa hàng là 240USD. Chị T. muốn vay mức vốn là 950USD để mua thêm nguyên vật liệu về bán.

loans.use: Buy building materials

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Greetings from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Eva K. is 40 years old. She is single and has three children, who are ages 13, 17, and 20.

In 2005, Eva established a general store. Working 5 to 8 hours a day, seven days a week, and assisted by her niece, she earns about $210 per month from this business. Eva has already received and successfully repaid three loans from SELFINA. She now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of sugar, oil, rice, cloth, and sarongs. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $35.

About SELFINA SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of rice, oil, sugar, cloth, and sarongs for her general store

loans.name: Angela Pilar

texts.es:
Senora Angela is part of the group "Women and Children of Jesus." She is dedicated to the sale of footwear and food at the entrance to the EsSalud public hospital in the city of Huaraz.

With a loan of $125, (300 PEN), that will be recieved in 4 payments, she will buy 1 sack of rice and 3 pairs of children's shoes.

She is 21 years old and single. She works hard with the goal of one day opening up her own small restaurant in her house with her parents.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

La señora Angela, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres Niño Jesús, se dedica a la venta de alimentos y calzados, en la puerta de Essalud (Seguro Social) Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará, 1 saco de arroz y 3 pares de zapatos para niños. Ella tiene 21 años de edad, soltera trabaja con mucho con la esperaza de abrir un pequeño restaurante en la casa de sus padres.

loans.use: To buy materials to prepare products.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is a small entrepreneur from Kharkov. She started a venture selling footwear at the Barabashova market seven years ago. She usually purchases inventory wholesale from a Chinese factory. Presently, Yelena’s turnover capital is about $9000, and her monthly net profit is about $1500. 

Yelena is requesting a loan to increase her selection of merchandise for the coming summer season which will help her respond to customer demand. Because her clientele is continuously growing, she hopes to open a new vending spot and further develop her trade.  At this stage in her business development, it is important for Yelena to offer a wide variety of items in order to establish a good reputation and attract more customers. This loan will enable her to continue building a solid foundation for her business so that it will be successful for many years to come.

loans.use: To purchase a new vending location and additional seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Tran Thi H., 31 years old, currently live with her husband (34 years old) and two young children. Her family main sources of income are farming and raising pigs. During the 4 years participating in TYM, Ms H.'s loans have always been used to buy fertilizers and food-stuff for her pigs. Her husband is a construction workers and has stable income so she has never had problem repaying the loans. During this time, the weather is not cooperating and her family is having a lot of trouble with the crops as prices of fertilizers are also going up. Ms. H. need to borrow more money to buy fertilizers in time for the harvesting season. She also would like some additional money to buy more foodstuff and pigs. During this cycle, she decide to ask for a loan of 575USD

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Hà năm nay 31 tuổi còn chồng chị 34 tuổi. Hai anh chị có 2 con đang còn nhỏ. Gia đình không có nghề phụ, thu nhập chính là từ làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Tham gia được 4 năm, vốn vay được chị Hà sử dụng chủ yếu mua phân bón và chăn nuôi lợn. Chồng đi làm thợ xây, thu nhập tương đối ổn định nên việc hoàn trả tuần không gặp khó khăn. Đồng vốn vay luôn được sử dụng đúng mục đích nên kinh tế phát triển rất tốt. Hiện nay thời tiết khắc nghiệt, lúa chết, giá phân bón lại tăng lên, để kịp thời mùa vụ chị Hà quyết định vay vốn để mua phân bón, phần còn lại đầu tư chăn nuôi. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị Hà là 575USD.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pigs

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
Sharofat Z. is a 62 year old woman, who is a widow and has 4 children. Thanks to her work, she has supported her 4 dear children and their home, and now all of her children are independent. Sharofat is a farmer, and she plants crops like wheat, potato, carrot and other vegetables on her land. She also raises cattle, which she buys as calves at the market for a low price. She then feeds and raises them to then resell at the same market for a more profitable price. Her younger son helps her with the business. As a rule, Sharofat and her son grow enough crops for the family's consumption and also for selling.

By applying to IMON for a loan, Sharofat hopes to produce a rich yield that she will sell at the market at prices attractive to the population. She is requesting US$850, and she plans to purchase fertilizer and create better conditions for the cattle. This woman has a lot of courage and the strength to live.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, and maintain the cattle.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr:
Born in 1977, Mrs. Ami K. is a farm worker who loves growing corn. The mother of two children, she is able to contribute toward the household expenses thanks to her earnings. She is very attached to growing corn, which is of major importance to their everyday diet and is a source of income for them. A real go-getter, she manages her business activities very well, and is requesting financing to enable her to increase the area she cultivates and therefore her income. In this way she will have sufficient means to make a greater contribution toward improving the family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1977, Madame K. Ami est une cultivatrice qui aime la culture du maïs. Mère de deux (2) enfants, elle arrive à contribuer aux charges du ménage grâce à ses revenus. Elle est très attachée à la culture du maïs qui a une importance capitale dans leur habitude alimentaire et est source de revenu dans le milieu. Très battante, elle gère bien ses activités et sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre d’augmenter sa superficie cultivée et de facto augmenter ses revenus. Ainsi, elle pourra avoir les moyens suffisants pour plus contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To increase the size of her cultivable land

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria Teresa is 33 years old and married. She works as a teacher and administrator of the Colegio San Pablo, a private center, with 5 years of service. She has 3 daughters: 15 , 8, and 2 years old, respectively. One of them is a Senior in high school and the 2 year old girl is taken care by someone she employs as a caretaker. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. daily. She is asking for her second loan which she will use to make an addition to the back of her home to be more comfortable and add space to her house. Presently, she is by herself since her husband is in the United States and sends her a monthly stipend to help out with the family's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramreiz-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La profesora María Teresa es casada, de 33 años de edad, trabaja como administradora del Colegio San Pablo, centro privado, con 5 años de servicio, tiene 3 hijas de 15, 8 y 2 años, 1 estudia el 4to año de secundaria, la niña de 2 años no estudia la cuida una empleada; los turnos de trabajo son de 8:00am a 5:00 pm. Está solicitando su 2do crédito el que utilizará para la construcción de un anexo al fondo de su vivienda para dar mas comodidad y espacio a su casa, en estos momentos se encuentran sola, ya que su esposo está en EE.UU quien le envia remesa mensual para que pueda salir adelante con sus hijas.

loans.use: Construction of a small addition to the house to place a washer.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy es una muchacha muy trabajadora y perseverante de 21 años de edad, a pesar de su condición de mujer, viene incursionando en  el oficio de carpintera, en un principio muchos desconfiaban de su  trabajo y hasta obtuvo malas críticas, pero afortunadamente con su empeño, diligencia y mucha voluntad aprendió rápidamente los trucos  y aplicaciones para un perfecto acabado en las obras de este oficio.En estos momentos, está logrando incrementar sus solicitudes, pero  aun no cuenta con suficientes herramientas  de trabajo, es con ese fin presenta esta solicitud de préstamo.
texts.en:
Nancy is a very hardworking and perserverent 21 year old women. Despite being a woman, she finds herself as a carpenter. In the beginning, a lot didn't trust her work and she received bad criticisms, but fortunately with her work, diligence and much goodwill she quickly learned the tricks and applications for perfectly finishing the works of this trade. These days, she has been able to increase her requests, but they don't come with sufficient work tools, and it's with this end that she's asking for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquiring the necessary tools for her work as a carpenter

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
K. Sharofat is a very responsible and hard-working woman. She is married and has 3 adorable children. Three years ago, she started offering her services as a seamstress to her neighbors and acquaintances. She has a sewing machine at her house where she produces national dresses for women. Now her daughter is grown up and helps her mother with her business, but unfortunately they have only one sewing machine.

Sharofat wants to purchase another sewing machine in order to expand her business. That is the reason she is asking for a loan of 1800 Somoni ($550). She plans to buy an additional sewing machine to increase her production and meet her customers' requests. She promises to repay the loan in 6 months.

From money she earns from the additional sales, she wants to fix the house and pay for her children’s education. Help this family with improving the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Sharofat’s business. They will sincerely thank you for it.

loans.use: Purchasing another sewing machine for sewing women national dresses

loans.name: Sojida

texts.en:
Sojida A.  is a 48 year old married woman with 4 children. She owns a specialized fabrics store at the central market in Dushanbe city. Sojida works in an area of trade where the demand is very consistent and high. She is one of the leading fabric vendors for national dresses in Tajikistan which are a very popular and very important item of the dowry of any girl. Sojida is very skilled entrepreneur and is determined in all of her business endeavors, which has helped to sustain her venture for 4 years. 

In order to continue the growth of her business, Sojida is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni ($1200 USD) for a term of  9 months. The loan will be used to increase her assorted inventory and possibly open a new vending location. One of her personal goals is to generate additional profit so that she can remodel a new apartment she recently bought for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics for her inventory.

loans.name: Las Rositas Group

texts.en: Sandra A. is a perfect example of the effects of micro-credit. Sandra came to Esperanza International with no income and three kids to feed with her husband's tiny income. She came hoping to receive a loan and start her own business. She received a small loan of 5,000 pesos which is approximately 150 USD. She took that loan and started a small business selling used clothing. Due to her hard work, she increased her business and paid back the loan in its entirety. Today she is hoping to receive her fifth loan for 18,000 pesos (or about 530 USD). Sandra is now able to provide for her children and put them through school. She said that she is happy for the first time and feels like she has something of her own and something to wake up for each day. She is excited about the future, and feels like this next loan will just continue to grow her business. She is very grateful for this opportunity and challenge.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Ramón tiene 26 años, esta casado y tiene 1 hijo, posee una despensa anexo mercería, se inicio en esta actividad hace mas de 7 años, como todo inicio fue difícil ya que empezó con un pequeño capital, producto de unos préstamos que le realizo unos parientes con ese capital se inicio y actualmente su despensa lo tiene en un barrio muy populoso de la ciudad de Caacupé. 
Los préstamos que le otorgo la Fundación Paraguaya pudo surtir su negocio con la compra de mercaderías y en esta ocasión desea volver a aumentar su stock de mercaderías ya que la demanda aumenta en las épocas de fin de año. Entre las mercaderías que desea adquirir están pan, azúcar, leche, carne, carbón, gaseosas, fideos,  y también artículos de mercería como ser ropas, productos de bellezas, útiles escolares entre otros. 
Su principal logro dice ser el hecho de sacrificarse y haber perseverado en su objetivo de contar con un negocio propio que le permite  ayudar y mantener los gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
Ramón is 26-years old, married with 1 son, and owns a storeroom attached to a general store that he set up more than 7 years ago. Like many small businesses, it was difficult to start. With a little money borrowed from relatives, he began his storeroom in a densely populated neighborhood in Caacupé city. Loans from Fundación Paraguaya have enabled Ramón to purchase merchandise for his store. To meet the heightened demand at the end of the year, he would like to restock his inventory with bread, sugar, milk, meat, coal, sodas, pasta, and other items such as clothes, beauty products, and school supplies. His greatest achievement has been persevering and making the sacrifices necessary for his business, which allows him to provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for store (milk, bread, tea, cheese, eggs, cornstarch, oil, flour, sugar, soda, etc.)

loans.name: Yatimy

texts.ru: Ятими Бердизод проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 37 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Образование среднее. Имеет свой бизнес. Привозит из Пакистана калоши .Продает оптом и в розницу жителям своего кишлака. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Yatimy B. lives in the Shahrinaw district. He is 37 years old, married, and has four children. He has a high school education. He has his own business, importing galoshes from Pakistan. He buys wholesale and sells retail to residents of his town. He decided to request a loan in order to increase his sales volume. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales Volume

loans.name: Valida

texts.en:
Valida M. is a 47-year-old woman who breeds cattle in the small village of Imishli. She started her business more than ten years ago and now has three cattle. She purchases calves in the local livestock bazaar and fattens them up for sale. After several months, she sells them to local people or to the restaurants.

Valida is married and has 3 children. She is proud that her children help with the business, but she's more interested in their future. Valida dreams of providing her children with a high-quality education.

Valida would like to expand her business and purchase two more calves, so she has applied for a 1200 USD loan for the term of 15 months. Valida is counting on your helping hand.

loans.use: Purchase 2 calves

loans.name: Merman Rohaba Group

texts.en:
Merman Rohaba is the group leader of the Merman Rohaba group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to receive a loan for his/her own business.

Nelofar and Mahboba want to take a loan for their tailoring businesses to purchase more materials for their businesses. Merman Rohaba wants to take a loan for her son’s business driving a taxi. S. Ahmadsha wants to take a loan for his tailoring business; he will buy three new machines for his business. They all want to buy necessary materials for their businesses.

They want to say this loan is very useful because this loan can provide a good chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses and become stronger in their businesses and lives. This group wants to thank all involved in this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials for their businesses

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en: Agartha F. sells provisions in Cape Coast. Agartha has received a junior high school education and she is married with 4 children Her husband is employed as a petty trader.  Agartha has been selling provisions since 2003. She is responsible for paying rent, utilities, food, and other necessary items. Her loan will be used to buy more goods in order to fill the store. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to put up a building.

loans.use: to buy more goods in order to fill the store

loans.name: Bozorjon

texts.ru: Бозорчон - женщина 50 лет. Замужем и имеет 5-х детей. Занимается откормом скота и переработкой шерсти. Её муж занимается перепродажей скота на скотном рынке. Сыновья помогают отцу, а дочки и невестка помогают Бозорчон. Когда ее муж сострижёт овец и коз, а это бывает в летнее время, Бозорчон берет всю шерсть, и перерабатывает ее, потом везет на рынок и продает их вязальщицам. Она заинтересована в покупке скота.
texts.en:
Bozorjon is a 50 year old woman. She is married and has 5 children. She raises livestock and processes wool. Her husband resells livestock at the livestock market. Her sons help their father and the daughters and daughter-in-law help Bozorjon. When her husband shaves the sheep and goats, which occurs in the summer, Bozorjon takes all the wool and processes it, then she takes it to the market and sells it to knitters. She is interested in purchasing livestock.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. is a trader selling earrings and necklaces in Elmina, which she has done since 2006.  She is divorced with 2 children and has received an education through Primary School.  She is responsible for paying her children’s school fees and also her family’s bills. Her loan will be used to purchase more jewelry for re-sale, and she hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and build a house.

loans.use: purchase more jewellery for re-sale

loans.name: Mavdjuda

texts.en: Ten years ago, Mavdjuda started her women's clothing business. Experienced and talented in the business, she has expanded her business into a successful trade, supporting her family of three children. Throughout the last year, IMON International has provided assistance to Mavdjuda’s business through microfinance loans. Committed to growth and successful entrepreneurship, Mavdjuda has used her previous loan wisely and has repaid each with a perfect credit history. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 5,000 Somoni to replace her depleted inventory, hoping to continue expanding her business and support her family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for women and teenagers

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en: Nadir T. is married and has three children. His family lives in the city of Agsu, where Nadir runs a small downtown grocery store. Nadir 's store is well-known in the neighborhood because he serves his customers well and works late hours, which is very convenient for those who work late and go shopping after they get off work. Nadir has been in business for eighteen years. Currently he is seeking a loan to purchase more inventory in order to increase the variety of goods he offers. Nadir had some struggles at first when his business was growing and becoming self-sustainable, but he handled all these challenges well and is looking toward the future with much enthusiasm and optimism.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods in his store

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio A. is currently in the business of selling beer at home and is requesting a loan to open up a bar. Julio is 42 years old and is married to a husband who is a security guard. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a bar

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en:
I. Anvar is a hard-working entrepreneur from Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He has operated his own car repair business for the past three years. Anvar has extensive experience in this field and his skills are very much in demand. Car ownership is increasing rapidly in Tajikistan, which means more business for repair technicians like Anvar. Anvar works hard to earn a good income and support his family. He and his wife have two children. Anvar has requested a short-term loan of 2000 Somoni to buy some tools that he needs for his business. The income from this loan will help him pay for the schooling expenses for his children. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase tools and spare parts used to repair cars

loans.name: Miriam Margot

texts.es:
Miriam es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchariy que significa Despierta en quechua.
Miriam es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Miriam vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria en el parque y en la puerta de las discotecas, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Miriam vende ropa a pedido en la selva ayacuchana.
Miriam necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos y golosinas.
Los sueños de Miriam son tener una tienda de ropa y tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Miriam belongs to Rikchariy Communal Bank. Rikchariy means "awake" in Quechua. Miriam lives with her life partner, is 25 years old, and has two children. Miriam sells candy by traveling sales, in the park and at the doors to shops/clubs. In addition to doing this every day, Miriam also sells cloths by order in the Ayacuchana jungle. Miriam needs a loan of S./2100 to buy popsicles and candy. Miriam dreams of having a clothing store, and her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying popsicles and candy

loans.name: Mekobaun A2 Group

texts.en:
Mekobaun A2 Group is a group of eight farmers in Bokong Village, Taebenu Subdistrict - Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara Province. Bokong Village is situated about 27 km and a two-hour drive from Kupang City. The community in this village, including the group members, leans on agricultural products to support their family lives. They also depend on animal husbandry (pigs, chickens and cows) when meeting family needs for a particular moment (e.g. they could sell their livestock to pay a child’s education fees or when one of their family members is unwell).

Most of community in Bokong Village has a background in farming. They usually sell their agricultural products, such as bananas, coconuts and beans, at Inpres Market. The challenge that the community faces in running their businesses is the lack of public transport to reach Inpres market as it only available three days a week, whereas the local market in this area only operates on Tuesdays. 

Mekobaun A2 Group is led by Petrus A., a 60-year-old farmer. Petrus is respected by the group members as he has the ability to lead and also has constructive thoughts. He was born and grew up in Bokong Village. He is married to Agustin and they have five children: Jumlina A., who is 33, graduated from University and married; Sarce, who is 29 and working in Malaysia; Becy A., who is 26 and a senior high school graduate who spends her days helping her parents on the farm; Julianus A., who is a 24-year-old junior high school graduate and motorcycle taxi driver; and Welem A. , who is 22 and in the third semester of the university.

In order to fulfill his family's daily needs, Petrus plants cassavas, corns, bananas and beans. His family is relying on the agricultural products and this is the reason why Petrus should work hard. Currently, Petrus has to finance Welem’s education at the university. Petrus also raises pigs and goats to be sold so he can pay his son’s education fees. Petrus' wife, Agustin, also helps him to generate more income by weaving cloth to be sold but the income generated by Petrus and Agustin is not enough to meet their family's needs.     

Petrus got information that TLM Foundation provides loans to assist poor farmers like him. Together with the other community members who are interested in joining the program, they formed a group to receive a loan so they can buy young cattle to be fattened over a 12-month period. Petrus is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 3,400,000 from TLM to buy young cattle. The other group members are also requesting a loan to buy young cattle. They hope the profits that will be generated in the future will help them in improving their living standard and providing a better future for their children.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice sells provisions and food. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is 41, married and has 5 children. She has been in the business for the past 4 years. She is requesting a loan of N50, 000 to purchase more foodstuff and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food to sell

loans.name: Precious

texts.en: Precious is a mother of a child and she is 28 years old. She sells electronics at Alaba International market in Lagos state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for long. She hopes for the loan amount of N160, 000 to purchase more electronics to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Benardine

texts.en:
Benardine O. is 34 years old and a mother of two children. She is a wife, a teacher and a business woman at the same time.

She used to own a small retail shop which she closed because it was not giving back. She then ventured into opening a maize mill and realized there was a great demand for maize. This is the reason she finally ventured into cereals business with specialization in maize.

Benardine needs a loan of Kshs. 20,000 to increase the stock of maize and increase her capital base. She restocks twice a week and her wish is to one day open a larger store and widen her market as far as the capital city of Kenya, Nairobi.

loans.use: INCREASE STOCK.

loans.name: Mohammad Rahoof

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is Mohammad Rahoof the son of A. M.. He is 40, married, and the father of five children: three sons and two daughters. His youngest son is a first year college student and the others are students at school.

A. Rahoof owns a small retail shop and has the responsibility of paying for all the household expenses. Besides that, he has to pay the school fees and expenses of his children.

A. Rahoof has taken the decision to construct a new house because, after coming from Pakistan, they live in a rental house and that is really difficult for them to pay 5,000 Afghani which equals approximately 100 American dollars.

When he was informed about the loan process that is supporting the people, A. Rahoof came to AFS and requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to purchase the essential construction materials to solve his problem.

A. Rahoof would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders that support the people around the world through their effective process.

loans.use: To purchasing construction materials to build his house

loans.name: Shine In Allah Group

texts.en: Mariama is forty three years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Mariama is a trader. She trades in cereals. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Shine in Allah. Most of the group members are traders. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Mariama is second from the right in the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy supplies of cereal for resale

loans.name: Simao Israel

texts.pt:
Simão Israel M. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, tem 33 anos de idade, casado e pai de 6 filhos de 15, 12, 9, 6, 4 e 2 anos de idade, destes 4 vão a escola. Fez somente 5ª classe, não continuou por falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais. Vive na casa própria em Boane com a sua família e sustenta sua mãe, enviando dinheiro.

Saiu de Boane para Suazilândia, a procura de emprego, depois de varias dificuldades enfrentadas, decidiu voltar a Moçambique 2 anos depois. Actualmente tem um campo agrícola e conta com 4 trabalhadores, produzem e vendem Hortícolas (feijão verde e repolho) juntos com a sua esposa. Desenvolve esta actividade desde o ano de 2002 e  rende trimestralmente cerca de 45.000.00mt, poupa algum na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhos que também são clientes da mesma instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 30.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar insumos e pagar jornas de trabalho para produção de hortícolas (batata, pimento, pepino e outras) como forma de satisfazer a sua clientela. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 12.000.00mt, 16.000.00mt e 20.000.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade.

Futuramente pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para poder aumentar a área de cultivo e introduzir novas culturas, por isso compromete se a pagar bem este empréstimo também.
texts.en:
Simão Israel M. was born in the District of Boane in the province of Maputo. He is 33; married; and the father of 6 children who are 15, 12, 9, 6, 4, and 2. Of these, 4 of them are in school. He only studied through 5th grade and didn't continue due to his parents' lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home in Boane with his family and supports his mother by sending her money. He left Boane for Swaziland to look for a job. After facing several difficulties, he decided to return to Mozambique 2 years later. He currently has some farmland and has 4 workers. He grows and sells vegetables (green beans and cabbage) along with his wife. He has done this activity since 2002 and makes about 45,000 meticais a quarter and saves some in his bank account. He has never had a loan with another bank. He became familiar with Hluvuku through neighbors who are also clients of the same institution. This is his 4th loan and it is for 30,000 meticais. He will use it to buy supplies and to pay his workers to produce vegetables (potatoes, peppers, cucumbers, etc) as a way to satisfy his customers. His previous loans were for 12,000, 16,000, and 20,000 meticais, and they were all used for the same purpose. In the future he hopes to request more loans to be able to increase his farmland and introduce new crops. This is why he promises to pay back his loan on time.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To produce vegetables and grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding and to buy fertilizer for the soil

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en: Altangerel is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house in Uvurkhangai province, Mongolia. His children, aged six and two, are in kindergarten.  Altangerel operates a tire repair and sales business in his town. He started his business in 2006 after conducting a raw materials trading business for several years. At first he conducted only the tire repair business but after two years of stable business growth, he expanded into tire sales in 2008. In a short amount of time he has gained much experience in his business and has built a strong customer base. His profits have allowed him to buy a new house and a yard for his family. Altangerel is a hard-working man and has a good personality. For the future, he has many plans to expand his business. He hopes to expand his tire selection and says, “I am also planning to have my own auto repair shop in the future. It is important because I must save for my children's future." Altangerel is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase tires and tire products for his business.

loans.use: To purchase tires and tire products for his business

loans.name: Bujjutabi Development Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
